commentary.comment: Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) and Anthony Martial combine well with a quick one-two and their attacking move continues.
Goal! Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:0. He was ably assisted there by Anthony Martial.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Michael Carrick (Manchester United) received a precise low pass and immediately unleashed a shot on goal. His attempt lacked a few centimetres to make it home as it crashed against the crossbar!
Wow, what an escape. Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. Manchester Utd will take a corner kick.
A dangerous attempt from Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) was aimed to the top left corner, but Adam Federici pulls off a superb save and stops this one. Manchester Utd earn a corner.
Chris Smalling (Manchester United) is quickest inside the box and jumps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it flies just wide of the right post.

Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his low strike to the middle of the target as Adam Federici produces a good save.
A yellow card for a tackle by Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United). Jonathan Moss doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Max Gradel (Bournemouth) for Marc Pugh.
Eddie Howe decides to make a substitution. Joshua King will be replaced by Benik Afobe (Bournemouth).
GOAL! Antonio Valencia meets a cross inside the box and heads the ball across the goal, where Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) lurks and pokes it into the back of the net. 2:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ander Herrera (Manchester United) will replace Juan Manuel Mata.
Louis van Gaal has decided to substitute Marcus Rashford and he is replaced by Memphis Depay (Manchester United).
Substitution. Callum Wilson will be replaced by Lewis Grabban (Bournemouth).
Louis van Gaal has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ashley Young (Manchester United) replacing Anthony Martial.

Goal! Wayne Rooney displays great vision and sends a pass to Ashley Young (Manchester United), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 3:0.
OWN GOAL! Chris Smalling (Manchester United) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 3:1.
That's it for today, Jonathan Moss has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Goal – 1:0! Nacho Monreal sends a precise lofted pass into the box, Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) rises above the defenders to meet the ball near the penalty spot and heads it straight into the bottom left corner.
Gabriel (Arsenal) finds himself some space around the penalty spot and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the right side of the goal, but Mark Bunn keeps it out.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly wide of the right post.
Jack Wilshere (Arsenal) gets on the end of a cross from Alexis Sanchez, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the right post.
A brilliant individual effort! Scott Sinclair (Aston Villa) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Carlos Sanchez (Aston Villa) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Eric Black is forced to make a change. Joleon Lescott is unable to continue due to injury, Micah Richards (Aston Villa) comes on.
Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Petr Cech makes a great save to stop the effort going into the bottom left corner.
The substitution has been made. Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal) has replaced Jack Wilshere.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.
Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal) misses a rebound from the penalty spot. The ball flies just a few inches over the bar.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Jordan Lyden as he is replaced by Jack Grealish (Aston Villa).
Mark Bunn pulls off a great save to deny Santi Cazorla (Arsenal), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.
Goal! Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Mesut Ozil. The score is 2:0.

Goal! Hector Bellerin displays great vision and sends a pass to Olivier Giroud (Arsenal), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 3:0.

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) makes a good run inside the box to meet a precise cross. He latches on to it and shoots, but the goalkeeper pulls off an excellent save. Good work from Arsenal as they win a corner.
Today's match ends for Mesut Ozil who will be replaced by Mikel Arteta (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger has decided to make a change. Joel Campbell (Arsenal) replaces Santi Cazorla.
Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
What a chance that is! Mikel Arteta (Arsenal) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the crossbar!
Mark Bunn (Aston Villa) has scored a goal! Unfortunately for him and his teammates it's an own goal.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
What a big chance! Pedro (Chelsea) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) misses a great chance after he found some space in the box! His effort goes inches wide of the left post.
What a big chance! Bertrand Traore (Chelsea) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball well wide of the left post.
Kasper Schmeichel pulls off a great save to deny Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.

Kasper Schmeichel pulls off a great save to deny Willian (Chelsea) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Good work from Chelsea as they win a corner.
A goal, which was scored by Pedro (Chelsea), was disallowed due to offside.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Claudio Ranieri makes a switch. Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) is coming on in place of Andy King at the start of the second period.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Claudio Ranieri gives a chance to Jeffrey Schlupp (Leicester) and Demarai Gray is off.
It will be a substitution. Tammy Abraham (Chelsea) is ready to enter the pitch as Bertrand Traore walks off.
Substitution. Pedro is replaced by Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea).
Here comes a substitution. Fikayo Tomori (Chelsea) is brought on as a substitute for Branislav Ivanovic.
Craig Pawson blows his whistle after Jeffery Schlupp (Leicester) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. PENALTY! Wonderful opportunity to score for Chelsea.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the left side of the net.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marc Albrighton (Leicester) comes onto the pitch for Riyad Mahrez.

Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester) scores an incredible goal! He receives a pass, makes some space for himself and unleashes a long-range thunderbolt of a shot past the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner.
Tammy Abraham (Chelsea) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Alex Neil is forced to make a change. Martin Olsson is unable to continue due to injury, Robbie Brady (Norwich) comes on.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) decided to shoot after receiving a sweet pass. If it wasn't for John Ruddy's superb save the ball would have probably ended up inside the left post.
John Ruddy dives like superman to thwart a rebound from Romelu Lukaku (Everton) which would probably have ended up in the left side of the goal. Everton have a corner.
What a beauty from just outside the box! James McCarthy (Everton) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power inside the right post.
Matthew Pennington is being substituted because of an injury. Joe Royle sends Jonjoe Kenny (Everton) on the pitch.
CHANCE! Romelu Lukaku finds Kevin Mirallas (Everton) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the left post!

Robbie Brady (Norwich) holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows for a foul after seeing the whole situation. Everton are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.
Leighton Baines (Everton) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Leighton Baines (Everton) gives no chance to the keeper and converts the penalty with a sharp low drive into the left side of the net.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Lee Mason starts the second half.
Goal! Kevin Mirallas (Everton) scores after an assist by Jonjoe Kenny that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 3:0.
Alex Neil has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sebastien Bassong (Norwich) replacing Ryan Bennett.
It will be a substitution. Aaron Lennon (Everton) is ready to enter the pitch as James McCarthy walks off.
Today's match ends for Kieran Dowell who will be replaced by Ross Barkley (Everton).
Alex Neil has decided to substitute Matthew Jarvis and he is replaced by Wesley Hoolahan (Norwich).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
It's 1:0! Aleksandar Mitrovic feeds Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the bottom right corner.

A perfect lofted pass from Moussa Sissoko finds Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the right side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Hugo Lloris had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
Ryan Mason (Tottenham) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Anthony Taylor had an easy-decision to make.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Joshua Onomah (Tottenham) comes on the pitch for Heung-Min Son.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Ryan Mason is replaced by Thomas Carroll (Tottenham).
Goal! Eric Dier plays a pass to the feet of Erik Lamela (Tottenham), and he shoots into the top left corner from inside the box. It's 2:1.
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Erik Lamela (Tottenham) for a tough tackle.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) will replace Cheik Tiote.
Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) makes a horrible challenge on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!
The referee signals a substitution. Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) is brought on as a substitute for Kyle Walker.
Jan Vertonghen (Tottenham) trips an opponent with a slide tackle. Anthony Taylor stops the game and he could give him a card, but eventually decides on just a warning. It's a penalty for Newcastle!
Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Goal! Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) slams home the penalty with a precise low shot into the bottom right corner.
Rafael Benitez has decided to make a change. Rolando Aarons (Newcastle Utd) replaces Georginio Wijnaldum.

Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and drills a nice strike from a promising distance towards the middle of the goal. Hugo Lloris has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. Newcastle get a corner.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Moussa Sissoko as he is replaced by Jamie Sterry (Newcastle Utd).
Daryl Janmaat plays a terrific cross over to Rolando Aarons (Newcastle Utd), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
Rolando Aarons (Newcastle Utd) gets a yellow card. The referee Anthony Taylor made the right call.
Daryl Janmaat (Newcastle Utd) receives a well-taken defence-splitting pass inside the box and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom left corner.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

That was a nice football moment. Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the roof of the net. Fraser Forster guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
Dusan Tadic (Southampton) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the left post by a whisker.
Sadio Mane (Southampton) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
Ryan Bertrand swings the cross over. Dusan Tadic (Southampton) gets his head to it but it goes just wide of the right post.

This should have been a goal! Virgil van Dijk (Southampton) takes a mid-range free kick and his effort flies straight as an arrow, but crashes against the crossbar. The keeper only turned his head and stared at the ball.
GOAL! Sadio Mane (Southampton) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 1:0.
Fraser Forster pulls off a great save to deny Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the top of the net.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Alan Pardew probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Jordon Mutch. He is replaced by Sullay Kaikai (Crystal Palace).
Here is a change after the half-time break. Oriol Romeu is replaced by Graziano Pelle (Southampton).
Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Michael Oliver didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Today's referee Michael Oliver rightly decides to book James McArthur (Crystal Palace) for his harsh tackle.

Sullay Kaikai (Crystal Palace) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Fraser Forster is alert and denies him with a nice save.

A perfect lofted pass from Cuco Martina finds Graziano Pelle (Southampton), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the top right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Julian Speroni had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a magnificent shot into the top left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Fraser Forster, so the score changes to 1:0.
Substitution. James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) replaces Dusan Tadic.
Graziano Pelle (Southampton) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Oliver ignores the protests.
Adrian Mariappa (Crystal Palace) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Michael Oliver blows his whistle for a foul. PENALTY to Southampton! Great chance to score.
Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) keeps his cool from the penalty spot and fires the ball into the top left corner to give the goalkeeper no chance!

Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms around the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace) replaces James McArthur.
Sadio Mane (Southampton) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post.
Alan Pardew prepares a substitution. Joel Ward is replaced by Martin Kelly (Crystal Palace).
A substitution has been made. Shane Long is replaced by Charlie Austin (Southampton).

Goal! Graziano Pelle displays great vision and sends a pass to Steven Davis (Southampton), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 4:1.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Today's referee Mike Jones rightly decides to book Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) for his harsh tackle. Stoke earn a free kick.
GOAL - 0:1! The corner comes over and Winston Reid flicks on with his head to Michail Antonio (West Ham), who makes no mistake and fires the ball into the back of the net.
Diafra Sakho (West Ham) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Mike Jones shows the yellow card to Giannelli Imbula (Stoke City) for a heavy challenge.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Mike Jones starts the second half.

Shay Given pulls off a great save to deny Diafra Sakho (West Ham) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Giannelli Imbula (Stoke City) received a pass and blasted a beautiful rocket of a shot from just outside the penalty area into the bottom right corner. He was given an ovation. Excellent finish.
Slaven Bilic is forced to make a change. Diafra Sakho is unable to continue due to injury, Emmanuel Emenike (West Ham) comes on.
Substitution. Enner Valencia (West Ham) on for Andrew Carroll.
Enner Valencia (West Ham) connects with a cross and powers a header goalwards, but his effort goes just over the bar.
The game has come to an end for Joselu. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Mame Diouf (Stoke City).

The ball from the corner kick lands at the feet of Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) deep inside the box and he takes a shot. The strike heads towards the right post, but it's deflected away thanks to a wonderful intervention by one of the defenders.
A substitution has been made. Bojan Krkic is replaced by Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City).

Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the right side of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
Mark Hughes prepares a substitution. Geoff Cameron is replaced by Phillip Bardsley (Stoke City).

Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) gets a shot away from about 50 metres after his amazing solo run. It goes to the roof of the net, but Darren Randolph refuses to be beaten easily and he pulls off an exquisite save to keep the ball out.
Here's the change. James Tomkins leaves the pitch and Victor Moses (West Ham) comes on as a substitute.
Charles Graham Adam takes the corner and Mame Diouf (Stoke City) rises highest near the penalty spot to plant a brilliant header into the top left corner. The score is 2:1.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) picks up a yellow card.
Shay Given (Stoke City) receives a yellow card for infringement.
That's it for today, Mike Jones has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Kristoffer Nordfeldt pulls off a great save to deny Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Goal! Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 0:1.
Goal disallowed! Jefferson Montero (Swansea) scores but Michael Dean blows his whistle for a foul.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Kristoffer Nordfeldt is alert and denies him.
Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Dean had an easy-decision to make. Swansea win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Goal! The free-kick is fired in by Andre Ayew (Swansea) and the ball inadvertently flicks off a defender and spins into the net, leaving Joe Hart stranded. 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Great ball in from Kevin De Bruyne. Eliaquim Mangala (Manchester City) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.
A dangerous towering header by Federico Fernandez (Swansea) from around the penalty spot goes just wide of the left post. This corner kick didn't change the score.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Modou Barrow (Swansea) replaces Wayne Routledge.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Bacary Sagna (Manchester City) for his blatant foul.
Kelechi Iheanacho goes off the pitch and Samir Nasri (Manchester City) comes on.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Leon Britton (Swansea) was quite harsh and Michael Dean didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) on for Jefferson Montero.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yaya Toure (Manchester City) comes onto the pitch for Sergio Aguero.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

What a chance that is! Almen Abdi (Watford) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the right post!
Nathan Ake (Watford) gets to the rebound on the edge of the penalty area and fires a shot towards the bottom right corner, but Jordan Pickford gets a hand to it and keeps it out.

Goal! Jeremain Lens displays great vision and sends a pass to Jack Rodwell (Sunderland), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 0:1.
A goal, which was scored by Duncan Watmore (Sunderland), was disallowed due to offside.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Kevin Friend has ended it.
Referee Kevin Friend blows his whistle to start the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Quique Flores gives a chance to Juan Carlos Paredes (Watford) and Craig Cathcart is off.

It's in the back of the net! Sebastian Prodl (Watford) gets on the scoresheet after converting a chance from the resulting corner kick. He finds himself some space inside the box and plants a perfect header into the top of the net. 0:1.
Goal! Duncan Watmore puts the ball across the area and Jeremain Lens (Sunderland) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 1:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and George Honeyman (Sunderland) comes onto the pitch for Rees Greenwood.
Dame N'Doye (Sunderland) has a goal ruled out for offside!

Jose Manuel Jurado (Watford) makes an overly-aggressive challenge and Kevin Friend blows his whistle for a foul. The crowd is going crazy! The referee makes a call and gives the penalty to Sunderland.
Troy Deeney (Watford) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Troy Deeney (Watford) leaves the keeper helpless with his precise penalty shot inside the right post.
The substitution has been made. Yann M'Vila (Sunderland) has replaced Sebastian Larsson.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Almen Abdi as he is replaced by Mario Suarez (Watford).
Samuel Allardyce is forced to make a change. DeAndre Yedlin is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Billy Jones (Sunderland).
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Adlene Guedioura (Watford) for his blatant foul.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Nordin Amrabat (Watford) will replace Jose Manuel Jurado.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal! Salomon Rondon (West Brom) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Jonathan Leko, then sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:0.

Jordon Ibe (Liverpool) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Ben Foster is just a bystander as the ball flies low into the middle of the goal. The score is 1:1.
Bradley Smith (Liverpool) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Today's referee Robert Madley rightly decides to book James McClean (West Brom) for his harsh tackle.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Tony Pulis has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. James Chester (West Brom) comes on the pitch for Jonas Olsson.

Jose Rondon (West Brom) leaps high to meet a beautiful cross from the resulting free kick and attempts to score with a header from near the penalty spot. His effort lacks accuracy and bounces away off the left post.
Substitution. Jordon Ibe did his best and is replaced by Danny Ings (Liverpool).
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) replaces Joe Allen.
Jose Rondon (West Brom) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Craig Dawson (West Brom) gets his head on the corner, but he can't find the target as his header flies high over the crossbar.
We are about to witness a substitution. Tyler Roberts (West Brom) is replacing Jonathan Leko.
Tyler Roberts (West Brom) has tested the patience of referee Robert Madley and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sheyi Ojo (Liverpool) departs the field of play to be replaced by .
We are about to witness a subsitution. Sam Field (West Brom) for James McClean.
Jonny Evans (West Brom) is booked for saying more than Robert Madley was willing to tolerate.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Goal! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom right corner. Simon Mignolet had no chance of reaching it. The score is 0:1.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Emre Can (Liverpool) was quite harsh and Michael Oliver didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Kolo Toure (Liverpool) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Guus Hiddink prepares a substitution. Willian is replaced by Kenedy (Chelsea).
James Milner (Liverpool) has tested the patience of referee Michael Oliver and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
That will be all from Bertrand Traore who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Tammy Abraham (Chelsea).
Jurgen Klopp has decided to substitute James Milner and he is replaced by Joe Allen (Liverpool).
Substitution. Adam Lallana makes his way off the pitch and Christian Benteke (Liverpool) comes on as his replacement.
Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Jurgen Klopp decides to make a substitution. Kolo Toure will be replaced by Sheyi Ojo (Liverpool).
Christian Benteke (Liverpool) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Guus Hiddink has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea) replacing Pedro.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal! Troy Deeney (Watford) fires the rebound low into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.

A superb goal from great team play! Nathan Redmond (Norwich) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot inside the right post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.

OFF THE POST! Nathan Redmond (Norwich) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Goal! Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 2:1.
Nathan Redmond (Norwich) collects a wonderful lead pass and creates some space to smash the ball goalwards from long range. His shot goes painfully wide of the left post!
Nathan Redmond (Norwich) creates a good chance for himself and fires in a powerful close-range shot, but his effort ricochets off the right post.

Martin Olsson (Norwich) had a good opportunity from long range. His shot was directed towards the right side of the goal, but Heurelho Gomes was alert and made a comfortable save. Corner kick. Norwich will have an opportunity.
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Craig Cathcart (Watford), who attempted to block the ball after a cross, but instead he sends it into the roof of his own net.
Almen Abdi (Watford) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.

This was a piece of cake for Heurelho Gomes. Steven Naismith (Norwich) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went low to the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper. Now Norwich have a corner.

Wesley Hoolahan (Norwich) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one! The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Norwich.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Quique Flores has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Nathan Ake (Watford) comes on the pitch for Allan Nyom.
Ryan Bennett (Norwich) was probably a bit loose with his words to Roger East, who decides to show him a yellow.
Odion Ighalo (Watford) finds some space inside the box to meet a beautiful cross and with a precise low drive puts the ball into the middle of the goal.
Jose Manuel Jurado comes off the pitch to be replaced by Steven Berghuis (Watford).
Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) latches on to a precise pass inside the box and sends in a superb strike that finds its way into the bottom right corner.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Ben Watson (Watford) was quite harsh and Roger East didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Quique Flores has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Adlene Guedioura (Watford) replacing Ben Watson.
Substitution. Robbie Brady (Norwich) has come on for Wesley Hoolahan.
Substitution. Nathan Redmond is replaced by Matthew Jarvis (Norwich).
Alex Neil has decided to substitute Steven Naismith and he is replaced by Vadis Odjidja-Ofoe (Norwich).
Nathan Ake (Watford) has tested the patience of referee Roger East and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The booking goes to Vadis Odjidja-Ofoe (Norwich).

Heurelho Gomes was forced into action to thwart Matthew Jarvis (Norwich). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Craig Cathcart (Watford) tackles a bit over-zealously and Roger East blows for a foul. Norwich earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
CLOSE! Younes Kaboul (Sunderland) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post!
Patrick van Aanholt (Sunderland) takes the free kick from mid-range and finds the back of the net with the goalkeeper rooted to the spot.

A header by Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) from very close range goes towards the crossbar, but doesn't get past Joel Robles, who makes a brilliant save. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Sunderland.
Gooal! Lamine Kone (Sunderland) scores with a shot from inside the box after latching onto a headed pass from Yann M'Vila. He makes it 2:0.
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
Roberto Martinez makes a half-time substitution. Aaron Lennon (Everton) comes on in place of Ross Barkley.
Jan Kirchhoff (Sunderland) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the right post.
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) has a shot blocked from inside the box. The ball is out of play. Sunderland will have a chance to score from a corner.
Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland) sends the corner into the box, but Joel Robles intercepts it and averts the threat.
Goal 3:0! Lamine Kone (Sunderland) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Joel Robles was forced into action to thwart Jermain Defoe (Sunderland). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper.
Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) sees a yellow card from Anthony Taylor after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

A brilliant cross into the box finds Ramiro Mori (Everton), who directs his header towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes an astonishing save. Everton get a corner.
Today's match ends for Jan Kirchhoff who will be replaced by Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland).
Gareth Barry (Everton) jumps above the defenders in order to convert a lofted cross with a nice header. Vito Mannone makes a reflexive save to block his effort from hitting the net.
The manager makes a subsitution with John O'Shea (Sunderland) coming on for Lee Cattermole.
Roberto Martinez prepares a substitution. Tom Cleverley is replaced by Leon Osman (Everton).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Wahbi Khazri will be replaced by Duncan Watmore (Sunderland).

Kevin Mirallas (Everton) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the right post. Vito Mannone is alert and denies him with a nice save. Everton have a corner.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) fires a shot from close range, but he is somehow only able to hit the crossbar!
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match will be delayed due to rioting fans. It looks like they didn't come to watch football. Crazy scenes here.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Manuel Lanzini plays it to Diafra Sakho (West Ham), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless David de Gea. 1:0.
Mark Noble (West Ham) unleashes a bullet of a shot that is blocked by a defender.
Angelo Ogbonna (West Ham) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. David de Gea makes a comfortable save to stop the effort from flying into the middle of the goal.
What a chance that is! Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Michael Dean starts the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Louis van Gaal probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Morgan Schneiderlin. He is replaced by Michael Carrick (Manchester United).
Dimitri Payet (West Ham) tries his luck with a promising long-range shot from a rebound, but the ball sails painfully wide of the right post. What a great effort!

It's a goal! Juan Manuel Mata plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Anthony Martial (Manchester United). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:1.
Dimitri Payet (West Ham) slams the ball goalwards from 22 metres out, but his decent effort flies a whisker wide of the right post.
Diafra Sakho (West Ham) latches on to a cross to head the ball wide of the net. A poor header.
A yellow card for a tackle by Anthony Martial (Manchester United). Michael Dean doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) gets his head on the corner, but he sees his header blocked.
Today's referee Michael Dean rightly decides to book Andrew Carroll (West Ham) for his harsh tackle.

Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision. West Ham win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.

Goal! Marcus Rashford displays great vision and sends a pass to Anthony Martial (Manchester United), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:2.
The foul by Ander Herrera (Manchester United) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Dean.

Dimitri Payet sends a superb cross into the box. Michail Antonio (West Ham) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the right post, leaving David de Gea beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:2.
Winston Reid (West Ham) celebrates a stunning goal. He manages to win himself just enough space inside the box to meet the free kick and powers a perfectly placed header inside the right post.
Substitution. Ander Herrera leaves the pitch and is replaced by Jesse Lingard (Manchester United).
Here is a change. Manuel Lanzini is going off and Slaven Bilic gives the last tactical orders to Pedro Obiang (West Ham).
It is time for a substitution. James Tomkins (West Ham) is on for Diafra Sakho.
We are about to witness a substitution. Adnan Januzaj (Manchester United) is replacing Antonio Valencia.
Slaven Bilic decides to make a substitution. Dimitri Payet will be replaced by Enner Valencia (West Ham).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Almen Abdi (Watford) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Watford.
It's in the back of the net! Christian Benteke slips the ball through to Joe Allen (Liverpool), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
Here comes a substitution. Mario Suarez is given a rest as he is replaced by Adlene Guedioura (Watford).

Odion Ighalo (Watford) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Simon Mignolet to get hold of the ball. Good work from Watford as they win a corner.
Substitution. Jose Manuel Jurado did his best and is replaced by Steven Berghuis (Watford).
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) for a tough tackle.
That will be all from Philippe Coutinho who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Roberto Firmino (Liverpool).
Today's referee Lee Mason rightly decides to book Jon Flanagan (Liverpool) for his harsh tackle.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Almen Abdi departs the field of play to be replaced by Nordin Amrabat (Watford).
A yellow card for a tackle by Steven Berghuis (Watford). Lee Mason doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Goal! Some very poor defending from the opponent allows Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) the chance to get to the edge of the box and he makes no mistake with a lovely finish. It's 2:0.
The game has come to an end for Sheyi Ojo. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Cameron Brannagan (Liverpool).
Jordon Ibe (Liverpool) picks up an accurate pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that smashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alberto Moreno leaves the pitch and Connor Randall (Liverpool) comes on.
Christian Benteke (Liverpool) rises above the defence inside the box, but his header flies narrowly wide of the left post.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Fernandinho tees up Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the right side of the goal. 1:0.
Gooal! Mohamed Elneny takes over corner duties. Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the left side of the net. 1:1.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) fires the ball at goal from inside the area, but it's well blocked. The ball goes out of play. Manchester City are awarded a corner kick.
Arsene Wenger is forced to make a change. Danny Welbeck is unable to continue due to injury, Jack Wilshere (Arsenal) comes on.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Anthony Taylor has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Jesus Navas slides a brilliant pass into Fernandinho (Manchester City), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker over the crossbar.

Goal! Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom left corner. Petr Cech had no chance of reaching it. The score is 2:1.
Substitution. Theo Walcott (Arsenal) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Alex Iwobi walks off.
Olivier Giroud plays a pass to Theo Walcott (Arsenal), but he fails to get a decent shot away from inside the box and the ball flies well wide of the left post.

2:2. Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) latches on to a pass on the edge of the penalty area and immediately fires a fantastic first-time shot into the left side of the net. What a finish that is! Joe Hart did his best to stop it, but the shot was just too good. Olivier Giroud provided the assistance.
Substitution. Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) replaces Kelechi Iheanacho.
Gabriel (Arsenal) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Anthony Taylor didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with an accurate shot from the free kick, which is placed dangerously close to the penalty area. However, Petr Cech pulls off a great save to stop his attempt towards the roof of the net. The referee points to the corner flag and Manchester City will take a corner.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) receives a fine cross inside the box and attempts to score a goal, but his shot flies just wide of the right post.
Kevin De Bruyne plays a lovely pass into Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Substitution. Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) in, Mohamed Elneny out.
Manuel Pellegrini has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Wilfried Bony (Manchester City) replacing Jesus Navas.
A substitution has been made. Fernando goes off and Yaya Toure (Manchester City) comes on.
OFF THE BAR! Wilfried Bony (Manchester City) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball crashes against the crossbar.
Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Anthony Taylor ignores the protests.
Fernandinho (Manchester City) has received a yellow card for his foul.
That's it for today, Anthony Taylor has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Fraser Forster is alert and denies him. The ball goes out of play. Tottenham are awarded a corner kick.

Sadio Mane sprays a wonderful pass out to Dusan Tadic (Southampton), who cannot get enough power or direction to cause Hugo Lloris problems and the goalkeeper is able to watch the ball go just wide of the right post.
Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) displays great tekkers inside the box leading to a fantastic goal, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.
It's in the back of the net! Dusan Tadic slips the ball through to Steven Davis (Southampton), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent low shot into the back of the net. He makes it 1:1.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) doesn't hesitate and begins a run towards the opponent's goal. Defenders try to tackle him, but he manages to keep the ball at his feet and pulls the trigger in front of the goal. The strike, though, was not as successful as the solo run and the ball is easily stopped by the keeper. The referee signals a corner kick to Tottenham.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Jonathan Moss blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Today's referee Jonathan Moss rightly decides to book Sadio Mane (Southampton) for his harsh tackle.
Shane Long (Southampton) latched on to a lofted pass inside the box, but his header misses to the right of the target.
Ronald Koeman is forced to make a change. Jordy Clasie is unable to continue due to injury, Oriol Romeu (Southampton) comes on.
It is time for a substitution. Graziano Pelle (Southampton) is on for Sadio Mane.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Clinton N'Jie (Tottenham) replacing Heung-Min Son.
Steven Davis (Southampton) received a pass and blasted a beautiful rocket of a shot from just outside the penalty area into the bottom right corner. He was given an ovation. Excellent finish.
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) sees a yellow card from Jonathan Moss after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Ryan Mason as he is replaced by Nacer Chadli (Tottenham).
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to Shane Long (Southampton) for a tough tackle.
Substitution. James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) in, Dusan Tadic out.

Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) latches on to a lofted pass from the resulting set piece and pulls the trigger from around the penalty spot. His effort towards the bottom left corner is saved by the excellent Fraser Forster. It will be a corner kick for Tottenham.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
It's a goal! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) scores with a brilliant shot into the left side of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Andy King. The score is now 1:0.
Andy King (Leicester) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and powers the ball into the middle of the target, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
A yellow card for a tackle by Matthew Pennington (Everton). Andre Marriner doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Tom Cleverley (Everton) sees a yellow card from Andre Marriner after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. Leicester will take a free kick near the side line.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper blocks the effort.

Christian Fuchs (Leicester) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike to the bottom left corner. Joel Robles pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill.
Here's the change. Shinji Okazaki leaves the pitch and Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) comes on as a substitute.
Roberto Martinez decides to make a substitution. Tom Cleverley will be replaced by Darron Gibson (Everton).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Kevin Mirallas (Everton) for Oumar Niasse.
Matthew Pennington (Everton) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Andre Marriner signals. Leicester are awarded a penalty kick!
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) is going to take the penalty!
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the left side of the net.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marc Albrighton trots off the pitch and is replaced by Jeffery Schlupp (Leicester).
Aaron Lennon (Everton) does well to meet a cross from Leighton Baines, but he directs his shot just wide of the right post.

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) gets on the end of a pass and takes a low shot from the edge of the box which is straight at Joel Robles, who makes a comfortable save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Leicester.
Andre Marriner blows his whistle for a foul after Darron Gibson (Everton) hacks down one of his opponents. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for Leicester.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Darron Gibson (Everton) for a tough tackle.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) misses the penalty! His poor effort goes well over the crossbar.
Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches over the bar.
Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) rises above the defence inside the box to power a fine header, but the goalkeeper is lucky as the ball flies narrowly wide of the right post.
It will be a substitution. Leon Osman (Everton) is ready to enter the pitch as Ross Barkley walks off.
Kevin Mirallas (Everton) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Kasper Schmeichel with a low strike into the middle of the goal. He makes it 3:1.
The game has come to an end for Riyad Mahrez. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Demarai Gray (Leicester).

Demarai Gray (Leicester) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Joel Robles makes a decent save to deny his effort directed to the right side of the target. The ball goes out of play. Leicester are awarded a corner kick.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Robert Madley blows his whistle to start the second half.
Jack Colback (Newcastle Utd) has a great chance to score from deep inside the box! He creates some space for the shot, but blazes it high over the crossbar. Very bad attempt.
Substitution. Papiss Cisse leaves the pitch and is replaced by Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd).
Ciaran Clark (Aston Villa) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Here comes a substitution. Cheik Tiote is given a rest as he is replaced by Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd).

Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) receives a low pass just outside the box and drills a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. Mark Bunn pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) jumps for a cross and produces a fine header from near the penalty spot, but it goes narrowly wide of the left post!
That's the end of the game for Jack Colback, who is replaced by Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd).
Eric Black prepares a substitution. Scott Sinclair is replaced by Rushian Hepburn-Murphy (Aston Villa).
Paul Dummett (Newcastle Utd) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Jonny Evans produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Jose Rondon (West Brom) rises high to head the ball into the left side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 0:1.
Tommy Elphick (Bournemouth) is penalised for holding. Mark Clattenburg signals a set piece. Penalty! A huge opportunity to score for West Brom.
Mark Clattenburg shows a yellow card to Tommy Elphick (Bournemouth) for a tough tackle.
Craig Gardner (West Brom) is going to take the penalty!
Craig Gardner (West Brom) misses the penalty and holds his head in his hands after the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save by diving to the left side of the goal!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Benik Afobe trots off the pitch and is replaced by Callum Wilson (Bournemouth).
Eddie Howe has decided to substitute Max Gradel and he is replaced by Joshua King (Bournemouth).
Mark Clattenburg shows a yellow card to Claudio Yacob (West Brom), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Harry Arter (Bournemouth) was quite harsh and Mark Clattenburg didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That will be all from Junior Stanislas who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Matt Ritchie (Bournemouth).
Tony Pulis has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Saido Berahino (West Brom) replacing Craig Gardner.
The attempt by Steve Cook is blocked, but from the six-yard boxMatt Ritchie (Bournemouth) heads the rebound low into the middle of the goal. He alters the score to 1:1.
Here is a change. Jonathan Leko is going off and Tony Pulis gives the last tactical orders to Sandro (West Brom).

Craig Dawson (West Brom) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Artur Boruc pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Glenn Whelan (Stoke City).
Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) produced a promising shot towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Jakob Haugaard thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Erik Pieters (Stoke City) for a tough tackle.
What a hit! Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
James McArthur (Crystal Palace) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Kevin Friend ignores the protests.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Kevin Friend has ended it.
The whistle blows and Kevin Friend starts the second half.
Half-time substitution. Yohan Cabaye will not participate anymore and Joe Ledley (Crystal Palace) is coming on.
Goal! Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:1.
Alan Pardew is forced to make a change. Joe Ledley is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Jordon Mutch (Crystal Palace).
Connor Wickham (Crystal Palace) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the bar. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Substitution. Xherdan Shaqiri makes way for Jonathan Walters (Stoke City).
Mark Hughes has decided to make a change. Stephen Ireland (Stoke City) replaces Charles Graham Adam.
Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) takes the free kick from a promising position. He has already proven that he can handle such situations and once again, he sends the ball into the back of the net!
Substitution. Glenn Whelan makes his way off the pitch and Bojan Krkic (Stoke City) comes on as his replacement.
Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) strikes a promising volley towards goal, but one of the defenders is quick enough to step in and make a crucial block.
Stephen Ireland (Stoke City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Kevin Friend had an easy-decision to make.
Jordon Mutch (Crystal Palace) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes narrowly over the bar. Terrific solo effort, though.
Pape Souare (Crystal Palace) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dwight Gayle leaves the pitch and Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) comes on.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Gary Cahill (Chelsea) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

This was a piece of cake for Vito Mannone. Willian (Chelsea) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect low strike that goes inside the right post. What a clinical goal!

Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the right side of the goal. Thibaut Courtois shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.

Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes inside the right post. He couldn't have done it any better. 1:1.
Goal! Cesar Azpilicueta gets to the ball and heads it over the defence to Nemanja Matic (Chelsea), who meets it nicely and fires in into the back of the net. 1:2.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Mike Jones has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Diego Costa (Chelsea) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Vito Mannone guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) receives a yellow card for infringement.
A substitution has been made. Lamine Kone is replaced by John O'Shea (Sunderland).
Vito Mannone pulls off a great save to deny Diego Costa (Chelsea), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
It's time for a substitution. Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) comes on in place of Jan Kirchhoff.
Goal! Patrick van Aanholt slips it to Fabio Borini (Sunderland) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom left corner with a great effort. The score is 2:2.
We are about to witness a substitution. Abdul Baba Rahman (Chelsea) is replacing Branislav Ivanovic.
Goal! Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:2.
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) picks up a yellow card.
Today's match ends for Lee Cattermole who will be replaced by Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland).
Willian (Chelsea) takes the mid-range free kick and sends it towards the roof of the net, but he is denied by the goalkeeper. Good work from Chelsea as they win a corner.
Oscar (Chelsea) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Willian.
Guus Hiddink has decided to make a change. Bertrand Traore (Chelsea) replaces John Obi Mikel.
John Terry (Chelsea) gets a yellow card. The referee Mike Jones made the right call.
It's a yellow card for Younes Kaboul (Sunderland).
The referee shows the yellow card to Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland).
This was really stupid from John Terry (Chelsea)! He is booked for the second time today and is forced to leave the pitch after seeing a red card in the hand of Mike Jones.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.

Dimitri Payet (West Ham) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. Some classy goalkeeping by Lukasz Fabianski stops the ball out of the bottom right corner. The ball goes out of play. West Ham are awarded a corner kick.
It's 0:1! Kyle Naughton feeds Wayne Routledge (Swansea) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the bottom left corner.
Angelo Ogbonna (West Ham) misses a big chance! He fires the ball high over the crossbar from inside the 6-yard box after the ball rebounded to him.

Erik Lamela (Tottenham) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the right post! What an opportunity that was!
Mike Jones shows a yellow card to Jonny Evans (West Brom) for a tough tackle.

Salomon Rondon (West Brom) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the right side of the goal, but Hugo Lloris pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. The referee points to the corner flag and West Brom will take a corner.
Craig Dawson (West Brom) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:1.
Mauricio Pochettino is forced to make a change. Eric Dier is unable to continue due to injury, Ryan Mason (Tottenham) comes on.
The referee signals a substitution. Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) is brought on as a substitute for Erik Lamela.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) replaces Dele Alli.
Tony Pulis prepares a substitution. Stephane Sessegnon is replaced by Sandro (West Brom).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Riyad Mahrez (Leicester), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 1:0.

It's in the back of the net! Daniel Drinkwater flights the free kick into the box, where Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) peels off his marker and heads straight into the left side of the net from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 2:0.

Federico Fernandez (Swansea) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it's not accurate and goes narrowly over the bar.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Francesco Guidolin gives a chance to Alberto Paloschi (Swansea) and Leroy Fer is off.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Wayne Routledge is replaced by Jefferson Montero (Swansea).
Goal! Jeffery Schlupp puts the ball on a plate for Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 3:0.
Federico Fernandez (Swansea) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Mark Clattenburg had an easy-decision to make. Leicester are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Ashley Williams (Swansea) has tested the patience of referee Mark Clattenburg and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Substitution. Shinji Okazaki makes way for Demarai Gray (Leicester).
Francesco Guidolin has decided to make a change. Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) replaces Gylfi Sigurdsson.

Andre Ayew (Swansea) shows good awareness inside the box to meet a delightful cross from the free kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Leicester will have a goal kick.
Andy King (Leicester) comes onto the pitch after Leonardo Ulloa signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.

Andy King (Leicester) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom right corner is blocked by Lukasz Fabianski, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Robert Huth (Leicester) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Mark Clattenburg didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Jeffery Schlupp walks off the pitch to be replaced by Marc Albrighton (Leicester).
Demarai Gray (Leicester) takes a great touch after receiving a pass inside the box. He immediately unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a decent save!
Goal! Marc Albrighton (Leicester) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 4:0.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Patrick van Aanholt (Sunderland) takes a mid-range free kick and his beautiful strike only rattles the right post.

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending the ball towards the bottom left corner only for Vito Mannone to dive and make a save. Arsenal have been awarded a corner kick.
Per Mertesacker (Arsenal) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort.
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
A yellow card for a tackle by Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal). Michael Dean doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Wow, what an escape. Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) gets a yellow card.
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) makes a good run inside the box to meet a precise cross. He latches on to it and shoots, but the goalkeeper pulls off an excellent save.

DeAndre Yedlin (Sunderland) finds himself some space just outside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Petr Cech pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going into the bottom left corner. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Arsenal.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Fabio Borini (Sunderland) for a tough tackle.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Alex Iwobi will be replaced by Theo Walcott (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) replacing Olivier Giroud.
Substitution. Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) on for Fabio Borini.
Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
It will be a substitution. Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland) is ready to enter the pitch as Jan Kirchhoff walks off.
Mesut Ozil comes off the pitch to be replaced by Jack Wilshere (Arsenal).

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom left corner, but Vito Mannone made a crucial save!
Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) sees a yellow card from Michael Dean after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Michael Dean didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Shane Long (Southampton) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!

Ryan Bertrand showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Shane Long (Southampton) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header into the bottom left corner. It's 0:1.
Ashley Westwood sends a terrific cross into the box. Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just over the bar.
Virgil van Dijk (Southampton) spurned a golden opportunity! He was quickest to the rebound, but his effort crashed against the left post!
Shane Long (Southampton) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Fraser Forster is alert and denies him.
Goal! Dusan Tadic (Southampton) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Shane Long. The score is 0:2.
Goal! Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:2.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Ronald Koeman gives a chance to Jordy Clasie (Southampton) and Victor Wanyama is off.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Eric Black probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Micah Richards. He is replaced by Kevin Toner (Aston Villa).

Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Southampton.
Shane Long (Southampton) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Brad Guzan is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
A yellow card for a tackle by Alan Hutton (Aston Villa). Neil Swarbrick doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee signals a substitution. Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) is brought on as a substitute for Jordan Ayew.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Carlos Sanchez walks off the pitch to be replaced by Jack Grealish (Aston Villa).
Ronald Koeman decides to make a substitution. Jay Rodriguez will be replaced by Sadio Mane (Southampton).
Goal! Shane Long passes the ball to Dusan Tadic (Southampton) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Brad Guzan couldn't do anything about it. 1:3.
Unbelievable miss! Shane Long (Southampton) reacts superbly to latch on to a rebound, but he blazes the ball high over the crossbar!
Idrissa Gueye (Aston Villa) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Neil Swarbrick ignores the protests.

What an amazing save by Fraser Forster! Alan Hutton (Aston Villa) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the right side of the goal, but fails. Aston Villa force their opponents to concede a corner.

Goal! Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Fraser Forster is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 2:3.
What a big chance! Shane Long (Southampton) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.

It's in the back of the net! Cedric Soares sends a superb cross into the box. Sadio Mane (Southampton) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header low inside the left post, leaving Brad Guzan beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:4.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Pedro (Chelsea) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a precise shot inside the left post. What a lovely finish!
Steve Cook (Bournemouth) misses a rebound from close range. His effort floats narrowly over the crossbar!
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) collected a pass and decided to shoot from about 20 metres out. He hit it perfectly! The ball zoomed around the goalkeeper and ended up inside the left post.
Simon Francis showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Tommy Elphick (Bournemouth) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 1:2.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Joshua King leaves the pitch and is replaced by Callum Wilson (Bournemouth).
Here is a change. Lewis Grabban is going off and Eddie Howe gives the last tactical orders to Benik Afobe (Bournemouth).
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) makes a yard for himself and unleashes a stunning shot from 20 metres out. His great effort, however, goes painfully wide of the right post.
GOAL - 1:3! Cesc Fabregas found Willian (Chelsea) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Artur Boruc off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
Here comes a substitution. Matt Ritchie (Bournemouth) is brought on as a substitute for Junior Stanislas.
Guus Hiddink is forced to make a change. Willian is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea).
Matt Ritchie (Bournemouth) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Goal! Nemanja Matic displays great vision and sends a pass to Eden Hazard (Chelsea), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 1:4.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) meets a perfect cross from Alberto Moreno deep inside the box, and he produces an accurate strike which goes into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar.
A yellow card for a tackle by Cheik Tiote (Newcastle Utd). Andre Marriner doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Goal - 2:0! Adam Lallana (Liverpool) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the top left corner. Alberto Moreno provided an assist for the goal.
Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) latches on to a precise pass on the edge of the box, but miskicks his shot and the ball goes high over the bar. Poor effort!
Vurnon Anita (Newcastle Utd) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes just over the bar.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Andre Marriner has ended it.
Andre Marriner blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Rafael Benitez makes a switch. Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) is coming on in place of Ayoze Perez at the start of the second period.

A perfect lofted pass from Vurnon Anita finds Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the left side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Simon Mignolet had no chance of stopping that. 2:0.

Ambitious effort from Andros Townsend (Newcastle Utd). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well over the bar.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to James Milner (Liverpool), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Simon Mignolet pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.

Joe Allen (Liverpool) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Karl Darlow shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
A goal, which was scored by Roberto Firmino (Liverpool), was disallowed due to offside.
Goal! Jack Colback (Newcastle Utd) picks up the ball inside the box, finds himself in a good position and fires in a shot which is deflected past Simon Mignolet. He makes it 2:2.
Adam Lallana (Liverpool) gets a shot from inside the penalty area and it flies just wide of the left post.
Substitution. Connor Randall is replaced by Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool).
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) replaces Joe Allen.
Substitution. Papiss Cisse makes way for Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd).
Kevin Stewart (Liverpool) produces an effort from the edge of the box, but doesn't hit the ball properly and sends it yards over the bar.

What a save from Karl Darlow! Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising low header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Substitution. Sheyi Ojo (Liverpool) on for Adam Lallana.
Here is a change. Cheik Tiote is going off and Rafael Benitez gives the last tactical orders to Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd).
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Sergio Aguero links up with Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City), who fires just wide of the left post from the edge of the box.
