Glenn Whelan (Stoke City) clutches his head in despair after he blew a huge opportunity! He received the ball from the set piece, took a good first touch and unleashed a mid-range projectile to the roof of the net, but Joe Hart makes a nice save. Stoke will take a corner kick.
Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) meets a fine cross on the edge of the box from the resulting corner kick and shoots. His shot flies just wide of the left post.
The free kick into the box finds Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City), who directs his header into the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a fantastic reflex save. Great goalkeeping.
Giannelli Imbula (Stoke City) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and has an effort on goal. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies inches high over the bar.

Marko Arnautovic sends a lovely lofted pass forward that flies over the top of the defence and into the path of Joselu (Stoke City), but he can't direct his header on target as it flies well wide of the left post.
Gianelli Imbula (Stoke City) gets a shot away from distance, but wasn't really set to take it and fires well wide of the left post.

Fernando (Manchester City) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Jesus Navas. His header was precise and ended up inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 1:0.
Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Robert Madley blows his whistle for a foul. PENALTY to Manchester City! Let's see who will take responsibility.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) is going to take the penalty!
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) fires the penalty inside the left post.
Glenn Whelan (Stoke City) makes a yard for himself on the edge of the box after picking up a pass, but produces a poor effort that sails high over the bar.

What a poor attempt! Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) drives another shot towards goal - this time from further out, but it couldn't have been worse if he had shot blindfolded. The ball goes miles wide to the right.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
Mark Hughes makes a switch. Jakob Haugaard (Stoke City) is coming on in place of Shay Given at the start of the second period.
Marko Arnautovic slides a brilliant pass into Joselu (Stoke City), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.

Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Jakob Haugaard makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the roof of the net. The referee points to the corner flag and Manchester City will take a corner.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he arrows his header just a few inches wide of the right post.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and David Silva walks off the pitch to be replaced by Fabian Delph (Manchester City).
Yaya Toure (Manchester City) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Jakob Haugaard is alert and denies him.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) produced a promising shot towards the roof of the net after his wonderful solo run, but Joe Hart thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.

Goal Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City)! Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) was put through by Pablo Zabaleta and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 3:0.
Manuel Pellegrini prepares a substitution. Sergio Aguero is replaced by Wilfried Bony (Manchester City).
CLOSE! Gianelli Imbula (Stoke City) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that whistles over the bar.
Substitution. Fernando did his best and is replaced by Martin Demichelis (Manchester City).
Wilfried Bony provides Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Here's the change. Marko Arnautovic leaves the pitch and Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) comes on as a substitute.
Gianelli Imbula (Stoke City) attempts to score from a mid-range free kick, but he curls his effort a few inches over the crossbar.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) collected a pass and decided to shoot from about 20 metres out. He hit it perfectly! The ball zoomed around the goalkeeper and ended up in the bottom left corner.
Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
CHANCE! Gareth McAuley (West Brom) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar!

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) struck with a perfectly taken free kick from the edge of the box. He curled the ball straight inside the left post. There are not enough superlatives that can be used to describe that goal.
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to Gareth McAuley (West Brom) for a tough tackle.
Jonathan Moss has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. James Chester comes off for Jonas Olsson (West Brom).
Half-time substitution. Tony Pulis decided to make a change. Sandro is replaced by Salomon Rondon (West Brom).
James McClean goes off the pitch and Craig Gardner (West Brom) comes on.
Ben Foster pulls off a great save to deny Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.

Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The referee points to the corner flag and Arsenal will take a corner.
Jose Rondon (West Brom) wins the ball from the resulting corner but blazes it well over the bar.
Substitution. Alex Iwobi makes way for Francis Coquelin (Arsenal).
Substitution. Alexis Sanchez will be replaced by Theo Walcott (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger has decided to make a change. Joel Campbell (Arsenal) replaces Mesut Ozil.
Close! Joel Campbell (Arsenal) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.

Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Ben Foster guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Adam Lallana (Liverpool) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Joel Robles.
The referee gives a yellow card to James Milner (Liverpool).
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) collects a pass and has an effort from 22 metres out, but it flies just over the crossbar.
Adam Lallana (Liverpool) jumps for a cross and produces a fine header from near the penalty spot, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post.

Joel Robles can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Roberto Firmino (Liverpool). The ball would have probably ended up in the bottom left corner.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Aaron Lennon (Everton).

James Milner sends a superb cross into the box. Divock Origi (Liverpool) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the bottom left corner, leaving Joel Robles beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
Mamadou Sakho (Liverpool) jumps for a cross and plants a brilliant header into the roof of the net.
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Roberto Martinez gives a chance to Muhamed Besic (Everton) and Gareth Barry is off.
Ramiro Mori (Everton) must think that he is playing a different sport because his behaviour has nothing to do with football and the referee has no choice but to show him a straight red card!
Jurgen Klopp is forced to make a change. Divock Origi is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool).
Ross Barkley comes off the pitch to be replaced by Tom Cleverley (Everton).

A superb goal from great team play! Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot inside the left post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Roberto Martinez is forced to make a change. John Stones is unable to continue due to injury, Steven Pienaar (Everton) comes on.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Roberto Firmino departs the field of play to be replaced by Joe Allen (Liverpool).
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) received a pass and blasted a beautiful rocket of a shot from just outside the penalty area into the bottom right corner. He was given an ovation. Excellent finish.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jordon Ibe (Liverpool) comes onto the pitch so that James Milner can be given a rest.
Close! Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot narrowly over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Everton.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Here is an example of luck not being on your side. Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace) puts the ball into the back of the net but, unfortunately for him, it's into his own goal!
Martin Kelly (Crystal Palace) is penalised for holding. Lee Mason signals a set piece. Martin Kelly (Crystal Palace) is shown a yellow card by the referee.

Anthony Martial (Manchester United) unleashes a promising shot towards the right side of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Julian Speroni thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.

What a wasted opportunity by Anthony Martial (Manchester United)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the right side of the goal, but Julian Speroni makes an astonishing save to thwart him. The referee blows his whistle, Manchester Utd are awarded a corner kick.
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Pape Souare (Crystal Palace) for his blatant foul.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Lee Mason blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) is in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound and unleashes a fabulous shot from just outside the box. He couldn't be more precise. His effort bounces off the left post and into the back of the net. Absolutely fantastic!
It's time for a substitution. Jordon Mutch (Crystal Palace) comes on in place of Chung-Yong Lee.
Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) has tested the patience of referee Lee Mason and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Substitution. Marcus Rashford is replaced by Memphis Depay (Manchester United).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and James McArthur (Crystal Palace) comes onto the pitch for Yohan Cabaye.
The game has come to an end for Jesse Lingard. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Ander Herrera (Manchester United).
Alan Pardew has decided to make a change. Connor Wickham (Crystal Palace) replaces Emmanuel Adebayor.
Here is a change. Wayne Rooney is going off and Louis van Gaal gives the last tactical orders to Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.
What a wonderful finish! Andrew Carroll (West Ham) latches on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and smashes the ball inside the left post. There are not enough superlatives to describe that goal.

Sebastian Prodl (Watford) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle. Michael Dean couldn't ignore the rough tackle by Sebastian Prodl (Watford) and blew his whistle. West Ham are awarded the free kick.
Good team movement sets up Dimitri Payet (West Ham) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Watford.

Diafra Sakho (West Ham) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to West Ham.
Jose Holebas (Watford) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Michael Dean blows his whistle for a foul. The referee gives a penalty kick to West Ham!!
Mark Noble (West Ham) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Mark Noble (West Ham) leaves the keeper helpless with his precise penalty shot inside the right post.

Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Watford will have a goal kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Michael Dean blows his whistle to start the second half.
Diafra Sakho (West Ham) latched on to an accurate pass deep into the box and attempted to fire the ball past the keeper, but the shot is way off target. What a miskick!

Chance! Almen Abdi (Watford) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Valon Behrami, but his shot from inside the box flashes just over the bar. The ball goes out of play and West Ham will have a goal kick.
Foul! Almen Abdi (Watford) is penalised for pulling back his opponent. The referee points to the penalty spot. PENALTY to West Ham!
Mark Noble (West Ham) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Mark Noble (West Ham) sends Heurelho Gomes the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
Today's match ends for Jose Manuel Jurado who will be replaced by Steven Berghuis (Watford).
Quique Flores decides to make a substitution. Adlene Guedioura will be replaced by Ikechi Anya (Watford).
Goal! Steven Berghuis puts a cross into the box and finds Sebastian Prodl (Watford), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the right post. He makes it 3:1.

Steven Berghuis (Watford) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the right post by a whisker. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for West Ham.

Mario Suarez (Watford) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier. A clumsy foul by Mario Suarez (Watford) and Michael Dean blows his whistle. It's a free kick to West Ham, but it's in no position for a direct shot on goal.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Nordin Amrabat (Watford) for his blatant foul. Nordin Amrabat (Watford) robs an opponent of the ball and explodes in anger when Michael Dean blows for a foul.
Here's the change. Almen Abdi leaves the pitch and Troy Deeney (Watford) comes on as a substitute.
Slaven Bilic has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Victor Moses (West Ham) replacing Diafra Sakho.
Victor Moses (West Ham) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it under the roof. Unfortunately for him, Heurelho Gomes makes a great save to stop his effort.
CHANCE! Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Watford.
Andrew Carroll comes off the pitch to be replaced by Emmanuel Emenike (West Ham).
Angelo Ogbonna (West Ham) is penalised for holding. Michael Dean signals a set piece. The referee's verdict is crystal clear. A penalty is awarded to Watford!
Troy Deeney (Watford) is going to take the penalty!

Troy Deeney (Watford) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot into the middle of the target, but Adrian pulls off a save. Corner kick. Watford will have an opportunity.

Nordin Amrabat (Watford) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Michael Dean blows his whistle for a foul. Michael Dean blows his whistle and Nordin Amrabat (Watford) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and James Collins (West Ham) comes onto the pitch so that Dimitri Payet can be given a rest.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Perfectly taken free kick! Aleksandar Kolarov sends the ball in, Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) manages to jump highest near the penalty spot and plants a bullet of a header into the roof of the net. It's 0:1.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) produces an effort from the edge of the box, but doesn't hit the ball properly and sends it yards wide of the right post.

Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a low shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Joe Hart made an astonishing save!

Vurnon Anita (Newcastle Utd) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Joe Hart with a precise strike which bounces off the bottom of the left post and into the back of the net. He makes it 1:1.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Vurnon Anita (Newcastle Utd) was quite harsh and Kevin Friend didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Jesus Navas (Manchester City) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Karl Darlow, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him. Manchester City will take a corner kick.
Rafael Benitez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) replacing Papiss Cisse.
Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Kevin Friend didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Karl Darlow pulls off a great save to deny Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.

Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Vincent Kompany (Manchester City), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late. Newcastle are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.
Substitution. Fabian Delph walks off the pitch and Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) comes on as a substitute.
It will be a substitution. Fernandinho (Manchester City) is ready to enter the pitch as Yaya Toure walks off.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) is coming onto the pitch as Andros Townsend cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Manuel Pellegrini decides to make a substitution. Jesus Navas will be replaced by Wilfried Bony (Manchester City).
What an amazing save by Joe Hart! Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the middle of the target, but fails.
Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post.
Eliaquim Mangala (Manchester City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Kevin Friend had an easy-decision to make. Newcastle are awarded the free kick.
Here is a change. Ayoze Perez is going off and Rafael Benitez gives the last tactical orders to Rolando Aarons (Newcastle Utd).
Today's referee Kevin Friend rightly decides to book Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) for his harsh tackle.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
What a sweet touch by Harry Kane (Tottenham) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Shay Given to hold.
Goal! Mousa Dembele slips it to Harry Kane (Tottenham) on the edge of the box and he finds the right side of the net with a great effort. The score is 0:1.
OFF THE BAR! Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and fires a bullet of a shot that crashes against the crossbar.
Neil Swarbrick has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Mark Hughes makes a half-time substitution. Joselu (Stoke City) comes on in place of Xherdan Shaqiri.

Erik Lamela (Tottenham) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the left side of the goal, but he can't get the power to direct it past Shay Given, who keeps it out. Good work from Tottenham as they win a corner.
The whistle blows and Gianelli Imbula (Stoke City) is booked for an infringement.
Goal! Christian Eriksen gets to the ball, slips Dele Alli (Tottenham) into the area and he scores with a delightful chipped finish to make it 0:2.
Off the post! Dele Alli (Tottenham) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range bounced off the right post.
Goal! Erik Lamela puts the ball on a plate for Harry Kane (Tottenham), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:3.
We are about to witness a substitution. Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) is replacing Glenn Whelan.
Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) for a tough tackle.
Goal! Dele Alli (Tottenham) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot inside the right post. Christian Eriksen assisted in the goal. 0:1.
Substitution. Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Dele Alli walks off.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ryan Mason (Tottenham) replacing Mousa Dembele.
Erik Lamela (Tottenham) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly over the crossbar.
Here's the change. Erik Lamela leaves the pitch and Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) comes on as a substitute.
Neil Swarbrick is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Wayne Hennessey pulls off a great save to deny Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.

Goal! Danny Welbeck clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal), who jumps highest and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the top of the net. Wayne Hennessey had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Alan Pardew makes a switch. Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) is coming on in place of Mile Jedinak at the start of the second period.
Joe Ledley (Crystal Palace) sees a yellow card from Roger East after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. A free kick to Arsenal.
Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) fires the ball in from a mid-range free kick, but the effort goes just wide of the right post.
It will be a substitution. Emmanuel Adebayor (Crystal Palace) is ready to enter the pitch as Connor Wickham walks off.
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot at goal. His effort is blocked by Wayne Hennessey with a brilliant diving save!

What a chance that is! Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly wide of the right post.
Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) has tested the patience of referee Roger East and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Arsenal have a free kick.
It's time for a substitution. Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) comes on in place of Danny Welbeck.
Arsene Wenger prepares a substitution. Alex Iwobi is replaced by Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal).
Substitution. Jason Puncheon will be replaced by Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace).

Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the top of the net. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save. The ball is out of play. Crystal Palace will have a chance to score from a corner.
Wonderful finish from Yannick Bolasie (Crystal Palace). He drills a low shot precisely into the bottom left corner. No chance for the goalkeeper.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Theo Walcott (Arsenal) comes onto the pitch for Mohamed Elneny.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) fails to turn the rebound in as the goalkeeper pulls off a great save to keep him out. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Liverpool.

Excellent touch by Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.
Goal! Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 0:1.
Perfectly taken free kick! Jordon Ibe sends the ball in, Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) manages to jump highest near the penalty spot and plants a cracking header low inside the left post. It's 0:2.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Eddie Howe makes a half-time substitution. Lewis Grabban (Bournemouth) comes on in place of Junior Stanislas.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) blows an opportunity as he sends a rebound from just outside of the box narrowly wide of the left post.
Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) fires a brilliant shot from the edge of the box, but the effort rattles the right post! It could have been a superb goal.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Max Gradel departs the field of play to be replaced by Marc Pugh (Bournemouth).
The manager makes a subsitution with Mamadou Sakho (Liverpool) coming on for Kolo Toure.

Joshua King (Bournemouth) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Danny Ward leaps like a salmon to deny him.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Roberto Firmino will be replaced by Divock Origi (Liverpool).
Eddie Howe prepares a substitution. Matt Ritchie is replaced by Callum Wilson (Bournemouth).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Adam Lallana (Liverpool) replaces Jordon Ibe.

Joshua King (Bournemouth) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the bottom right corner. The effort, however, is blocked by Danny Ward, who pulls off a stunning save! Now Bournemouth have a corner.

Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Bournemouth will have a goal kick.
Joshua King (Bournemouth) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort which ends up in the bottom left corner.
Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails a few inches over the bar!
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would probably have ended up inside the right side of the goal, but Kasper Schmeichel pulls off a superb reflex save and punches the ball onto the post.

What an opportunity! Robert Huth (Leicester) leaps high to meet a beautiful cross into the box from the resulting free kick, and he plants a header from near the penalty spot which goes a whisker wide of the right post.
It's 1:0! N'Golo Kante feeds Jamie Vardy (Leicester) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the right side of the net.
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to Jamie Vardy (Leicester) for his blatant foul.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Winston Reid (West Ham) was quite harsh and Jonathan Moss didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Mark Noble (West Ham) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Dimitri Payet (West Ham) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Jonathan Moss had an easy-decision to make.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Slaven Bilic makes a half-time substitution. Andrew Carroll (West Ham) comes on in place of Pedro Obiang.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marc Albrighton leaves the pitch and Jeffery Schlupp (Leicester) comes on.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) is sent-off after receiving his second yellow card!
Claudio Ranieri has decided to substitute Shinji Okazaki and he is replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester).
Winston Reid (West Ham) gathers a cross inside the box and strikes the ball. He wastes a great scoring opportunity as his shot only hits the right-hand post.
Mark Noble will be replaced by Manuel Lanzini (West Ham).
Here comes a substitution. Victor Moses is given a rest as he is replaced by Enner Valencia (West Ham).
Wes Morgan (Leicester) has tested the patience of referee Jonathan Moss and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Another situation results in a direct free kick for West Ham.
Substitution. Riyad Mahrez did his best and is replaced by Daniel Amartey (Leicester).
Wes Morgan (Leicester) makes a rough challenge and the referee blows for a foul. A penalty is given to West Ham!
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) is going to take the penalty!
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) scores from the penalty spot with a shot that goes inside the right post. How easy is that!
What a beauty from just outside the box! Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power into the top right corner.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) escapes without any punishment from the referee after using excessive force to foul his opponent. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for Leicester.
Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) fires the penalty into the right side of the net!
That's it for today, Jonathan Moss has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.

Pedro (Chelsea) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Chelsea.

Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Asmir Begovic guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The ball goes out of play and Manchester City have been awarded a corner kick.

Excellent touch by Samir Nasri (Manchester City)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.
Today's referee Michael Dean rightly decides to book Pablo Zabaleta (Manchester City) for his harsh tackle.

Kevin De Bruyne passes to Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 0:1.
Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Samir Nasri (Manchester City) sees a yellow card from Michael Dean after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Goal Sergio Aguero (Manchester City)! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) was put through by Samir Nasri and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the left side of the net. 0:2.
The yellow card is received by Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea).
Samir Nasri (Manchester City) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Asmir Begovic is alert and denies him.
Substitution. Bacary Sagna (Manchester City) replaces Pablo Zabaleta.
Guus Hiddink has decided to make a change. Kenedy (Chelsea) replaces Pedro.
Substitution. Bertrand Traore (Chelsea) on for Willian.
The foul by John Obi Mikel (Chelsea) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Dean.
Substitution. Samir Nasri walks off the pitch and Fabian Delph (Manchester City) comes on as a substitute.
Thibaut Courtois (Chelsea) knocks his opponent down with an over-the-top tackle. PENALTY to Manchester City! Great chance to score.
Thibaut Courtois (Chelsea) is ordered to leave the field of play by the referee after receiving a red card!
The manager is forced to make a substitution due to a red card. Guus Hiddink issues instructions to Asmir Begovic (Chelsea), who will replace John Obi Mikel.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) is going to take the penalty!
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) steps up and confidently powers the spot kick into the bottom left corner.
The referee signals a substitution. Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) is brought on as a substitute for Sergio Aguero.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Dusan Tadic (Southampton) misses a rebound from the penalty spot. The ball flies just a few inches over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Everton will have a goal kick.
Ronald Koeman is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Jose Fonte suffers an injury and Maya Yoshida (Southampton) comes on.
Sadio Mane (Southampton) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Everton.

Darron Gibson (Everton) has tested the patience of referee Craig Pawson and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Southampton win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.

Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top right corner only for Joel Robles to dive and make a save. Southampton have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Shane Long (Southampton) sees his header crash off the left post after meeting a corner kick inside the six-yard box. The goalkeeper would have been helpless.

Virgil Van Dijk (Southampton) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his shot flies just over the crossbar. This should be a big warning for the defence.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
It should have been a goal! Dusan Tadic (Southampton) fires a rocket of a shot but it only hits the crossbar!
Seamus Coleman is substituted due to injury. Roberto Martinez gives a chance to Callum Connolly (Everton).
Roberto Martinez has decided to make a change. Ross Barkley (Everton) replaces Gerard Deulofeu.
Substitution. Graziano Pelle will be replaced by Steven Davis (Southampton).
Goal! Ramiro Mori (Everton) picks up the ball inside the box, finds himself in a good position and fires in a shot which is deflected past Fraser Forster. He makes it 1:0.
Substitution. Victor Wanyama makes his way off the pitch and Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) comes on as his replacement.
Sadio Mane (Southampton) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and fires the ball into the bottom right corner of the target, leaving the goalkeeper completely helpless.
A substitution has been made. Darron Gibson goes off and Tom Davies (Everton) comes on.
Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Marcos Rojo (Manchester United) creates himself some space in front of goal and connects with the resulting free kick. His header is slightly mistimed and sails inches over the bar.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) jumps for a header from the resulting set piece, but it goes way wide of the right post.

Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) makes a decision to dribble through the defence towards the goal. He gets inside the box, pulls the trigger, but hits the ball very poorly and it goes yards wide of the target.
Kieran Richardson (Aston Villa) latches onto a lofted pass on the edge of the penalty box and unleashes a volley towards goal, but it goes high over the crossbar.
Goal - 1:0! Antonio Valencia laid the ball off to Marcus Rashford (Manchester United), who shot from close range low into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

A neat pass is well received by Wayne Rooney (Manchester United), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the middle of the target. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Kevin Friend blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Juan Manuel Mata plays a lovely pass into Marcus Rashford (Manchester United), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Memphis Depay (Manchester United) has an effort from the edge of the area, but he skies the ball over the top.

Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) finds himself some space inside the box and gets on the end of the corner. He lashes the ball towards the left post, but Brad Guzan pulls off an amazing save to thwart him. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Manchester Utd.
Today's referee Kevin Friend rightly decides to book Kieran Richardson (Aston Villa) for his harsh tackle.
Memphis Depay (Manchester United) takes the free kick and unleashes a strong shot from mid-range. Unfortunately for him, the ball curls inches over the crossbar. What a squandered chance!
Today's match ends for Wayne Rooney who will be replaced by Jesse Lingard (Manchester United).
Louis van Gaal has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Anthony Martial (Manchester United) replacing Marcus Rashford.
It's time for a substitution. Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) comes on in place of Kieran Richardson.
Corner kick falls to Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa), who attempts to finish. Luck is not on his side today as the ball crashes against the right post.
Ciaran Clark (Aston Villa) jumps inside the box to meet the corner and aims a low header towards middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes to stop the effort.
That will be all from Juan Manuel Mata who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Timothy Fosu-Mensah (Manchester United).

Memphis Depay (Manchester United) collects a pin-point pass inside the box and tries a snap shot in the vicinity of the left post, but the goalkeeper dives perfectly to deny him. The ball bounces off his gloves and brushes the post. That was a fantastic reflex save. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Manchester Utd.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Leroy Fer (Swansea) for a tough tackle.
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Chancel Mbemba (Newcastle Utd), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Lukasz Fabianski pulls off a great save to deny Jack Colback (Newcastle Utd) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.

Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) jumped highest to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Andros Townsend. His header was precise and ended up in the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 0:0.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Lee Mason starts the second half.
It is time for a substitution. Modou Barrow (Swansea) is on for Leroy Fer.
The manager makes a subsitution with Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) coming on for Cheik Tiote.
Ashley Williams (Swansea) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post.
A substitution has been made. Andre Ayew goes off and Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) comes on.
Vurnon Anita (Newcastle Utd) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Lee Mason ignores the protests.
Rafael Benitez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) replacing Georginio Wijnaldum.
Golden chance! Jefferson Montero (Swansea) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Papiss Cisse goes off the pitch and Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) comes on.
Goal! Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 2:0.
Substitution. Wayne Routledge (Swansea) replaces Alberto Paloschi.
Goal - 3:0! Aleksandar Mitrovic laid the ball off to Andros Townsend (Newcastle Utd), who shot from close range low into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Lee Mason is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Great touch by Adlene Guedioura (Watford) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save! Watford win a corner.

Ben Watson (Watford) connects with a cross from Adlene Guedioura inside the six-yard box and steers the ball behind the keeper off the left post. Poor defending there has resulted in the scoreline change to 0:0.
A brilliant individual effort! James McClean (West Brom) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post.
Michael Oliver shows the yellow card to Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) for a heavy challenge. West Brom are awarded the free kick.

Heurelho Gomes pulls off a great save to deny Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner. The ball goes out of play. West Brom are awarded a corner kick.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Michael Oliver blows his whistle to start the second half.

Gareth McAuley (West Brom) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would have probably ended up in the roof of the net, but Heurelho Gomes pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him. Good work from West Brom as they win a corner.
Ben Foster pulls off a great save to deny Troy Deeney (Watford), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal. Watford will take a corner kick.
A substitution has been made. Adlene Guedioura is replaced by Mario Suarez (Watford).
Poor challenge! Heurelho Gomes (Watford) is penalised for tripping and Michael Oliver blows his whistle. That is a penalty kick for West Brom.
Heurelho Gomes (Watford) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Saido Berahino (West Brom) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.

Saido Berahino (West Brom) places the ball on the penalty spot and sends it towards the left post. His effort isn't powerful enough, allowing Heurelho Gomes to dive and keep the ball out with an excellent save.
Today's match ends for Jose Rondon who will be replaced by Victor Anichebe (West Brom).
Tony Pulis has decided to make a change. Callum McManaman (West Brom) replaces James Chester.
That will be all from Claudio Yacob who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Craig Gardner (West Brom).
Michael Oliver blows his whistle after Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. The referee makes the call - penalty to Watford!
Troy Deeney (Watford) was probably a bit loose with his words to Michael Oliver, who decides to show him a yellow.
Saido Berahino (West Brom) is going to take the penalty!
Saido Berahino (West Brom) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot into the bottom left corner, but Heurelho Gomes pulls off a superb save.
Jose Manuel Jurado will be replaced by Valon Behrami (Watford).
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) rises high to head a nice lofted cross towards the middle of the goal. Unfortunately for him, his close-range effort lacks pace and Vito Mannone makes a comfortable save.
What a huge chance for Fabio Borini (Sunderland). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.

Vito Mannone receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Martin Olsson (Norwich), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed towards the roof of the net. The referee signals a corner kick to Norwich.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) makes some space to meet a perfect cross inside the box, but he blazes his shot over the bar. High, wide and not at all pretty.
Andre Wisdom (Norwich) was too forceful with his tackle and Andre Marriner interrupted the game to signal a free kick. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for Sunderland!
Andre Wisdom (Norwich) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) is going to take the penalty!
Goal! Fabio Borini (Sunderland) slams home the penalty with a precise low shot into the bottom left corner.
Jermain Defoe passes to Fabio Borini (Sunderland), but he produces a wild shot from the edge of the box which goes high over the bar.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
Alex Neil has made a change at the break. Nathan Redmond (Norwich) has come on in place of Robbie Brady.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Wahbi Khazri comes off for Duncan Watmore (Sunderland).

Good touch by Nathan Redmond (Norwich) as he latched on to an accurate pass before attempting to threaten the goalkeeper with his long-range shot. Unluckily for him, his attempt only rattles the left post.
What a beautiful long-range strike by Sebastien Bassong (Norwich). He is quite unlucky as his shot flies just over the bar.
Goal! Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) scores after an assist by Fabio Borini that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:2.
A yellow card for a tackle by Lee Cattermole (Sunderland). Andre Marriner doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Martin Olsson (Norwich) attempts to discuss the decision with Andre Marriner, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
Substitution. Wesley Hoolahan (Norwich) replaces Matthew Jarvis.

Vito Mannone hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Wesley Hoolahan (Norwich) shoots from the edge of the box towards the top right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Norwich.

A huge opportunity wasted! Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) produces a header from a rebound inside the six-yard box. His effort is denied by one of the defenders who is well positioned and clears the ball to safety.

Jonathan Howson (Norwich) blew a promising chance when he got to a rebound just outside the penalty area. He struck it towards the bottom left corner, but Vito Mannone pulled off a nice save to stop the attempt. The referee blows his whistle, Norwich are awarded a corner kick.
Substitution. Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland) on for Yann M'Vila.
Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland) expertly wins the ball from the free kick, but his effort from the edge of the penalty area isn't accurate at all and the ball goes well wide of the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Steven Naismith trots off the pitch and is replaced by Cameron Jerome (Norwich).

Nathan Redmond (Norwich) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the roof of the net is blocked by Vito Mannone, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Norwich force a corner. They send men into the box.
John O'Shea (Sunderland) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jan Kirchhoff.
Close! Cameron Jerome (Norwich) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
Gary O'Neil (Norwich) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and has an effort on goal. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies inches high over the bar.

Sebastian Larsson produces a sweet pass and picks out Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the middle of the net and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 0:2!
That's it for today, Andre Marriner has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Wilfried Zaha slides a brilliant pass into Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.
James McCarthy (Everton) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

Seamus Coleman (Everton) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the right side of the goal, but he can't get the power to direct it past Wayne Hennessey, who keeps it out. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Everton.
Arouna Kone (Everton) has a good chance to get on the scoresheet and fires the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but it goes narrowly over the crossbar.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.
Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Mike Jones blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Alan Pardew makes a half-time substitution. Connor Wickham (Crystal Palace) comes on in place of Dwight Gayle.
Ross Barkley (Everton) tries his luck with a shot from the edge of the box, but the ball crashes against the crossbar! It would have been a superb goal.
James McCarthy (Everton) should have been more careful. He commits a bad foul, receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!
We are about to witness a subsitution. Muhamed Besic (Everton) for Arouna Kone.
Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.

John Stones (Everton) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the top of the net. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save.
Substitution. Emmanuel Adebayor (Crystal Palace) on for Yannick Bolasie.

Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) bursts inside the box, beats two defenders and produces a strike from the penalty spot. The shot has power, but lacks precision and the goalkeeper stops it easily. The scoreline remains the same.
Roberto Martinez has decided to substitute Aaron Lennon and he is replaced by Bryan Oviedo (Everton).
Great ball in from Jason Puncheon. Emmanuel Adebayor (Crystal Palace) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the right post.
Today's match ends for Wilfried Zaha who will be replaced by Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace).
Substitution. Kevin Mirallas (Everton) in, Ross Barkley out.
Jason Puncheon swings the cross over. Emmanuel Adebayor (Crystal Palace) gets his head to it but it goes just over the crossbar.
Mike Jones shows a yellow card to Gareth Barry (Everton) for his blatant foul.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) receives a quality pass, makes a yard for himself and smashes a jaw-dropping long-range shot inside the right post. What a remarkable goal!
GOAL! Xherdan Shaqiri curls the free kick into the box. Bojan Krkic (Stoke City) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past Simon Mignolet and into the right side of the net. 1:0.
Erik Pieters (Stoke City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Mark Clattenburg had an easy-decision to make.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Peter Crouch (Stoke City) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Goal! A great cross from Sheyi Ojo finds Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool), who scores with a simple header into an empty net. 2:1.

Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the right post by a whisker.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Mark Clattenburg starts the second half.
Half-time substitution. Jurgen Klopp decided to make a change. Sheyi Ojo is replaced by Divock Origi (Liverpool).
It's in the back of the net! James Milner puts the ball on a plate for Divock Origi (Liverpool), who has an easy finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 3:1.
What a chance that is! Alberto Moreno swings the ball into the box, and Divock Origi (Liverpool) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the right post.
Substitution. Roberto Firmino is replaced by Adam Lallana (Liverpool).

Goal! Divock Origi (Liverpool) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box inside the right post. Jakob Haugaard had no chance of reaching it. The score is 4:1.
Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) whips a volley from long range towards the goal. His beautiful effort whistles wide of the left post.
Here is a change. Xherdan Shaqiri is going off and Mark Hughes gives the last tactical orders to Mame Diouf (Stoke City).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Bojan Krkic as he is replaced by Joselu (Stoke City).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) replaces Joe Allen.
Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) has tested the patience of referee Mark Clattenburg and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Mark Hughes prepares a substitution. Erik Pieters is replaced by Marc Muniesa (Stoke City).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's kick-off has been delayed due to heavy traffic en route to the stadium.
The first half has just begun.
Erik Lamela (Tottenham) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the left post!
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Michael Dean starts the second half.
Louis van Gaal has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Ashley Young (Manchester United) comes on the pitch for Marcus Rashford.

Great solo effort by Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) as he tricks his way through two defenders before firing a drive from just outside of the box towards the left side of the goal. The goalkeeper is ready and produces a stunning save.
David de Gea hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Eric Dier (Tottenham) shoots from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
Anthony Martial (Manchester United) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the middle of the goal is smartly dealt with by Hugo Lloris.
The referee signals a substitution. Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) is brought on as a substitute for Timothy Fosu-Mensah.

Goal! Christian Eriksen displays great vision and sends a pass to Dele Alli (Tottenham), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:0.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Danny Rose (Tottenham).
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) is given a yellow card.
Perfectly taken free kick! Erik Lamela sends the ball in, Toby Alderweireld (Tottenham) manages to jump highest near the penalty spot and plants a cracking header low inside the right post. It's 2:0.
What a hit! Erik Lamela (Tottenham) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 3:0.
Substitution. Juan Manuel Mata will be replaced by Memphis Depay (Manchester United).

Harry Kane (Tottenham) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would have probably ended up in the roof of the net, but David de Gea pulls off a decent save to thwart him. The linesman points to the corner flag, Tottenham are going to take it.
Kyle Walker (Tottenham) receives a yellow card.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Memphis Depay (Manchester United).
A yellow card for a tackle by Ashley Young (Manchester United). Michael Dean doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
A substitution has been made. Erik Lamela is replaced by Nacer Chadli (Tottenham).
The substitution is prepared. Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Harry Kane.
The expression of the referee Michael Dean is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Dele Alli (Tottenham) is shown a yellow card.
Substitution. Ryan Mason (Tottenham) on for Dele Alli.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Wes Morgan (Leicester) outjumps his marker inside the box and heads the resulting corner way wide of the right post.
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) has tested the patience of referee Anthony Taylor and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Christian Fuchs (Leicester) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Kasper Schmeichel pulls off a great save to deny Fabio Borini (Sunderland), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Anthony Taylor has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) pounced on a rebound on the edge of the box and his shot goes a whisker over the crossbar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Shinji Okazaki trots off the pitch and is replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester).
Fantastic team goal! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) was set free in the area by Daniel Drinkwater and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
Wahbi Khazri goes off the pitch and Dame N'Doye (Sunderland) comes on.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to substitute Yann M'Vila and he is replaced by Jack Rodwell (Sunderland).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Jeremain Lens (Sunderland) for Fabio Borini.
Substitution. Demarai Gray (Leicester) replaces Riyad Mahrez.
Close! Jack Rodwell (Sunderland) is a whisker away from finishing-off the move he started. His close-range effort flies just over the bar.
Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Vito Mannone.
Here is a change. Marc Albrighton is going off and Claudio Ranieri gives the last tactical orders to Daniel Amartey (Leicester).
Vito Mannone pulls off a great save to deny Jamie Vardy (Leicester) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Superb touch by Daniel Amartey (Leicester) as he receives a precise pass inside the box. He finds the keeper prepared as he unleashes his shot to the left side of the goal. Wonderful save!
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Vito Mannone with a low strike into the middle of the goal. He makes it 0:2.
That's it for today, Anthony Taylor has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.

A good lofted pass from James McClean finds Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom) on the edge of the area. He collects the ball and rips in a wonderful shot which ends up inside the right post. The score is now 0:1.
Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom) performs a sliding tackle but catches his opponent's legs. The referee blows his whistle for an infringement. The referee gives a penalty kick to Manchester City!!
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) is going to take the penalty!
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) leaves the keeper helpless with his precise penalty shot inside the right post.
Salomon Rondon is being substituted because of an injury. Tony Pulis sends Craig Gardner (West Brom) on the pitch.
The foul by Craig Gardner (West Brom) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Mike Jones.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
The substitution has been made. Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) has replaced Wilfried Bony.
Manuel Pellegrini has decided to make a change. Yaya Toure (Manchester City) replaces Fabian Delph.
Wow, what an escape. Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
Goal 2:1! Samir Nasri (Manchester City) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.

Ambitious effort from Saido Berahino (West Brom). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well wide of the right post.
Saido Berahino (West Brom) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Ben Foster is alert and denies him.
Substitution. Stephane Sessegnon makes way for Jonathan Leko (West Brom).
A brilliant individual effort! Samir Nasri (Manchester City) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post.
Manuel Pellegrini has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Gael Clichy (Manchester City) replacing Sergio Aguero.
James McClean (West Brom) unleashes a decent effort from just outside the box which goes narrowly wide of the left post.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Lewis Grabban (Bournemouth) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom left corner. Brad Guzan has a clear sight of it makes a comfortable save. Bournemouth will take a corner kick.
The foul by Steve Cook (Bournemouth) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Martin Atkinson.
Charlie Daniels (Bournemouth) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Martin Atkinson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Idrissa Gueye (Aston Villa) for his blatant foul.
GOAL! Steve Cook (Bournemouth) finishes off a sublime move with a delightful back-heel goal. Simon Francis provided the assist with a brilliant pass. 0:1.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Eric Black probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Jordan Lyden. He is replaced by Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa).
Substitution. Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) in, Max Gradel out.
Eric Black has decided to substitute Scott Sinclair and he is replaced by Adama Traore (Aston Villa).
GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Joshua King (Bournemouth) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 0:2.
Substitution. Kieran Richardson leaves the pitch and is replaced by Jack Grealish (Aston Villa).
Goal - 1:2! Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Idrissa Gueye provided an assist for the goal.
Eddie Howe decides to make a substitution. Lewis Grabban will be replaced by Shaun MacDonald (Bournemouth).
The referee signals a substitution. Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) is brought on as a substitute for Joshua King.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) for a tough tackle.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.

What a great touch by Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the right side of the goal, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Crystal Palace.
Yellow card. Yannick Bolasie (Crystal Palace) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) rises highest from the corner and heads at goal, but his effort towards the top left corner is saved by John Ruddy.
A yellow card for a tackle by Timm Klose (Norwich). Michael Oliver doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Alex Neil is forced to make a change. Timm Klose is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Sebastien Bassong (Norwich).
Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Michael Oliver starts the second half.
Yannick Bolasie (Crystal Palace) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
Today's match ends for Bakary Sako who will be replaced by Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace).
Alex Neil has decided to substitute Steven Naismith and he is replaced by Patrick Bamford (Norwich).
Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom left corner.
The foul by Mile Jedinak (Crystal Palace) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Oliver.

Ryan Bennett (Norwich) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the left post. Wayne Hennessey guesses his intentions and denies him with a fine save.

Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
A substitution has been made. Jason Puncheon goes off and Joe Ledley (Crystal Palace) comes on.
Alex Neil decides to make a substitution. Matthew Jarvis will be replaced by Nathan Redmond (Norwich).

Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the right post. John Ruddy is alert and denies him with a nice save. The linesman makes the right call and Crystal Palace will have a corner.
Substitution. Dwight Gayle leaves the pitch and is replaced by Connor Wickham (Crystal Palace).

What a great touch by Wayne Hennessey (Crystal Palace) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot towards the roof of the net, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. The linesman points to the corner flag, Crystal Palace are going to take it.
That's it for today, Michael Oliver has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Shane Long (Southampton) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Karl Darlow with a strike into the left side of the goal. He makes it 1:0.
Jordy Clasie (Southampton) fires the ball in from a mid-range free kick, but the effort goes just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Newcastle will have a goal kick.

Goal! Shane Long plays in Graziano Pelle (Southampton), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box slots it into the bottom right corner 2:0.
Rafael Benitez is forced to make a change. Daryl Janmaat is unable to continue due to injury, Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd) comes on.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Rafael Benitez makes a half-time substitution. Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) comes on in place of Steven Taylor.
Jose Fonte (Southampton) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender.
Goal! Victor Wanyama (Southampton) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 3:0.

Andros Townsend (Newcastle Utd) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the left side of the target, but Fraser Forster easily deals with the threat. Newcastle will take a corner kick.
Shane Long comes off the pitch to be replaced by James Ward-Prowse (Southampton).
Andros Townsend (Newcastle Utd) produces a moment of pure magic and scores a spectacular goal by striking the ball into the top left corner of the net!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ayoze Perez departs the field of play to be replaced by Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd).
Sadio Mane (Southampton) unleashes a decent effort from just outside the box which goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Substitution. Jordy Clasie makes way for Oriol Romeu (Southampton).
Ronald Koeman has decided to substitute Dusan Tadic and he is replaced by Jay Rodriguez (Southampton).
That's it for today, Robert Madley has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Lukasz Fabianski is alert and denies him.
Jefferson Montero (Swansea) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop.

Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Asmir Begovic, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Pato (Chelsea) finds some space inside the box and latches on to a brilliant cross, but he wastes his chance as his shot goes way wide of the left post.
What a hit! Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Andre Marriner shows the yellow card to Angel Rangel (Swansea) for a heavy challenge.
Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Andre Marriner ignores the protests.
Andre Ayew (Swansea) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the bottom right corner, but Asmir Begovic easily deals with the threat.
A yellow card for a tackle by Matthew Miazga (Chelsea). Andre Marriner doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The free kick into the box finds Leroy Fer (Swansea), who directs his header into the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a fantastic reflex save. Great goalkeeping.
Neil Taylor (Swansea) sees a yellow card from Andre Marriner after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Pato (Chelsea) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Andre Marriner has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Guus Hiddink probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Matthew Miazga. He is replaced by Kenedy (Chelsea).

This was a piece of cake for Asmir Begovic. Alberto Paloschi (Swansea) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went low to the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
CHANCE! Pato (Chelsea) fires just wide of the right post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Pedro.
Jack Cork (Swansea) was waiting for the ball on the edge of the box and produced a powerful volley directed to the left side of the target, but the goalkeeper made an amazing save to deny him.
Andre Ayew (Swansea) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post.
Guus Hiddink has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Bertrand Traore (Chelsea) replacing Pato.
Andre Ayew will be replaced by Wayne Routledge (Swansea).
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Alberto Paloschi (Swansea), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Pedro (Chelsea) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Andre Marriner's book.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alberto Paloschi departs the field of play to be replaced by Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea).

Jefferson Montero (Swansea) has a big opportunity to score! He climbs highest deep inside the penalty box and strikes a powerful header towards the goal. Next time he should aim better as his effort flies narrowly over the bar.
Guus Hiddink decides to make a substitution. Ruben Loftus-Cheek will be replaced by Falcao (Chelsea).
Ashley Williams (Swansea) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) is cautioned and receives a yellow card.
The foul by Leroy Fer (Swansea) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Andre Marriner.
Substitution. Kyle Naughton (Swansea) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Jefferson Montero walks off.
Falcao (Chelsea) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his shot goalwards, but the keeper produces a decent save!
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Today's referee Kevin Friend rightly decides to book Etienne Capoue (Watford) for his harsh tackle.

Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the right-hand post, but Heurelho Gomes was alert and the score remains the same. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Everton.
The foul by James McCarthy (Everton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Kevin Friend.
Odion Ighalo (Watford) collects a rebound and his promising attempt heads towards the left side of the goal, but Joel Robles keeps it out with an amazing save.
Goal! James McCarthy (Everton) finds some space for a shot from the edge of the box and his attempt goes low inside the right post. Fantastic finish.
OWN GOAL! Seamus Coleman (Everton) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 1:1.
The end of the first half.
Referee Kevin Friend blows his whistle to start the second half.
Quique Flores has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Adlene Guedioura (Watford) comes on the pitch for Valon Behrami.
Wow, what an escape. Romelu Lukaku (Everton) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.

Aaron Lennon (Everton) gets a shot away from about 18 metres out after his amazing solo run. It goes to the bottom left corner, but Heurelho Gomes refuses to beaten easily and he pulls off an exquisite save to keep the ball out.
We are about to witness a substitution. Nordin Amrabat (Watford) is replacing Jose Manuel Jurado.
Roberto Martinez has decided to substitute Ross Barkley and he is replaced by Tom Cleverley (Everton).
Aaron Lennon (Everton) picks up a pass and has an effort from the edge of the box, but Heurelho Gomes gets down to his right to keep it out. The referee signals a corner kick to Everton.
Roberto Martinez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Kevin Mirallas (Everton) replacing Gerard Deulofeu.
Quique Flores decides to make a substitution. Etienne Capoue will be replaced by Mario Suarez (Watford).
Kevin Mirallas (Everton) takes the resulting free kick from 20 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the left side of the goal, but Heurelho Gomes is alert and keeps the ball out.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Roberto Martinez has decided to make a change. Ramiro Mori (Everton) replaces Phil Jagielka.

Ben Watson (Watford) picks up a pass, lines up a shot and strikes from 22 metres out, but Joel Robles thwarts the effort which is headed to the right side of the goal. It will be a corner kick for Watford.
Kevin Friend shows the yellow card to Odion Ighalo (Watford) for a heavy challenge.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
