Craig Pawson shows the yellow card to Andrew Carroll (West Ham) for a heavy challenge.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Goal! Alex Iwobi plays a pass to the feet of Mesut Ozil (Arsenal), and he shoots into the bottom right corner from inside the box. It's 0:1.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Adrian makes a comfortable save to stop the effort from flying into the middle of the goal.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) fires a volley from the edge of the box, but his effort goes well wide of the left post.
Goal Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal)! Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) was put through by Alex Iwobi and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom right corner. 0:2.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. David Ospina makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom right corner.
A brilliant cross into the box finds Andrew Carroll (West Ham), who directs his header to the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes an astonishing save.

Aaron Cresswell shows his great technique and produces a beautiful cross into the box. Andrew Carroll (West Ham) gets on the scoresheet by heading the ball precisely inside the right post. It's now 0:2.
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Andrew Carroll (West Ham) makes a good run into the box to meet a cross and fires the ball in on goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender.
Goal! Andrew Carroll (West Ham) fires the rebound inside the left post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:2.

The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Slaven Bilic decided to make a change. James Tomkins is replaced by Emmanuel Emenike (West Ham).
Goal disallowed! Dimitri Payet (West Ham) scores but Craig Pawson blows his whistle for a foul.

Michail Antonio sends a superb cross into the box. Andrew Carroll (West Ham) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving David Ospina beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:2.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) receives a lofted pass from the flank and shoots from close range, but the ball flies just over the crossbar, almost brushing it.
Arsene Wenger prepares a substitution. Francis Coquelin is replaced by Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) replacing Mohamed Elneny.
Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) gets to the rebound just outside the box, but his attempt is blocked by one of the defending players.
Danny Welbeck feeds the ball through to Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the top right corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 3:2!

Dimitri Payet (West Ham) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the left side of the goal, but David Ospina made a crucial save! The ball goes out of play. West Ham are awarded a corner kick.
What a chance that is! Nacho Monreal swings the ball into the box, and Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the left post.

Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the right post is blocked by David Ospina, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. West Ham will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) gets his head on the corner, but he sees his header blocked.
Winston Reid (West Ham) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the right post.

Dimitri Payet (West Ham) gets the ball and drives a shot high over the bar from the edge of the area.
The foul by Michail Antonio (West Ham) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Craig Pawson.
That's it for today, Craig Pawson has blown his whistle and the game is over.

Anthony Martial (Manchester United) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.

Anthony Martial (Manchester United) is having a lively performance. He is causing problems and wanting the ball at every opportunity.

Sadio Mane (Southampton) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his shot towards the middle of the goal, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it.

Jose Fonte (Southampton) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the top right corner. Kasper Schmeichel pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. It will be a corner kick for Southampton.

The foul by Victor Wanyama (Southampton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Oliver. Leicester will look to take advantage of a free kick in a promising position in the middle of the field.

Fernando (Manchester City) scores from the resulting corner. The ball slips through the box to Fernando (Manchester City) and he slams it into the roof of the net, giving the goalkeeper no chance.

0:2. Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) latches on to a pass on the edge of the penalty area and immediately fires a fantastic first-time shot into the left side of the net. What a finish that is! Artur Boruc did his best to stop it, but the shot was just too good. David Silva provided the assistance.

A goal, which was scored by Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich), was disallowed due to offside.
Robbie Brady (Norwich) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the middle of the goal. Karl Darlow is alert, though, and makes an easy save to deny him.
Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the bottom right corner. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save!

It's in the back of the net! Robbie Brady flights the free kick into the box, where Timm Klose (Norwich) peels off his marker and heads it straight into the bottom left corner from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 1:0.

Andre Wisdom (Norwich) wastes a big chance! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and it goes narrowly over the crossbar.

Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Karl Darlow is just a bystander as the ball flies into the top right corner. The score is 2:1.

Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.

John Ruddy makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the top right corner by Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd) after a cross from the side. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Newcastle.

GOAL! Superb work from Jonathan Howson, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Martin Olsson (Norwich), who beats Karl Darlow with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 3:2.

Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.

What a chance that is! Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post.
Foul! Aly Cissokho (Aston Villa) is penalised for pulling back his opponent. PENALTY to Chelsea! Great chance to score.
Aly Cissokho (Aston Villa) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
Pato (Chelsea) is going to take the penalty!
Pato (Chelsea) takes the penalty and perfectly sends the ball inside the left post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Kenedy is replaced by Oscar (Chelsea).
Goal!  Oscar puts the ball on a plate for Pedro (Chelsea), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:3.

Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Brad Guzan guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) receives a precise pass and finds some space for a shot. The keeper is alert and denies his long-range effort towards the roof of the net. Decent save!
Pato (Chelsea) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the right-hand post, but Brad Guzan was alert and the score remains the same.
Goal! Pedro (Chelsea) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 0:4.
Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Carlos Sanchez (Aston Villa), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
It is time for a substitution. Jack Grealish (Aston Villa) is on for Carles Gil.
Eric Black prepares a substitution. Carlos Sanchez is replaced by Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa).
Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) breaks into the penalty area but his shot is blocked.
Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) unleashes a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Pedro will be replaced by Jake Clarke-Salter (Chelsea).
Alan Hutton (Aston Villa) sees a yellow card from Neil Swarbrick after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) sends in a direct shot from a dangerously positioned free kick. The ball sails towards the left post, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save.
Substitution. Idrissa Gueye walks off the pitch and Jordan Lyden (Aston Villa) comes on as a substitute.
Baba Rahman (Chelsea) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
Alan Hutton (Aston Villa) picks up his second yellow card from referee Neil Swarbrick and is given his marching orders.
Neil Swarbrick shows the yellow card to Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) for a heavy challenge.
Jack Grealish (Aston Villa) gets on the end of a cross from Jordan Ayew, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the left post.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
Chris Smalling (Manchester United) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well. A free kick is awarded to Manchester City.

Jesus Navas (Manchester City) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick low shot towards the middle of the goal. His effort lacks pace and that allows David de Gea to make a comfortable save. Manchester City will have a chance to score from a corner kick.

An amazing individual effort from Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and makes it 0:1. Joe Hart was helpless.
Manuel Pellegrini is forced to make a change. Raheem Sterling is unable to continue due to injury, Fernando (Manchester City) comes on.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Yaya Toure (Manchester City), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
The end of the first half.
Referee Michael Oliver blows his whistle to start the second half.
Joe Hart is substituted due to injury. Manuel Pellegrini gives a chance to Wilfredo Caballero (Manchester City).
Substitution. Wilfried Bony (Manchester City) in, Martin Demichelis out.

Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. Manchester Utd have been awarded a corner kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marcos Rojo leaves the pitch and Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) comes on.
Wilfried Bony (Manchester City) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) connects with a cross from out wide in the six-yard box, but only plants his header onto the right post.
Today's match ends for Juan Manuel Mata who will be replaced by Bastian Schweinsteiger (Manchester United).

Wow, what an escape. Wilfried Bony (Manchester City) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. The ball is out of play. Manchester City will have a chance to score from a corner.
Eliaquim Mangala (Manchester City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Oliver had an easy-decision to make. There is a free kick near the sideline to Manchester Utd.
Substitution. Matteo Darmian is replaced by Timothy Fosu-Mensah (Manchester United).
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) misses a great chance after he found some space in the box! His effort goes inches wide of the left post.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Goal Harry Kane (Tottenham)! Harry Kane (Tottenham) was put through by Kyle Walker and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 1:0.

Dele Alli passes to Harry Kane (Tottenham), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 2:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Half-time substitution. Benik Afobe is replaced by Lewis Grabban (Bournemouth).
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Eddie Howe probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Harry Arter. He is replaced by Eunan O'Kane (Bournemouth).
Goal! Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:0.
Neil Swarbrick shows the yellow card to Simon Francis (Bournemouth) for a heavy challenge.
Substitution. Thomas Carroll (Tottenham) replaces Erik Lamela.
Here is a change. Max Gradel is going off and Eddie Howe gives the last tactical orders to Marc Pugh (Bournemouth).
Dele Alli will be replaced by Ryan Mason (Tottenham).

Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the bottom right corner that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
The referee signals a substitution. Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) is brought on as a substitute for Eric Dier.
That's it for full time as Neil Swarbrick ends the second half.
The first half has started.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Jack Colback (Newcastle Utd) for his blatant foul.
CHANCE! Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) fires just wide of the right post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Jack Rodwell.

Vito Mannone makes a brilliant save! Andros Townsend (Newcastle Utd) easily weaves through the defence and fires the ball from mid-range. His effort goes towards the middle of the goal but is saved by the keeper!
Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) produces a shot from a direct free kick on the edge of the box. His effort sails narrowly wide of the left post. The goalkeeper was lucky there.
Today's referee Martin Atkinson rightly decides to book Daryl Janmaat (Newcastle Utd) for his harsh tackle.
The free kick from a promising distance is taken by Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the left post. What a chance!

Fabio Borini (Sunderland) won himself some space after the corner kick and tries his luck with a shot from the edge of the box. His effort is directed towards the underside of the crossbar, but the goalkeeper is alert and makes the save.
Goal! Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 0:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the middle of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) was quite harsh and Martin Atkinson didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jack Colback.
Substitution. Daryl Janmaat is replaced by Vurnon Anita (Newcastle Utd).
Samuel Allardyce prepares a substitution. Younes Kaboul is replaced by John O'Shea (Sunderland).
The game has come to an end for Wahbi Khazri. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Dame N'Doye (Sunderland).
Rafael Benitez has decided to substitute Andros Townsend and he is replaced by Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd).

GOAL! Georginio Wijnaldum produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) rises high to head the ball into the bottom right corner and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:1.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) receives a yellow card.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to make a change. Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) replaces Jan Kirchhoff.
Vito Mannone (Sunderland) gets a yellow card.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

The defending players give Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) far too much free space and he knows how to take advantage of it. He produces a howitzer in the direction of the bottom right corner. Fraser Forster was taken unawares by his effort and the score is 0:1.
Goal! Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Divock Origi, then sends the ball into the bottom left corner. 0:2.
Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Roger East didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Excellent touch by Joe Allen (Liverpool)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.
Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Joe Allen (Liverpool) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Roger East has ended it.
Half-time substitution. Jurgen Klopp decided to make a change. Dejan Lovren is replaced by Martin Skrtel (Liverpool).
The game is over for Oriol Romeu. Victor Wanyama (Southampton) comes on for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Dusan Tadic will not participate anymore and Sadio Mane (Southampton) is coming on.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Emre Can (Liverpool).
Martin Skrtel (Liverpool) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Roger East blows his whistle for a foul. The referee gives a penalty kick to Southampton!!
Martin Skrtel (Liverpool) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Sadio Mane (Southampton) is going to take the penalty!
Sadio Mane (Southampton) couldn't focus enough and misses the penalty.
Goal! Graziano Pelle displays great vision and sends a pass to Sadio Mane (Southampton), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the right post. The score is 1:2.
Substitution. Oriol Romeu makes his way off the pitch and James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) comes on as his replacement.
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Daniel Sturridge is replaced by Christian Benteke (Liverpool).
Christian Benteke (Liverpool) takes a shot on goal, but his effort isn't precise enough and it flies a whisker wide of the left post.
Goal! Shane Long slips it to Graziano Pelle (Southampton) on the edge of the box and he finds the left side of the net with a great effort. The score is 2:2.
Goal Sadio Mane (Southampton)! Sadio Mane (Southampton) was put through by Graziano Pelle and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom right corner. 3:2.
The referee Roger East awards Sadio Mane (Southampton) a yellow card.
Joe Allen goes off the pitch and Sheyi Ojo (Liverpool) comes on.
The end of the second half.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Joleon Lescott (Aston Villa) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the right post.
Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes narrowly over the bar. Terrific solo effort, though.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Aly Cissokho (Aston Villa), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late. That's a free kick to Swansea.

Lukasz Fabianski pulls off a fantastic save! Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the right post, but the effort is kept out.
Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) announces himself with a close-range shot after a cross, but one of the defenders gets in the way of the ball to thwart him. Aston Villa have been awarded a corner kick.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Michael Dean has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Francesco Guidolin has made a change at the break. Leon Britton (Swansea) has come on in place of Sung-Yong Ki.

Federico Fernandez (Swansea) determinedly makes his way to the ball from the resulting set piece, but only manages to connect with his body. It's enough to beat the goalkeeper, however, and make it 0:0.
A yellow card for a tackle by Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea). Michael Dean doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Andre Green (Aston Villa) will replace Jordan Veretout.
Remi Garde decides to make a substitution. Carles Gil will be replaced by Gabriel Agbonlahor (Aston Villa).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Modou Barrow departs the field of play to be replaced by Kyle Naughton (Swansea).
Problems for Francesco Guidolin as Stephen Kingsley is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Wayne Routledge (Swansea) replaces him.
Today's referee Michael Dean rightly decides to book Wayne Routledge (Swansea) for his harsh tackle.
Joleon Lescott (Aston Villa) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Leon Britton (Swansea) sees a yellow card from Michael Dean after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. Aston Villa are awarded the free kick.

Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 20 metres out, but it missed the left post by a whisker.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.

Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) controls the ball with a great first touch just outside the penalty area after receiving a pass and smashes the ball into the roof of the net to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Winston Reid (West Ham) is booked by the referee.
Angelo Ogbonna (West Ham) receives a yellow card.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) scores a beautiful goal from the resulting free kick. He bends the ball into the top left corner. A technically stunning goal.
Robert Madley has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Robert Madley starts the second half.
It is time for a substitution. Pedro (Chelsea) is on for .
Oscar (Chelsea) does well to meet a cross from Branislav Ivanovic, but he directs his shot just wide of the left post.
Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) picks up a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that crashes against the bar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Diafra Sakho goes off the pitch and Andrew Carroll (West Ham) comes on.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort which ends up in the bottom left corner.
Guus Hiddink has decided to substitute Loic Remy and he is replaced by Bertrand Traore (Chelsea).
Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Emmanuel Emenike (West Ham) is coming onto the pitch as Enner Valencia cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Substitution. Manuel Lanzini did his best and is replaced by Pedro Obiang (West Ham).
Guus Hiddink has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea) replacing  Oscar.
A clumsy foul by Michail Antonio (West Ham) and Robert Madley blows his whistle. The referee points to the penalty spot. Chelsea are awarded a penalty kick!
The foul by Michail Antonio (West Ham) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Madley.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a shot into the bottom right corner.
Adrian (West Ham) says more than he should have to the referee and is shown a yellow card.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Willian (Chelsea).
Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.

Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Wayne Hennessey to get hold of the ball.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker.
The referee shows a yellow card to Kasper Schmeichel (Leicester). No wonder. A clear yellow for bad language.
Goal! Jamie Vardy produces a great pass that finds Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
Yannick Bolasie (Crystal Palace) gets inside the penalty area and sends a powerful shot that almost ends inside the net. The keeper is alert and makes a good save.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Pape Souare (Crystal Palace).
Mark Jones has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Emmanuel Adebayor is replaced by Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace).
Alan Pardew makes a switch. Martin Kelly (Crystal Palace) is coming on in place of Pape Souare at the start of the second period.
Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly over the crossbar.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) comes onto the pitch so that Shinji Okazaki can be given a rest.
Alan Pardew has decided to make a change. Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) replaces Joe Ledley.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Riyad Mahrez as he is replaced by Jeffery Schlupp (Leicester).
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) breaks into the penalty area but his shot is blocked. Leicester force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Substitution. Jamie Vardy leaves the pitch and is replaced by Daniel Amartey (Leicester).
Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace) smashed a volley without hesitation from near the penalty spot, but it only rattled the crossbar!
That's it for today, Mark Jones has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
What a sweet touch by Odion Ighalo (Watford) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Jack Butland to hold.
Goal! Phillip Bardsley passes the ball to the feet of Jonathan Walters (Stoke City), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 0:1.
Jose Manuel Jurado (Watford) wriggles into space inside the box with excellent ball control, but his effort on goal is well blocked. Watford have been awarded a corner kick.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Etienne Capoue (Watford) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Craig Pawson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Joselu (Stoke City) produces a nice first-time shot from a promising distance. Heurelho Gomes pulls off a quality save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Craig Pawson shows a yellow card to Allan Nyom (Watford), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Craig Pawson blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal! Jonathan Walters finds Joselu (Stoke City) on the edge of the area, he times his run to perfection and beautifully chips the ball over the goalkeeper. 0:2.
That will be all from Jose Manuel Jurado who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Nordin Amrabat (Watford).
Quique Flores prepares a substitution. Valon Behrami is replaced by Adlene Guedioura (Watford).

Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the right post is blocked by Heurelho Gomes, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Stoke have a corner.
Craig Pawson shows a yellow card to Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) for a tough tackle. Watford earn a free kick.
Substitution. Ikechi Anya (Watford) on for Nathan Ake.
The referee shows the yellow card to Adlene Guedioura (Watford).
Substitution. Marko Arnautovic makes way for Stephen Ireland (Stoke City).
Mark Hughes has decided to make a change. Mame Diouf (Stoke City) replaces Ibrahim Afellay.
Ikechi Anya showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Troy Deeney (Watford) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 1:2.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Claudio Yacob (West Brom) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom) makes a good run with the ball into the box, but mishits his shot as it goes well wide of the right post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Anthony Taylor has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Goal! Robbie Brady (Norwich) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 0:1. He was ably assisted there by Matthew Jarvis.
The referee signals a substitution. James McClean (West Brom) is brought on as a substitute for Jonas Olsson.
Craig Gardner (West Brom) stands over the resultant free kick from mid-range, but his shot goes just wide of the left post.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Patrick Bamford walks off the pitch to be replaced by Steven Naismith (Norwich).
Tony Pulis decides to make a substitution. Craig Gardner will be replaced by Alex Pritchard (West Brom).
Alex Neil is forced to make a change. Robbie Brady is unable to continue due to injury, Vadis Odjidja-Ofoe (Norwich) comes on.
Vadis Odjidja-Ofoe (Norwich) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
The substitution has been made. Rickie Lambert (West Brom) has replaced Stephane Sessegnon.
Gareth McAuley (West Brom) has tested the patience of referee Anthony Taylor and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Substitution. Ivo Pinto (Norwich) replaces Matthew Jarvis.
Jonathan Howson (Norwich) has received a yellow card for his foul.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
Goal! Alexis Sanchez plays in Danny Welbeck (Arsenal), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box slots it into the bottom right corner 0:1.

Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Joel Robles is just a bystander as the ball flies low into the middle of the goal. The score is 0:2.
What a big chance! Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Roberto Martinez has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. John Stones (Everton) comes on the pitch for Muhamed Besic.

Phil Jagielka (Everton) leaps to meet an excellent cross on the edge of the penalty box and sends in a fantastic header towards the roof of the net. The opponent’s defence, however, master the situation well and keeps the ball out. Corner kick. Everton will have an opportunity.
Ross Barkley goes off the pitch and Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) comes on.
Mesut Ozil is substituted due to injury. Arsene Wenger gives a chance to Kieran Gibbs (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger prepares a substitution. Danny Welbeck is replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).
Goal disallowed! Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) scores but Mark Clattenburg blows his whistle for a foul.
It is time for a substitution. Calum Chambers (Arsenal) is on for Alex Iwobi.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
What a chance that is! Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header narrowly wide of the left post.

What a GOAL that is! Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) showed great determination to get to the ball inside the box and acrobatically launched himself into the air and produced a scissor kick of the highest quality to leave Rob Elliot helpless. He makes it 1:0.
CLOSE! Marc Albrighton (Leicester) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post!
Substitution. Vurnon Anita leaves the pitch and is replaced by Andros Townsend (Newcastle Utd).
Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) connects with a pass but sees his shot from the edge of the box blocked. The ball is out of play. Newcastle win a corner kick.
It is time for a substitution. Jeffery Schlupp (Leicester) is on for Shinji Okazaki.
Substitution. Ayoze Perez is replaced by Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd).
Claudio Ranieri has decided to substitute Marc Albrighton and he is replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester).
Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) strikes a volley towards goal, but one of the defenders blocks his effort. Newcastle win a corner.
Rafael Benitez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Seydou Doumbia (Newcastle Utd) replacing Jonjo Shelvey.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Harry Kane (Tottenham) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

Brad Guzan pulls off a great save to deny Harry Kane (Tottenham) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal. The ball goes out for a corner. Tottenham can continue in their attacking effort.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Brad Guzan.
Erik Lamela (Tottenham) wasted a clear opportunity. He fired a first-time shot from point-blank range, but it rattled the right post.
Goal - 0:1! Dele Alli tees up Harry Kane (Tottenham) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Brad Guzan.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
GOAL! Superb work from Dele Alli, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Harry Kane (Tottenham), who beats Brad Guzan with a brilliant shot into the top left corner. 0:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jordan Veretout departs the field of play to be replaced by Andre Green (Aston Villa).
Remi Garde decides to make a substitution. Carles Gil will be replaced by Scott Sinclair (Aston Villa).

Erik Lamela (Tottenham) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort. The referee signals a corner kick to Tottenham.
The substitution has been made. Thomas Carroll (Tottenham) has replaced Christian Eriksen.
Off the post! Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range bounced off the left post.
Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) fires a rebound from close range onto the bar!
Substitution. Ryan Mason (Tottenham) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Dele Alli walks off.
The corner kick falls to Joleon Lescott (Aston Villa), who does his best to finish. The snap shot, however, only marks the left post!
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to make a change. Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) replaces Erik Lamela.
Anthony Taylor is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

Great ball in from Max Gradel. Joshua King (Bournemouth) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.

Andrew Surman (Bournemouth) lashes in a mid-range free kick and his effort crashes against the left post. That was an excellent shot, but unfortunately for him it didn't end up in the back of the net.

Goal! Max Gradel (Bournemouth) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.

The second half gets underway.

Goal Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea)! Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) was put through by Modou Barrow and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the left side of the net. 2:2.

Alberto Paloschi (Swansea) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Artur Boruc. The ball is out of play. Swansea will have a chance to score from a corner.

Gianelli Imbula (Stoke City) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post.
Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.

Graziano Pelle (Southampton) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the roof of the net. His effort, however, is blocked by Jack Butland, who pulls off a stunning save! The linesman points to the corner flag, Southampton are going to take it.
Steven Davis sends the resulting corner into the box and expertly finds Graziano Pelle (Southampton), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the roof of the net. It's 0:1.

Jack Butland was forced into action to thwart Shane Long (Southampton). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper. Southampton will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Glenn Whelan (Stoke City) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Southampton will have a goal kick.
Great ball in from Glenn Whelan. Mame Diouf (Stoke City) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.
It's in the back of the net! Dusan Tadic slips the ball through to Graziano Pelle (Southampton), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:2.
Mark Hughes is forced to make a change. Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Bojan Krkic.
A superb shot by Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) after a mid-range free kick! His attempt, however, flies just over the crossbar.

The defence had a hard time blocking out the strike from Bojan Krkic (Stoke City). He didn't hesitate and finished from outside the box right after he had received a pass from his teammate.

Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Jonathan Moss didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Craig Pawson blows his whistle to start the second half.
Louis van Gaal is forced to make a change. Marcos Rojo is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Timothy Fosu-Mensah (Manchester United).
Morgan Schneiderlin (Manchester United) receives the ball inside the box from the resulting free kick, but fails to score as his shot is blocked by one of the defenders.
Substitution. Theo Walcott walks off the pitch and Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) comes on as a substitute.
Goal! Marcus Rashford passes the ball to Ander Herrera (Manchester United) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Petr Cech couldn't do anything about it. 3:1.

A nice lofted cross finds Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) unmarked and he displays an excellent touch to control the ball. Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) drills a low shot towards the middle of the net, but doesn't give the goalkeeper anything to worry about. An easy save.
Goal! Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 3:2.
Arsene Wenger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal) replacing Francis Coquelin.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) gets a yellow card. The referee Craig Pawson made the right call.
Ander Herrera (Manchester United) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Today's match ends for Marcus Rashford who will be replaced by Adnan Januzaj (Manchester United).
The substitution has been made. Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) has replaced Danny Welbeck.
Craig Pawson shows the yellow card to Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) for a heavy challenge.
Adnan Januzaj (Manchester United) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
The game has come to an end for Ander Herrera. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of James Weir (Manchester United).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.

Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Hugo Lloris. The ball goes out for a corner. Swansea can continue in their attacking effort.
Chance! Erik Lamela (Tottenham) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Danny Rose, but his shot from inside the box flashes just over the bar.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Lukasz Fabianski is alert and denies him with a nice save. The linesman points to the corner flag, Tottenham are going to take it.
Goal! Alberto Paloschi (Swansea) fires the rebound into the top right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.

Ashley Williams (Swansea) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Mike Jones didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket. Tottenham win a free kick.

Lukasz Fabianski can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Heung-Min Son (Tottenham). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Alberto Paloschi (Swansea) makes a good run into the box to meet a cross and fires the ball in on goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender.
Mike Jones rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Alberto Paloschi (Swansea).

Eric Dier (Tottenham) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Lukasz Fabianski to get hold of the ball.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) releases a promising shot from the free kick from around 25 metres out. The ball goes towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a save and denies him.
The foul by Danny Rose (Tottenham) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Mike Jones.
Today's referee Mike Jones rightly decides to book Andre Ayew (Swansea) for his harsh tackle. Tottenham earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) shoots at goal from the free kick from some 22 metres out. His attempt was quite precise and another few inches and it would have ended up inside the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) comes onto the pitch so that Erik Lamela can be given a rest.

Lukasz Fabianski had to pull off an exquisite save to thwart a knuckleball from Danny Rose (Tottenham), even though it only went towards the middle of the target. The ball goes out of play. Tottenham are awarded a corner kick.
Goal! Kyle Walker provides Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
A substitution has been made. Heung-Min Son goes off and Ryan Mason (Tottenham) comes on.
Francesco Guidolin prepares a substitution. Leon Britton is replaced by Leroy Fer (Swansea).
Danny Rose (Tottenham) controls the ball from the resulting corner kick and smashes a low drive into the bottom right corner. Excellent finish!
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Kyle Walker (Tottenham) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) is coming onto the pitch as Sung-Yong Ki cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to substitute Harry Kane and he is replaced by Joshua Onomah (Tottenham).
Substitution. Modou Barrow (Swansea) in, Alberto Paloschi out.
The booking goes to Kyle Walker (Tottenham).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Salomon Rondon (West Brom) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Wayne Hennessey is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Goal! Craig Gardner (West Brom) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:0.
The foul by Craig Dawson (West Brom) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jonathan Moss.

Goal! Craig Dawson (West Brom) peels away from his marker to meet the resulting free kick from Craig Gardner, and he steers a powerful header from near the penalty spot low inside the right post. What a finish that is - 2:0!
Emmanuel Adebayor (Crystal Palace) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Jonathan Moss ignores the protests.

What a goal! Stephane Sessegnon plays it to Saido Berahino (West Brom), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Wayne Hennessey into the right side of the goal. 3:0.
Chris Brunt is being substituted because of an injury. Tony Pulis sends James Chester (West Brom) on the pitch.
Craig Dawson (West Brom) strikes the ball from the free kick and his effort rattles the left post!
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. Crystal Palace earn a corner.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
Alan Pardew has made a change at the break. Yannick Bolasie (Crystal Palace) has come on in place of Emmanuel Adebayor.
Connor Wickham (Crystal Palace) displays great tekkers inside the box leading to a fantastic goal, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.
OFF THE POST! Good play from Saido Berahino (West Brom) as skips past two defending players and from the edge of the box unleashes a decent strike that smashes against the crossbar!
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) sees a yellow card from Jonathan Moss after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Here comes a substitution. Stephane Sessegnon is given a rest as he is replaced by James McClean (West Brom).
What a big chance! Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to James Chester (West Brom) for a tough tackle. A free kick has been awarded to Crystal Palace.
Alan Pardew has decided to make a change. Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) replaces Yohan Cabaye.
Jordon Mutch (Crystal Palace) delivers a fine ball into the box from a free kick. However, the opposition's defence make sure none of his teammates get a challenge in on the goalkeeper.
Goal! Connor Wickham (Crystal Palace) fires the rebound into the top right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:2.
The substitution is prepared. Mile Jedinak (Crystal Palace) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Joe Ledley.
Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) gets himself onto the end of the corner, but his header is blocked.
Today's match ends for Jose Rondon who will be replaced by Sandro (West Brom).
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked.
Cameron Jerome (Norwich) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.

Cameron Jerome (Norwich) blows a clear opportunity to score a goal. He was one-on-one with Kasper Schmeichel inside the six-yard box and attempted to put the ball into the bottom right corner, but was denied by a great save. Norwich force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
The end of the first half.
Referee Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle to start the second half.
Steven Naismith (Norwich) tackles a bit over-zealously and Neil Swarbrick blows for a foul. A yellow-coloured card is received by Steven Naismith (Norwich).
It's a yellow card for Ryan Bennett (Norwich).
Claudio Ranieri has decided to make a change. Jeffrey Schlupp (Leicester) replaces Shinji Okazaki.
That will be all from N'Golo Kante who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Andy King (Leicester).
Substitution. Daniel Amartey is replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester).
Steven Naismith goes off the pitch and Matthew Jarvis (Norwich) comes on.
Goal! Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:0. He was ably assisted there by Jamie Vardy.
The substitution has been made. Patrick Bamford (Norwich) has replaced Cameron Jerome.
Timm Klose comes off the pitch to be replaced by Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich).
This would have been a magnificent goal from Patrick Bamford (Norwich), who collected the ball inside the box and prodded a first-time shot on goal that flew just narrowly wide of the left post.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Guus Hiddink is forced to make a change. Pedro is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by  Oscar (Chelsea).

Shane Long (Southampton) has a big opportunity to score! He climbs highest deep inside the penalty box and strikes a powerful header towards the goal. Next time he should aim better as his effort flies narrowly over the bar.
Steven Davis (Southampton) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Martin Atkinson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Oscar (Chelsea) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and drills a nice strike from a promising distance towards the middle of the goal. Fraser Forster has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar.
Good team movement sets up Charlie Austin (Southampton) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) wastes a big chance! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and it goes narrowly over the crossbar.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Shane Long (Southampton), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Guus Hiddink makes a half-time substitution. Kenedy (Chelsea) comes on in place of Baba Rahman.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) skips perfectly past challenges but misdirects his shot from the edge of the box. The ball flies a few yards over the bar.
John Obi Mikel (Chelsea) covers his face with his hands after wasting a glorious chance. The ball rebounded to him but his close-range header went a whisker wide of the left post.
It wasn't the best example of how to strike the ball. Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) unleashed a first-time shot from the edge of the box that went high over the crossbar.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) gets on the end of a cross from Eden Hazard, but his shot goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Diego Costa (Chelsea) for a tough tackle.
Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) sees a yellow card from Martin Atkinson after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Today's referee Martin Atkinson rightly decides to book Jordy Clasie (Southampton) for his harsh tackle.
Virgil Van Dijk (Southampton) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting corner and steers his header into the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper pulls off an astonishing save to deny him.
Ronald Koeman is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Shane Long suffers an injury and Graziano Pelle (Southampton) comes on.
Brilliant finish! Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Diego Costa, then produced a nice strike into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:1.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Charlie Austin as he is replaced by Sadio Mane (Southampton).
Willian (Chelsea) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the right post. Terrific solo effort, though.
Oscar (Chelsea) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the middle of the target, but Fraser Forster was alert and the score remains the same.

Graziano Pelle (Southampton) found himself in a promising position. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a shot from just outside the penalty area which went towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper was ready and made a decent save.

Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) outjumps the defenders inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a header into the middle of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 1:2.
Ronald Koeman decides to make a substitution. Matt Targett will be replaced by James Ward-Prowse (Southampton).
A substitution has been made. Eden Hazard is replaced by Nemanja Matic (Chelsea).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Giannelli Imbula (Stoke City) breaks into the penalty area but his shot is blocked.

Idrissa Gueye (Aston Villa) trips an opposition player and Kevin Friend signals a foul. Yellow card! It's like Idrissa Gueye (Aston Villa) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Kevin Friend agrees and books him.
Alan Hutton (Aston Villa) receives a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) tackles a bit over-zealously and Kevin Friend blows for a foul. It's a penalty! Stoke have an opportunity to score from the penalty spot.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) takes the penalty and perfectly sends the ball inside the left post.
Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) shows his incredible technical ability by sending the ball into free space and Marko Arnautovic latches onto his pass.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) was in the right place to put the ball into the back of the net with his body. It's 0:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Carles Gil trots off the pitch and is replaced by Scott Sinclair (Aston Villa).
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Bojan Krkic (Stoke City) is coming onto the pitch as Ibrahim Afellay cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Mark Hughes decides to make a substitution. Jonathan Walters will be replaced by Joselu (Stoke City).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) comes onto the pitch so that Jordan Veretout can be given a rest.
Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa) picks up the ball in the penalty area and finds the back of the net with a superb strike that goes inside the left post!
Marko Arnautovic comes off the pitch to be replaced by Mame Diouf (Stoke City).
Jores Okore (Aston Villa) is penalised for holding. Kevin Friend signals a set piece. The booking goes to Jores Okore (Aston Villa).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Junior Stanislas is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Max Gradel (Bournemouth).
Anthony Taylor has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Anthony Taylor starts the second half.
Max Gradel (Bournemouth) received a precise pass and hammers the ball at goal from close range. Unfortunately for him, his aim was a bit off and it flies just over the bar.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mario Suarez (Watford) is coming onto the pitch as Etienne Capoue cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Harry Arter (Bournemouth) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the right post is blocked by Heurelho Gomes, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The ball is out of play. Bournemouth will have a chance to score from a corner.
Odion Ighalo (Watford) meets a cross inside the box and heads it goalwards. Unfortunately for him, he sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a chance!
Substitution. Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) replaces Benik Afobe.
Ben Watson (Watford) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.

Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) clutches his head in despair after he blew a huge opportunity! He received the ball from the free kick, took a good first touch and unleashed a projectile from close range to the left side of the goal, but Heurelho Gomes makes a nice save.

Max Gradel (Bournemouth) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Heurelho Gomes shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Valon Behrami (Watford) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nordin Amrabat departs the field of play to be replaced by Almen Abdi (Watford).
Andrew Surman (Bournemouth) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Eddie Howe has decided to substitute Matt Ritchie and he is replaced by Glenn Murray (Bournemouth).
Craig Cathcart (Watford) has tested the patience of referee Anthony Taylor and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Max Gradel (Bournemouth) is quick to pounce on the rebound inside the penalty area and fires in a shot towards the roof of the net, but is denied by a reflex save from Heurelho Gomes. Bournemouth force their opponents to concede a corner.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Mark Noble (West Ham) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the roof of the net, but Vito Mannone was alert and the score remains the same.
Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland) takes a mid-range free kick and his stunning strike crashes against the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and West Ham will have a goal kick.

An amazing individual effort from Michail Antonio (West Ham) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom left corner and makes it 1:0. Vito Mannone was helpless.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) meets a cross from the flank and pulls the trigger from the edge of the box, but the ball flies high over the bar. High, wide and not at all pretty.

Michail Antonio (West Ham) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the right side of the target, but Vito Mannone easily deals with the threat. The ball goes behind for a corner. West Ham will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker.
CHANCE! Wahbi Khazri finds Patrick van Aanholt (Sunderland) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just over the bar!
The manager makes a subsitution with Andrew Carroll (West Ham) coming on for Emmanuel Emenike.
Jan Kirchhoff picks out Yann M'Vila (Sunderland), who drives a shot just wide of the right post from the edge of the box. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for West Ham.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Manuel Lanzini departs the field of play to be replaced by Victor Moses (West Ham).
Samuel Allardyce has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jack Rodwell (Sunderland) replacing Lee Cattermole.
Dimitri Payet (West Ham) misses a rebound from close range. His effort floats narrowly over the crossbar!
Victor Moses (West Ham) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the bottom left corner, but is thwarted by a great save from Vito Mannone.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Samuel Byram (West Ham), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late. Free kick. Sunderland will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.
Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland) sends in a direct shot from a dangerously positioned free kick. The ball sails towards the left post, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save.
Adrian pulls off a great save to deny Jack Rodwell (Sunderland) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.

OFF THE BAR! Andrew Carroll (West Ham) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the crossbar! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Jack Rodwell (Sunderland) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender. The ball goes out of play. Sunderland are awarded a corner kick.
Adrian was forced into action to thwart Dame N'Doye (Sunderland). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Substitution. Pedro Obiang (West Ham) replaces Mark Noble.
What a chance that is! Dimitri Payet (West Ham) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) wins the ball from the resulting corner but blazes it well over the bar.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
The foul by Eric Dier (Tottenham) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Mark Clattenburg.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Mark Clattenburg shows a yellow card to Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) for a tough tackle.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) misses a big chance! He fires the ball high over the crossbar from inside the 6-yard box after the ball rebounded to him. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Tottenham.

The referee blows his whistle after Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) does a good impression of a basketball player and handles the ball. It's a penalty! Tottenham have an opportunity to score from the penalty spot.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) is going to take the penalty!
Harry Kane (Tottenham) sends Joe Hart the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
A yellow card for a tackle by Kevin Wimmer (Tottenham). Mark Clattenburg doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Manchester City are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Yaya Toure (Manchester City) tries to beat the goalkeeper from a set piece from some 18 metres out. He's very close, but his effort only bounces off the crossbar!
It is time for a substitution. Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) is on for Fernando.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Thomas Carroll (Tottenham) comes onto the pitch so that Heung-Min Son can be given a rest.
Goal Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City)! Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) was put through by Gael Clichy and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the top left corner. 1:1.
Manuel Pellegrini decides to make a substitution. Gael Clichy will be replaced by Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City).
Thomas Carroll (Tottenham) sees a yellow card from Mark Clattenburg after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to substitute Dele Alli and he is replaced by Erik Lamela (Tottenham).
Fantastic team goal! Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) was set free in the area by Erik Lamela and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom right corner. 1:2.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) will replace Harry Kane.
David Silva (Manchester City) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

It's in the back of the net! Philippe Coutinho sends a superb cross into the box. Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header inside the left post, leaving Mark Bunn beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
James Milner (Liverpool) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up inside the right post.

Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. Good work from Liverpool as they win a corner.

Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Mark Bunn guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa) for a tough tackle.

Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball towards the left-hand post. However, he couldn't beat Mark Bunn, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Problems for Remi Garde as Gabriel Agbonlahor is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Scott Sinclair (Aston Villa) replaces him.
Emre Can (Liverpool) collected a pass and decided to shoot from about 20 metres out. He hit it perfectly! The ball zoomed around the goalkeeper and ended up in the bottom left corner.

Simon Mignolet was forced into action to thwart Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Jurgen Klopp decides to make a substitution. Daniel Sturridge will be replaced by Divock Origi (Liverpool).
It's in the back of the net! Philippe Coutinho is the provider as he slips the ball to Divock Origi (Liverpool) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 0:4.
The foul by Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Neil Swarbrick.
Goal 0:5! Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Here's the change. Philippe Coutinho leaves the pitch and Kevin Stewart (Liverpool) comes on as a substitute.
Remi Garde has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jordan Lyden (Aston Villa) replacing Leandro Bacuna.
The corner from Jordan Henderson goes into a dangerous area and finds Kolo Toure (Liverpool), who outjumps the defence and glances a header into the back of the net. 0:2.
The substitution has been made. Christian Benteke (Liverpool) has replaced Roberto Firmino.
Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Jordan Veretout (Aston Villa), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Scott Sinclair (Aston Villa) collects an accurate pass and tries his luck from about 20 metres. He was very close to scoring, but the ball ends up hitting the right post.
Today's referee Neil Swarbrick rightly decides to book Kevin Stewart (Liverpool) for his harsh tackle. Aston Villa have been awarded a free kick.
Alan Hutton (Aston Villa) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Micah Richards.
That's it for today, Neil Swarbrick has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and leaps to connect with a cross from the corner kick. He produces a fine header, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the bottom left corner. The effort, however, is blocked by Petr Cech, who pulls off a stunning save!

What a goal-scoring opportunity! Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) finds some space inside the box and fires a volley at goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender. Arsenal have been awarded a corner kick.
A goal, which was scored by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal), was disallowed due to offside.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) for his blatant foul.

N'Golo Kante (Leicester) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the top right corner, but Petr Cech was alert and the score remains the same. The referee points to the corner flag and Leicester will take a corner.
Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) tackles a bit over-zealously and Martin Atkinson blows for a foul. The referee points to the penalty spot. PENALTY to Leicester!
Today's referee Martin Atkinson rightly decides to book Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) for his harsh tackle.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) is going to take the penalty!
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) fires the penalty into the right side of the net!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) was quite harsh and Martin Atkinson didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Martin Atkinson has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Arsene Wenger gives a chance to Calum Chambers (Arsenal) and Laurent Koscielny is off.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) unleashes a decent effort from just outside the box which goes narrowly wide of the left post.
The foul by Danny Simpson (Leicester) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Martin Atkinson.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Christian Fuchs (Leicester) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Martin Atkinson blows his whistle and Danny Simpson (Leicester) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
N'Golo Kante (Leicester) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Martin Atkinson had an easy-decision to make.
Claudio Ranieri is forced to make a tactical change due to a red card. Riyad Mahrez will be replaced by Marcin Wasilewski (Leicester).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Shinji Okazaki trots off the pitch and is replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
Arsene Wenger has decided to make a change. Theo Walcott (Arsenal) replaces Francis Coquelin.
Gooal! Theo Walcott (Arsenal) scores with a shot from inside the box after latching onto a headed pass from Olivier Giroud. He makes it 1:1.
Golden chance! Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Good team movement sets up Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marc Albrighton departs the field of play to be replaced by Andy King (Leicester).
Here is a change. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain is going off and Arsene Wenger gives the last tactical orders to Danny Welbeck (Arsenal).
What a chance that is! Mesut Ozil swings the ball into the box, and Per Mertesacker (Arsenal) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the left post.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
Marcin Wasilewski (Leicester) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Martin Atkinson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) celebrates a beautiful goal. He wins the ball inside the box from the free kick and plants a header inside the left post. 2:1.
The referee Martin Atkinson awards Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) a yellow card.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
It's in the back of the net! Willian is the provider as he slips the ball to Diego Costa (Chelsea) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 1:0.
GOAL! Pedro (Chelsea) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 2:0.
Willian (Chelsea) scores a goal! He latches onto a lovely pass that puts him one-on-one with the keeper before producing a fine strike that goes into the left side of the net!
Steven Taylor (Newcastle Utd) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Wow, what an escape. Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. The ball goes out of play. Chelsea are awarded a corner kick.
CHANCE! Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a shot towards Thibaut Courtois, who produces an excellent reflex save.
Pedro (Chelsea) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Guus Hiddink is forced to make a change. John Terry is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Baba Rahman (Chelsea).
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Steve McClaren has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Jack Colback (Newcastle Utd) comes on the pitch for Georginio Wijnaldum.

Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) blows an opportunity as he sends a rebound from just outside of the box narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Chelsea will have a goal kick.
It's a goal! Pedro (Chelsea) scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Cesc Fabregas. The score is now 3:0.
The substitution is prepared. Bertrand Traore (Chelsea) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Diego Costa.
Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
It is time for a substitution. Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) is on for Cheik Tiote.
Here's the change. Aleksandar Mitrovic leaves the pitch and Seydou Doumbia (Newcastle Utd) comes on as a substitute.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Willian will be replaced by Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea).
Goal! Cesar Azpilicueta plays a pass to the feet of Bertrand Traore (Chelsea), and he shoots into the bottom right corner from inside the box. It's 5:0.

Eden Hazard (Chelsea) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Newcastle.

Andros Townsend (Newcastle Utd) scores with a great individual effort! He makes a good run, skips past defenders and smashes the ball from the edge of the box past the diving goalkeeper. His low drive went into the bottom left corner. Absolutely phenomenal!
That's all for today as the game is over.
