Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Gianelli Imbula (Stoke City) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot inside the right post. His attempt was beyond the reach of Artur Boruc, so the score changes to 0:1.
What a chance! The ball is inside the box and Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) takes a first-time shot on goal, but his volley goes narrowly wide of the left post.
The foul by Mame Diouf (Stoke City) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Graham Scott.
Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) sees a yellow card from Graham Scott after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. There is a free kick near the sideline to Stoke.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.

What a chance that is! Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Marc Muniesa is replaced by Teixeira (Stoke City).
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Eddie Howe gives a chance to Matt Ritchie (Bournemouth) and Dan Gosling is off.
Half-time substitution. Marc Pugh is replaced by Joshua King (Bournemouth).
Matt Ritchie (Bournemouth) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Goal - 1:3! Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the right post. Jonathan Walters provided an assist for the goal.
Glen Johnson is substituted due to injury. Mark Hughes gives a chance to Joselu (Stoke City).

It's a goal! Joselu (Stoke City) makes it 0:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Xherdan Shaqiri and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Artur Boruc was helpless.
Goal! Matt Ritchie (Bournemouth) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot inside the right post. Charlie Daniels assisted in the goal. 0:1.
Chance! Matt Ritchie (Bournemouth) was in a good position inside the box, but he couldn't connect with the pass as it was overhit.
Andrew Surman (Bournemouth) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Here is a change. Junior Stanislas is going off and Eddie Howe gives the last tactical orders to Juan Iturbe (Bournemouth).
Simon Francis (Bournemouth) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Graham Scott ignores the protests. Stoke get a free kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Stephen Ireland (Stoke City) comes onto the pitch so that Ibrahim Afellay can be given a rest.
A yellow card for a tackle by Harry Arter (Bournemouth). Graham Scott doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Graham Scott shows a yellow card to Giannelli Imbula (Stoke City) for a tough tackle.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.

Mile Jedinak (Crystal Palace) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Robert Madley blows his whistle for a foul. It's a penalty! Watford have an opportunity to score from the penalty spot.
Troy Deeney (Watford) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Troy Deeney (Watford) steps up and confidently powers the spot kick into the bottom left corner.
What an excellent shot, but not the luckiest one. Odion Ighalo (Watford) fires the ball from inside the penalty box but it only hits the left post!
Nordin Amrabat (Watford) gets to the rebound inside the box and shoots goalwards, but his sidefooter is blocked by an alert Wayne Hennessey. What a save!
Emmanuel Adebayor (Crystal Palace) heads the ball under the bar after a splendid cross. This timely header produces a wonderful moment.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Madley has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Alan Pardew makes a half-time substitution. Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace) comes on in place of Connor Wickham.
Heurelho Gomes pulls off a great save to deny Emmanuel Adebayor (Crystal Palace), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.
It is time for a substitution. Almen Abdi (Watford) is on for Nordin Amrabat.
Today's match ends for Etienne Capoue who will be replaced by Mario Suarez (Watford).
Alan Pardew has decided to substitute Jordon Mutch and he is replaced by Fraizer Campbell (Crystal Palace).

Emmanuel Adebayor (Crystal Palace) gets to a cross from the corner kick inside the penalty area and rises high to plant a header towards the top right corner. Heurelho Gomes splendidly saves the attempt by punching the ball onto the post.

Odion Ighalo (Watford) blew a promising chance when he got to a rebound just outside the penalty area. He struck it towards the bottom right corner, but Wayne Hennessey pulled off a nice save to stop the attempt.
Mario Suarez (Watford) sees a yellow card from Robert Madley after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Goal! Troy Deeney (Watford) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 1:2.
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) fires a rebound from mid-range onto the left post!
That was really pointless! Pape Souare (Crystal Palace) made a mindless challenge and the referee Robert Madley showed him a red card.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Jose Rondon (West Brom) was in the right place to put the ball into the back of the net with his body. It's 0:0.

What a chance that is! Ross Barkley (Everton) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the right post!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Michael Oliver has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
A yellow card for a tackle by James McClean (West Brom). Michael Oliver doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The yellow card goes to Darren Fletcher (West Brom).
A substitution has been made. James McClean goes off and Chris Brunt (West Brom) comes on.
Roberto Martinez has decided to substitute Tom Cleverley and he is replaced by Arouna Kone (Everton).
Chris Brunt (West Brom) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Gareth Barry (Everton), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Substitution. Jose Rondon makes way for Victor Anichebe (West Brom).
Roberto Martinez has decided to make a change. Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) replaces Aaron Lennon.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Ben Foster (West Brom).

Gareth Barry (Everton) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it. Everton earn a corner.
Substitution. Leon Osman (Everton) has come on for James McCarthy.
Chris Brunt (West Brom) is very lucky to stay on the pitch after using excessive force to bring down his opponent with a two-footed challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sandro (West Brom) comes onto the pitch for Saido Berahino.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.

John Ruddy was forced into action to thwart Enner Valencia (West Ham). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a strike to the top left corner but couldn't beat the keeper. The ball goes out of play. West Ham are awarded a corner kick.
James Collins (West Ham) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
The game has begun to heat up. Pedro Obiang (West Ham) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
What a chance that is! Jonathan Howson (Norwich) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar.
The foul by Steven Naismith (Norwich) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Mike Jones.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Mike Jones has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Cameron Jerome (Norwich) collects a pass and has an effort from 22 metres out, but it flies just wide of the right post.
Robbie Brady (Norwich) scores a goal! He makes his way to the edge of the box without any help from his teammates and unleashes a shot that bounces off the crossbar and ends in the goal.
It is time for a substitution. Andrew Carroll (West Ham) is on for Enner Valencia.
Here is a change. Alex Song is going off and Slaven Bilic gives the last tactical orders to Victor Moses (West Ham).

Steven Naismith (Norwich) unleashed a monstrous piledriver. He controlled a pass, glanced up at goal and shot from the edge of the box. It could have been a difficult one for the keeper, but the ball fortunately hit one of the defenders and ball bounced away.
Goal! Wesley Hoolahan (Norwich) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 2:0.
Michail Antonio (West Ham) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by John Ruddy, who pulls off a decent save!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Emmanuel Emenike (West Ham) is coming onto the pitch as Michail Antonio cannot continue after picking up an injury.

John Ruddy can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stopped the close-range effort from Victor Moses (West Ham). The ball would have probably ended up in the bottom right corner.
Goal! Dimitri Payet (West Ham) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 2:1.
Steven Naismith will be replaced by Martin Olsson (Norwich).

It's in! Dimitri Payet spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Mark Noble (West Ham) doesn't think twice and curls a first-time shot into the top right corner. The score is now 2:2.
The substitution has been made. Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) has replaced Cameron Jerome.
Alex Neil has decided to substitute Wesley Hoolahan and he is replaced by Graham Dorrans (Norwich).
Close! Emmanuel Emenike (West Ham) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot narrowly over the bar.
Mike Jones shows the yellow card to Jonathan Howson (Norwich) for a heavy challenge.
That's it for today, Mike Jones has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Yellow card. Oriol Romeu (Southampton) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) gets to the ball in the penalty box and immediately fires a first-time effort. He didn't hit the ball properly and skies it high over the crossbar.
Shane Long (Southampton) rises above the defenders and places a towering header towards the middle of the goal, but Lukasz Fabianski is prepared to thwart his effort.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Jonathan Moss blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal disallowed! Jose Fonte (Southampton) scores but Jonathan Moss blows his whistle for a foul.
Wayne Routledge goes off the pitch and Modou Barrow (Swansea) comes on.
Ronald Koeman has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Cedric Soares (Southampton) replacing Oriol Romeu.
The referee shows the yellow card to Jordy Clasie (Southampton).
Substitution. Angel Rangel is replaced by Kyle Naughton (Swansea).

A perfect lofted pass from James Ward-Prowse finds Shane Long (Southampton), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header in the countermovement of the goalkeeper. His effort was both strong and precise, and Lukasz Fabianski had no chance of stopping that. 0:0.
The substitution has been made. Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) has replaced Leon Britton.
Ronald Koeman has decided to substitute Graziano Pelle and he is replaced by Charlie Austin (Southampton).

Modou Barrow (Swansea) bursts into the penalty area with the ball at his feet after a wonderful individual effort that left fans breathless and in awe. However, he sends the ball in a completely different direction than intended, well wide of the target.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Maya Yoshida (Southampton) for Matt Targett.

Charlie Austin (Southampton) has a good chance to score with a mid-range attempt after collecting a pass. He aims for the top right corner, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Lukasz Fabianski.
Booking. James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) receives a caution from the referee.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland) scores the goal from the free kick. The ball goes in the back of the net as it bounces in off the right post.
What a huge chance for Jermain Defoe (Sunderland). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Jan Kirchhoff is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Jack Rodwell (Sunderland).

Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Vito Mannone, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Donald Love (Manchester United) for Matteo Darmian.
The referee Andre Marriner awards DeAndre Yedlin (Sunderland) a yellow card.

Vito Mannone receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed for the bottom left corner.
Goal 1:1! Anthony Martial (Manchester United) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
A yellow card for a tackle by John O'Shea (Sunderland). Andre Marriner doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The game has begun to heat up. Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) for his blatant foul.
Michael Carrick (Manchester United) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Andre Marriner had an easy-decision to make.

Dame N'Doye (Sunderland) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. David de Gea is alert and denies him with a nice save. It will be a corner kick for Sunderland.
Substitution. Memphis Depay (Manchester United) has come on for Jesse Lingard.
Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for David de Gea to dive and make a save.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Jermain Defoe as he is replaced by Fabio Borini (Sunderland).

Dame N'Doye (Sunderland) latched on to an accurate pass just outside the box and immediately lashed the ball towards the top left corner. His effort was thwarted by David de Gea, who pulled off a stunning save. Sunderland force a corner. They send men into the box.
Lamine Kone (Sunderland) has a shot blocked from inside the box.
What an unlucky own goal by David de Gea (Manchester United)!
Lee Cattermole comes off the pitch to be replaced by Ola Toivonen (Sunderland).
Louis van Gaal decides to make a substitution. Morgan Schneiderlin will be replaced by Will Keane (Manchester United).

What an amazing save by Vito Mannone! Memphis Depay (Manchester United) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the right side of the goal, but fails.
That's it for today, Andre Marriner has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

Anthony Martial (Manchester United) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the top right corner is blocked by Thibaut Courtois, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Manchester Utd will take a corner kick.
Golden chance! Diego Costa (Chelsea) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Michael Oliver blows his whistle to start the second half.

Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Thibaut Courtois makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom left corner.

Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Thibaut Courtois pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Oscar comes off the pitch to be replaced by Eden Hazard (Chelsea).
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Kurt Zouma leaves the pitch to be replaced by Gary Cahill (Chelsea).
Fantastic team goal! Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) was set free in the area by Wayne Rooney and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the top right corner. 0:1.
Yellow card. Daley Blind (Manchester United) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Substitution. Pedro (Chelsea) has come on for Nemanja Matic.

Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball towards the top left corner. However, he couldn't beat David de Gea, who shows his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save. The referee points to the corner flag and Chelsea will take a corner.

Superb touch by Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) as he receives a precise pass into the box. He finds the keeper prepared as he unleashes his shot towards the top right corner. Wonderful save! The referee blows his whistle, Chelsea are awarded a corner kick.
The referee signals a substitution. Morgan Schneiderlin (Manchester United) is brought on as a substitute for Marouane Fellaini.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) was quite harsh and Michael Oliver didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Chris Smalling (Manchester United) receives a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jesse Lingard leaves the pitch and Memphis Depay (Manchester United) comes on.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) receives a great chance inside the box and finds the back of the net with a low drive that goes into the middle of the net.
Substitution. Juan Manuel Mata did his best and is replaced by Ander Herrera (Manchester United).

Diego Costa (Chelsea) skips past a few defenders in the penalty area and strikes a low shot towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper denies his effort with a superb save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Chelsea.
That's it for today, Michael Oliver has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Mathieu Flamini (Arsenal) for his blatant foul.
Gooal! Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) scores with a shot from inside the box after latching onto a headed pass from Olivier Giroud. He makes it 0:1.

Goal! Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) latches on to a superb pass inside the box, finds himself in a promising position and fires a low shot in off the left post. The goalkeeper was helpless to keep out his effort.

Harry Arter (Bournemouth) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the top of the net, but Petr Cech makes a brilliant save! The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Bournemouth.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Kevin Friend blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Artur Boruc pulls off a great save to deny Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal. The ball is out of play. Arsenal win a corner kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Joshua King (Bournemouth) will replace Dan Gosling.
Eddie Howe has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) replacing Matt Ritchie.
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain comes off the pitch to be replaced by Francis Coquelin (Arsenal).
It is time for a substitution. Lewis Grabban (Bournemouth) is on for Benik Afobe.
Here is a change. Alexis Sanchez is going off and Arsene Wenger gives the last tactical orders to Kieran Gibbs (Arsenal).

Steve Cook (Bournemouth) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball low towards the middle of the goal. However, he couldn't beat Petr Cech, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
The ball rebounds outside of the penalty area and falls to Harry Arter (Bournemouth) who directs his shot to the bottom right corner, but the keeper is there in time to stop his effort.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Theo Walcott (Arsenal) comes onto the pitch for Olivier Giroud.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.

What a save from Adrian! Cedric Soares (Southampton) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the left post, but the goalkeeper has pulled off a brilliant stop to keep it out. The linesman points to the corner flag, Southampton are going to take it.
Goal! Victor Wanyama displays great vision and sends a pass to Maya Yoshida (Southampton), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 1:0.

Winston Reid (West Ham) outjumped the defenders to meet the ball from the free kick and plants a precise header from deep inside the box towards the net! The goalkeeper shows his reflexes and superbly keeps the ball out!
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.

It's a foul from Victor Wanyama (Southampton). Surprisingly, the referee comes and pulls out a red card. It was a very harsh one and Victor Wanyama (Southampton) complains, but it's no use of course. The decision has been made.
Ronald Koeman has decided to make a change. Oriol Romeu (Southampton) replaces Sadio Mane.
We are about to witness a substitution. Andrew Carroll (West Ham) is replacing Victor Moses.
James Tomkins is substituted due to injury. Slaven Bilic gives a chance to Samuel Byram (West Ham).
Shane Long (Southampton) fails to keep his cool and squanders a golden chance to score from inside the penalty area after firing the ball over the crossbar.
The foul by Enner Valencia (West Ham) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Mark Clattenburg.
Substitution. Graziano Pelle leaves the pitch and is replaced by Charlie Austin (Southampton).
Slaven Bilic has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Emmanuel Emenike (West Ham) replacing Michail Antonio.
Jordy Clasie (Southampton) is given a yellow card.
Mark Clattenburg shows a yellow card to Samuel Byram (West Ham), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Charlie Austin (Southampton) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post.
It's time for a substitution. James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) comes on in place of Jordy Clasie.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Jonathan Howson (Norwich) has tested the patience of referee Martin Atkinson and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Sebastien Bassong (Norwich) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails a few inches over the bar!
OWN GOAL! Timm Klose (Norwich) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Martin Atkinson starts the second half.
Gabriel Agbonlahor (Aston Villa) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
That's the end of the game for Wesley Hoolahan, who is replaced by Patrick Bamford (Norwich).
Alex Neil has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nathan Redmond (Norwich) replacing Youssouf Mulumbu.
Timm Klose (Norwich) sees a yellow card from Martin Atkinson after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
It will be a substitution. Matthew Jarvis (Norwich) is ready to enter the pitch as Steven Naismith walks off.

Russell Martin (Norwich) plants a goal-bound header towards the left post after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders manages to deflect it away. The ball is out of play. Norwich will have a chance to score from a corner.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Ciaran Clark (Aston Villa) for Micah Richards.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Kolo Toure (Liverpool) comes onto the pitch after Dejan Lovren signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.

Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the right post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out. Now Liverpool have a corner.
Duncan Watmore is being substituted because of an injury. Samuel Allardyce sends Dame N'Doye (Sunderland) on the pitch.
Emre Can (Liverpool) jumps for a header from the corner kick, but fails to steer the ball into the goal as it flies high over the bar.
Dame N'Doye (Sunderland) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
That was close by Roberto Firmino (Liverpool)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes by a whisker over the crossbar.
Adam Lallana swings the cross over. Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) gets his head to it but it goes just over the crossbar.
Zeljko Buvac is forced to make a change. Joe Allen is unable to continue due to injury, Jordon Ibe (Liverpool) comes on.
Patrick van Aanholt (Sunderland) takes a mid-range free kick and fires the ball into the stands. His effort flew well wide of the right post and it's going to be a goal kick.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Robert Madley blows his whistle to start the second half.
Jordon Ibe (Liverpool) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the right post.

An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Jermain Defoe (Sunderland), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Liverpool will have a goal kick.

It's a goal! Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) makes it 0:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from James Milner and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Vito Mannone was helpless.

Jordon Ibe (Liverpool) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort. The ball is out of play and Liverpool manage to earn a corner.
Vito Mannone pulls off a great save to deny Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) has an effort on goal, but he misses to the right of the goal. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Sunderland.
The game has come to an end for Jan Kirchhoff. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Adam Johnson (Sunderland).
Patrick van Aanholt (Sunderland) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Goal! Adam Lallana (Liverpool) scores after an assist by Roberto Firmino that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:0.
Samuel Allardyce prepares a substitution. Billy Jones is replaced by DeAndre Yedlin (Sunderland).
Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool) connects with a precise cross inside the goalmouth and shoots. One of the defending players reacts in time and clears the ball to safety.
What a sensational goal that would have been! Adam Lallana (Liverpool) picks up the ball inside the box and fires a beautiful first-time shot, but it goes just a few inches wide of the right post.
Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Adam Johnson (Sunderland) takes the free kick and sends it towards the bottom right corner of the goal, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Today's match ends for Jordan Henderson who will be replaced by Lucas Leiva (Liverpool).

GOAL! Superb work from Wahbi Khazri, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Jermain Defoe (Sunderland), who beats Simon Mignolet with a brilliant shot into the left side of the net. 2:2.
Jordon Ibe (Liverpool) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Andros Townsend (Newcastle Utd) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the right post. Ben Foster has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Cheik Tiote (Newcastle Utd) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.

Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) scores a goal from medium range. He finds some space to collect a pass and produces a low drive that goes inside the net. The goalkeeper couldn't make a save, despite the ball going into the middle of the goal.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Sandro will not participate anymore and Saido Berahino (West Brom) is coming on.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Craig Gardner is replaced by Alex Pritchard (West Brom).
Gareth McAuley (West Brom) sees a yellow card from Lee Mason after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to James Chester (West Brom) for a tough tackle.
Andros Townsend swings the cross over. Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) gets his head to it but it goes just over the crossbar.
Andros Townsend (Newcastle Utd) fires a brilliant shot from the edge of the box, but the effort rattles the right post! It could have been a superb goal.

What a sensational goal that would have been! Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) picks up the ball inside the box and fires a beautiful first-time shot, but it goes just a few inches wide of the right post.
A substitution has been made. Victor Anichebe goes off and Jose Rondon (West Brom) comes on.
Today's referee Lee Mason rightly decides to book Jonas Olsson (West Brom) for his harsh tackle.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) is coming onto the pitch as Andros Townsend cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Steve McClaren has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Henri Saivet (Newcastle Utd) replacing Jonjo Shelvey.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Jack Butland (Stoke City) trips an opposition player and Andre Marriner signals a foul. No point in arguing there. Everton will take a penalty kick.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) is going to take the penalty!
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) coolly converts his spot kick! He sends the ball low into the middle of the net.
Seamus Coleman (Everton) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the right side of the goal. The score is 0:2.
GOAL! Aaron Lennon (Everton) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 0:3.
The end of the first half.
Referee Andre Marriner blows his whistle to start the second half.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Andre Marriner had an easy-decision to make.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the bar!
The substitution is prepared. Stephen Ireland (Stoke City) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ibrahim Afellay.
Mark Hughes has decided to make a change. Peter Odemwingie (Stoke City) replaces Xherdan Shaqiri.
Roberto Martinez prepares a substitution. Romelu Lukaku is replaced by Arouna Kone (Everton).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marko Arnautovic leaves the pitch and Joselu (Stoke City) comes on.

Arouna Kone (Everton) blows a clear opportunity to score a goal. He was one-on-one with Jack Butland inside the six-yard box and attempted to put the ball low into the middle of the target, but was denied by a great save. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Everton will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
A substitution has been made. Ross Barkley goes off and Kevin Mirallas (Everton) comes on.
Substitution. James McCarthy leaves the pitch and is replaced by Leon Osman (Everton).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up inside the right post.

Andre Ayew (Swansea) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner, but his effort goes narrowly wide of the right post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Wayne Routledge (Swansea) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies slightly wide, almost brushing the left-hand post.
Michael Dean has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The game is over for Chung-Yong Lee. Marouane Chamakh (Crystal Palace) comes on for the second half.
GOAL - 1:1! The corner comes over and Damien Delaney flicks on with his head to Scott Dann (Crystal Palace), who makes no mistake and fires the ball into the back of the net.
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace) was quite harsh and Michael Dean didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. Free kick. Swansea will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Mile Jedinak (Crystal Palace) for his blatant foul. Swansea are awarded a free kick.
Wayne Routledge will be replaced by Modou Barrow (Swansea).
Alan Pardew prepares a substitution. Yohan Cabaye is replaced by Hiram Boateng (Crystal Palace).
Lovely skill from Modou Barrow (Swansea) as he gets away from defenders and unleashes a shot from 19 metres out, but his effort goes just over the bar.
Federico Fernandez (Swansea) has tested the patience of referee Michael Dean and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) fires in a promising strike from the free kick just outside the penalty area. His nice effort flies towards the right post but is denied by Wayne Hennessey, who pulls off a glorious save! The linesman makes the right call and Swansea will have a corner.
It will be a substitution. Fraizer Campbell (Crystal Palace) is ready to enter the pitch as Emmanuel Adebayor walks off.
Francesco Guidolin decides to make a substitution. Angel Rangel will be replaced by Kyle Naughton (Swansea).
Alberto Paloschi comes off the pitch to be replaced by Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.

Ben Davies (Tottenham) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Ben Davies (Tottenham) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The referee blows his whistle, Tottenham are awarded a corner kick.
What a sweet touch by Ben Davies (Tottenham) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Heurelho Gomes to hold.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Eric Dier, but he hits a shot just over the crossbar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Roger East blows his whistle to start the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Mario Suarez is replaced by Valon Behrami (Watford).
Quique Flores has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Troy Deeney (Watford) comes on the pitch for Almen Abdi.
Quique Flores is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera suffers an injury and Sebastian Prodl (Watford) comes on.
Etienne Capoue (Watford) receives a yellow card for infringement.
A substitution has been made. Nacer Chadli goes off and Dele Alli (Tottenham) comes on.
Goal! Kieran Trippier (Tottenham) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:0. He was ably assisted there by Dele Alli.
The substitution is prepared. Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Erik Lamela.

Heurelho Gomes can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Heung-Min Son (Tottenham). The ball would have probably ended up in the middle of the net. Tottenham force their opponents to concede a corner.
Substitution. Christian Eriksen makes way for Thomas Carroll (Tottenham).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Robert Huth (Leicester) picks up the ball inside the box, finds himself in a good position and fires in a shot which is deflected past Joe Hart. He makes it 0:1.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Joe Hart, who pulls off a stunning save!

Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Leicester will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

David Silva (Manchester City) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms around the right post.
Yaya Toure (Manchester City) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) latches on to a pass on the edge of the box, but he can't get any power into the shot and fails to trouble Kasper Schmeichel.
Marc Albrighton (Leicester) aims for the middle of the goal, but that's an easy job for the goalkeeper. It will take more than that to test him!
Wes Morgan (Leicester) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.

Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Manchester City will take a corner kick.
Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
Wow, what an escape. Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. The linesman makes the right call and Manchester City will have a corner.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Danny Simpson (Leicester) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Joe Hart with a strike into the left side of the goal. He makes it 0:2.
Yaya Toure (Manchester City) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches over the bar.
CHANCE! Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a shot towards Joe Hart, who produces an excellent reflex save.
Substitution. Yaya Toure makes way for Fernando (Manchester City).
Manuel Pellegrini has decided to make a change. Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) replaces Fabian Delph.
Fernando (Manchester City) rises highest from the corner and heads at goal, but his effort towards the bottom right corner is saved by Kasper Schmeichel.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) takes the chance to have an effort at goal from inside the box but misses to the left of the target. The ball goes out of play and Leicester will have a goal kick.
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Robert Huth (Leicester) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header perfectly into the left side of the goal. He makes it 0:1.

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. His dangerous effort is blocked by Joe Hart, who makes a glorious save!
Pablo Zabaleta (Manchester City) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
This is a yellow card! Fernando (Manchester City) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the middle of the target, but Kasper Schmeichel was alert and the score remains the same.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Bersant Celina (Manchester City) will replace David Silva.
Claudio Ranieri decides to make a substitution. Riyad Mahrez will be replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
CHANCE! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) fires just wide of the right post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Marc Albrighton.
Shinji Okazaki comes off the pitch to be replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Marc Albrighton will be replaced by Nathan Dyer (Leicester).

It's a goal! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) makes it 0:3. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Bersant Celina and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Kasper Schmeichel was helpless.

Close! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Leicester.
Martin Demichelis (Manchester City) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

Tom Cleverley (Everton) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot towards the right side of the goal, but his effort is denied by the well positioned keeper with a stunning save.

Close effort! Romelu Lukaku (Everton) takes the resulting free kick from a promising distance, but he sends it narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Newcastle.
Goal! Tom Cleverley tees up Aaron Lennon (Everton) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Wow, what an escape. Aaron Lennon (Everton) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
Chancel Mbemba is being substituted because of an injury. Steve McClaren sends Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) on the pitch.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Steve McClaren makes a half-time substitution. Rolando Aarons (Newcastle Utd) comes on in place of Paul Dummett.
Half-time substitution. Romelu Lukaku will not participate anymore and Arouna Kone (Everton) is coming on.

Aaron Lennon (Everton) rifles a low drive from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball heads into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper denies him with a fantastic reflex save.
Close! Arouna Kone (Everton) is a whisker away from finishing-off the move he started. His close-range effort flies just over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Newcastle will have a goal kick.
That will be all from Henri Saivet who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd).

Ross Barkley (Everton) got in a good shooting position on the edge of the box and pulled the trigger. The ball flew towards the top right corner, but Rob Elliot punched it onto the post. The ball goes out of play. Everton are awarded a corner kick.
Ramiro Mori (Everton) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He planted a header against the bar and it glanced away off it.
Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee. Tom Cleverley (Everton) will take the free kick.
Rob Elliot reacts well to deny a long-range free kick from Tom Cleverley (Everton) towards the bottom left corner.
Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) gets on the end of a cross from Moussa Sissoko, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Everton.
What was Seamus Coleman (Everton) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot towards the top left corner. His effort is blocked by Joel Robles with a brilliant diving save!

Rolando Aarons (Newcastle Utd) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Craig Pawson blows his whistle for an infringement. Everton are awarded a penalty kick!
Ross Barkley (Everton) is going to take the penalty!
Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Craig Pawson's book.
Ross Barkley (Everton) converts the penalty with ease by slotting the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal after the goalkeeper guesses wrong and dives the opposite way!

Rob Elliot can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Ross Barkley (Everton). The ball would have probably ended up inside the left post. The ball goes out for a corner. Everton can continue in their attacking effort.

Arouna Kone (Everton) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and immediately unleashes a shot towards goal, but it goes high over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Newcastle.
Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) is sent off after deserving nothing other than a red card from a referee for clattering into his opponent!
Ross Barkley (Everton) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
With a cheeky finish ala Antonin Panenka, Ross Barkley (Everton) scores from the penalty spot.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Sebastian Prodl (Watford) for a tough tackle.
Sebastian Prodl (Watford) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but he sends his header straight at the goalkeeper.
Etienne Capoue (Watford) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) fires the ball at goal from inside the area, but it's well blocked. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Chelsea.
Michael Dean has issued a yellow card to Diego Costa (Chelsea).
Juan Carlos Paredes (Watford) is booked.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Golden chance! Jose Holebas (Watford) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
CHANCE!  Oscar (Chelsea) fires just wide of the left post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Diego Costa.
Quique Flores decides to make a substitution. Jose Manuel Jurado will be replaced by Almen Abdi (Watford).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Allan Nyom (Watford) is coming onto the pitch as Juan Carlos Paredes cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Oscar (Chelsea) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the left side of the target, but Heurelho Gomes easily deals with the threat. Chelsea have been awarded a corner kick.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Nemanja Matic.

Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Heurelho Gomes to get hold of the ball. The ball goes out of play and Chelsea have been awarded a corner kick.
Chance! Diego Costa (Chelsea) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Eden Hazard, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the right post.
Here comes a substitution. Etienne Capoue is given a rest as he is replaced by Mario Suarez (Watford).
Heurelho Gomes makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the left-hand post by Diego Costa (Chelsea) after a cross from the side.
Michael Dean is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

Goal! Wilfried Zaha plays in Scott Dann (Crystal Palace), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box he shoots into the top right corner of the net! Great finish - 1:0.
Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) received a pass and blasted a beautiful rocket of a shot from just outside the penalty area into the bottom right corner. He was given an ovation. Excellent finish.
The main referee, Mike Jones, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) is given a yellow card for dissent.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
Alan Pardew has made a change at the break. Jordon Mutch (Crystal Palace) has come on in place of James McArthur.
Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) sees a yellow card from Mike Jones after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Alan Pardew prepares a substitution. Fraizer Campbell is replaced by Emmanuel Adebayor (Crystal Palace).
Mike Jones shows a yellow card to Simon Francis (Bournemouth), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee shows the yellow card to Mile Jedinak (Crystal Palace).
The substitution has been made. Marouane Chamakh (Crystal Palace) has replaced Chung-Yong Lee.
Joshua King (Bournemouth) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Benik Afobe.
Steve Cook (Bournemouth) is penalised.
The foul by Adam Smith (Bournemouth) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Mike Jones.
Marouane Chamakh (Crystal Palace) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Matt Ritchie comes off the pitch to be replaced by Lewis Grabban (Bournemouth).
Lewis Grabban (Bournemouth) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Mike Jones's book.
Wilfried Zaha slides a brilliant pass into Emmanuel Adebayor (Crystal Palace), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.
The manager makes a subsitution with Sylvain Distin (Bournemouth) coming on for Harry Arter.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Jack Butland, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.

Cameron Borthwick-Jackson sends a superb cross into the box. Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Jack Butland beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.

Anthony Martial (Manchester United) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Anthony Martial (Manchester United). This could have been a legendary goal.
Bojan Krkic (Stoke City) dribbles into the box, but David de Gea is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.

Goal Anthony Martial (Manchester United)! Anthony Martial (Manchester United) was put through by Wayne Rooney and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the right side of the net. 2:0.

Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) receives a quality pass and releases a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just wide of the left post! The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one.
Mark Hughes is forced to make a change. Philipp Wollscheid is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Phillip Bardsley (Stoke City).
Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) blows a big chance to score! He slammed the ball from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it went narrowly over the crossbar.
Wow, what an escape. Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Goal disallowed! Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) scores but Roger East blows his whistle for a foul.
Goal! Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 3:0. He was ably assisted there by Anthony Martial.
Roger East shows a yellow card to Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) for a tough tackle.
Anthony Martial (Manchester United) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Roger East ignores the protests.
The substitution is prepared. Stephen Ireland (Stoke City) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Bojan Krkic.
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) collects a pass and has an effort from 20 metres out, but it flies just over the crossbar.
The manager makes a subsitution with Memphis Depay (Manchester United) coming on for Anthony Martial.
Louis van Gaal has decided to make a change. Ander Herrera (Manchester United) replaces Marouane Fellaini.
Close! Memphis Depay (Manchester United) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.

Substitution. Juan Manuel Mata makes his way off the pitch and Andreas Pereira (Manchester United) comes on as his replacement.

Craig Dawson (West Brom) attempts to score as he rises near the penalty spot and heads the ball to the roof of the net. Lukasz Fabianski displays brilliant reflexes and pulls off a comfortable save to stop the ball from hitting the net. The ball goes out of play and West Brom have been awarded a corner kick.

Ben Foster gets a well deserved ovation! He pulls off a remarkable save to block a long-range effort from Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) towards the roof of the net. Nice goalkeeping skills! The ball goes out of play. Swansea are awarded a corner kick.
Craig Dawson (West Brom) launches himself at the ball from the free kick and produces a header which lacks accuracy, sending it just wide of the left post.
Francesco Guidolin is forced to make a change. Sung-Yong Ki is unable to continue due to injury, Alberto Paloschi (Swansea) comes on.
Alberto Paloschi (Swansea) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the middle of the goal. Ben Foster is alert, though, and makes an easy save to deny him.

Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom) attempts to directly endanger the opponent's goal from a direct free kick just outside the box. He sends the ball under the crossbar, but the goalkeeper denies him with a great save. West Brom force a corner. They send men into the box.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Craig Gardner (West Brom) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jonny Evans.

Chance! James McClean sends a brilliant curling cross into the heart of the defence and into the path of Darren Fletcher (West Brom), whose header from the centre of the box goes a whisker over the bar.
Francesco Guidolin prepares a substitution. Neil Taylor is replaced by Kyle Naughton (Swansea).
A substitution has been made. Stephane Sessegnon is replaced by Saido Berahino (West Brom).
Darren Fletcher (West Brom) announces himself with a close-range shot after a cross, but one of the defenders gets in the way of the ball to thwart him.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and powers the ball inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper completely helpless.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Victor Anichebe (West Brom) replaces Sandro.

Victor Anichebe (West Brom) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and releases a quick shot to the top right corner. His promising effort is kept out by Lukasz Fabianski, who pulls off a stunning save! West Brom will have a chance to score from a corner kick.

Saido Berahino (West Brom) is strong enough to get to the ball and produces a header from close range. Even though the header went towards the top left corner, Lukasz Fabianski didn't have a hard time stopping the attempt as it wasn't powerful enough.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Andre Ayew as he is replaced by Jordi Amat (Swansea).

OFF THE POST! Alberto Paloschi (Swansea) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Victor Anichebe (West Brom) leaps like a salmon to produce a header from the resulting corner, but one of the defending players intercepts the ball and averts the danger.
Darren Fletcher (West Brom) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
GOAL! Salomon Rondon (West Brom) was in the right place at the right time. He had a good position inside the box and scored from a rebound.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and produces a low shot that sails towards the middle of a goal. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper makes a comfortable save.

Great chance! Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort. The ball goes out for a corner. Arsenal can continue in their attacking effort.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Lee Mason starts the second half.

Fraser Forster hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) shoots from the edge of the box towards the top right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. Arsenal get a corner.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His low header flies toward the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper blocks the effort.
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Cedric Soares (Southampton) for a tough tackle.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Theo Walcott (Arsenal) is coming onto the pitch as Joel Campbell cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Theo Walcott (Arsenal) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the right post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.
Theo Walcott (Arsenal) collects a rebound and his promising attempt heads towards the right side of the goal, but Fraser Forster keeps it out with an amazing save. Now Arsenal have a corner.

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) escapes his marker to connect with a cross and heads towards the right side of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent save to deny him. Arsenal force their opponents to concede a corner.

The ball from the corner kick lands at the feet of Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) deep inside the box and he takes a shot. His low strike heads towards the middle of the target, but it's deflected away thanks to a brilliant intervention by one of the defenders.
Shane Long (Southampton) announces himself with a close-range shot after a cross, but one of the defenders gets in the way of the ball to thwart him.
Substitution. James Ward-Prowse did his best and is replaced by Juanmi (Southampton).

Fraser Forster pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) fired on target after a rebound. His effort from inside the box flew straight towards the middle of the goal, but was stopped by the goalkeeper. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Arsenal.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.

The referee signals a substitution. Peter Odemwingie (Stoke City) is brought on as a substitute for Mame Diouf.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Peter Crouch (Stoke City) is coming onto the pitch as Xherdan Shaqiri cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) receives a killer pass and scores a great goal after finding the back of the net with a simple finish!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marc Albrighton leaves the pitch and Demarai Gray (Leicester) comes on.
Michael Dean is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Marouane Fellaini is replaced by Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United).
Louis van Gaal is forced to make a change. Matteo Darmian is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Paddy McNair (Manchester United).

Victor Wanyama (Southampton) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and leaps to connect with a cross from the corner kick. He produces a fine header, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Manchester Utd will have a goal kick.
The substitution is prepared. Oriol Romeu (Southampton) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jordy Clasie.
Ronald Koeman has decided to substitute Dusan Tadic and he is replaced by James Ward-Prowse (Southampton).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Charlie Austin (Southampton) comes onto the pitch so that Sadio Mane can be given a rest.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Adnan Januzaj (Manchester United) comes onto the pitch for Cameron Borthwick-Jackson.
The ball is whipped in from the resulting set piece and finds the head of Charlie Austin (Southampton) who rises and produces an amazing header into the bottom right corner.
Wasted opportunity. Adnan Januzaj (Manchester United) gets to the rebound inside the box and smashes the ball just wide of the right post.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
A neat pass is well received by Charlie Daniels (Bournemouth), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball on goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.

Junior Stanislas displays his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross deep into the box. Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) gets onto the scoresheet by superbly heading it into the roof of the net – 0:1.
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a precise pass. He pulls the trigger but only hits one of the opposition, who gets in the way of his effort.
Today's referee Roger East rightly decides to book Andrew Surman (Bournemouth) for his harsh tackle.
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Vito Mannone.
Great touch by Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
Great touch by Fabio Borini (Sunderland) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!

Goal! Fabio Borini displays great vision and sends a pass to Patrick van Aanholt (Sunderland), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 1:1.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by John O'Shea (Sunderland), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post.
Substitution. Marc Pugh walks off the pitch and Matt Ritchie (Bournemouth) comes on as a substitute.
The substitution has been made. Lewis Grabban (Bournemouth) has replaced Benik Afobe.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to make a change. Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) replaces Fabio Borini.
The free kick is delivered by Jeremain Lens (Sunderland) but it's not one of his best and is easily cleared.
Matt Ritchie (Bournemouth) got the ball on the edge of the box and produced a strong shot, but one of his teammates was standing in the wrong place and unintentionally blocked the effort.
What a huge chance for Lewis Grabban (Bournemouth). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
A substitution has been made. Jeremain Lens is replaced by Jack Rodwell (Sunderland).
Yellow card. Billy Jones (Sunderland) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Eddie Howe is forced to make a change. Junior Stanislas is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Glenn Murray (Bournemouth).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Jose Manuel Jurado (Watford) has a good chance to score with a mid-range attempt after collecting a pass. He aims for the right side of the goal, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Rob Elliot.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Andre Marriner blows his whistle and the second half starts.
It's in the back of the net! Troy Deeney slips the ball through to Odion Ighalo (Watford), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
Chancel Mbemba (Newcastle Utd) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
What was Valon Behrami (Watford) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Goal! Craig Cathcart (Watford) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:0.
It's time for a substitution. Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) comes on in place of Henri Saivet.
Here is a change. Rolando Aarons is going off and Steve McClaren gives the last tactical orders to Yoan Gouffran (Newcastle Utd).
Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

A perfectly taken corner kick. Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) gets on the end of it and produces a fantastic bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes inside the right post, increasing the score of today's match – 1:0.
Substitution. Almen Abdi (Watford) in, Jose Manuel Jurado out.

Etienne Capoue (Watford) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but it's just a bit too high and misses the bar by a whisker. The ball goes out of play and Newcastle will have a goal kick.
That will be all from Fabricio Coloccini who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Emmanuel Riviere (Newcastle Utd).
Quique Flores decides to make a substitution. Juan Carlos Paredes will be replaced by Allan Nyom (Watford).
Substitution. Troy Deeney is replaced by Nordin Amrabat (Watford).
That's it for today, Andre Marriner has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Robert Madley shows a yellow card to Micah Richards (Aston Villa) for his blatant foul.
Robert Madley has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Substitution. Craig Gardner leaves the pitch and is replaced by Saido Berahino (West Brom).
Remi Garde decides to make a substitution. Libor Kozak will be replaced by Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa).
We are about to witness a substitution. Victor Anichebe (West Brom) is replacing Jose Rondon.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Callum McManaman (West Brom) comes onto the pitch so that Stephane Sessegnon can be given a rest.
Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Jordan Veretout (Aston Villa) will take his place on the pitch.
That's it for today, Robert Madley has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.

James Milner is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot which bounces in off the bottom of the right post to make the score 0:1.
Goal - 1:1. Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) is first to the rebound and finds the back of the net with a brilliant back-heel finish.
It's 2:1! Wesley Hoolahan feeds Steven Naismith (Norwich) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the bottom left corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Lee Mason blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) jumps into a tackle and Lee Mason blows his whistle for a foul. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Norwich!
Wesley Hoolahan (Norwich) is going to take the penalty!
Wesley Hoolahan (Norwich) sends Simon Mignolet the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
What a first-time volley by Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) as he latches on to a cross and smashes the ball inside the left post. Simply glorious.
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Jordon Ibe is replaced by Adam Lallana (Liverpool).
Goal! Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Adam Lallana. The score is 3:3.
Substitution. Wesley Hoolahan leaves the pitch and is replaced by Martin Olsson (Norwich).
That's the end of the game for Nathan Redmond, who is replaced by Matthew Jarvis (Norwich).
Goal! The ball breaks to James Milner (Liverpool) after some poor defending, he finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and calmly puts the ball into the back of the net! He makes it 3:4.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Jordan Henderson as he is replaced by Christian Benteke (Liverpool).
Alex Neil decides to make a substitution. Steven Naismith will be replaced by Cameron Jerome (Norwich).
A substitution has been made. Alberto Moreno is replaced by Steven Caulker (Liverpool).
Sebastien Bassong (Norwich) is in the right place at the right time and perfectly hits a rebound into the bottom right corner.
Goal! Adam Lallana (Liverpool) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top right corner. It's 4:5.
Adam Lallana (Liverpool) goes into the book and receives a yellow card.
Lee Mason is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Jose Manuel Jurado (Watford) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Michael Oliver didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

A perfect lofted pass from Sung-Yong Ki finds Ashley Williams (Swansea), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the right side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Heurelho Gomes had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
The foul by Allan Nyom (Watford) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Oliver.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
Great ball in from Ben Watson. Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.
Michael Oliver rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Leon Britton (Swansea).
Jose Manuel Jurado (Watford) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post.
Here's the change. Wayne Routledge leaves the pitch and Modou Barrow (Swansea) comes on as a substitute.
That's the end of the game for Allan Nyom, who is replaced by Juan Carlos Paredes (Watford).
It's time for a substitution. Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) comes on in place of Andre Ayew.
Alan Curtis prepares a substitution. Sung-Yong Ki is replaced by Jordi Amat (Swansea).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Obbi Oulare (Watford) comes onto the pitch for Valon Behrami.
Jose Manuel Jurado (Watford) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post.

Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball hits the left post and ricochets away.
Yellow card! It's like Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Michael Oliver agrees and books him.
Troy Deeney (Watford) strikes a shot towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but it flies just wide of the left post.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.

Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 18 metres out, but he missed the right post by a whisker.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot at goal. His effort is blocked by Jack Butland with a brilliant diving save!
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) finds himself free inside the box and pulls the trigger, but his effort is brilliantly stopped by one of the defending players. Now Arsenal have a corner.

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the roof of the net, but Jack Butland was alert and the score remains the same. The referee signals a corner kick to Arsenal.
Craig Pawson has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.

Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) won himself just enough space to connect with the corner inside the box. His header flew towards the right post, but the goalkeeper dived superbly to stop the effort. The ball goes out of play. Arsenal are awarded a corner kick.
Joselu (Stoke City) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the left-hand post, but Petr Cech was alert and the score remains the same.
Bojan Krkic (Stoke City) shoots the rebound towards the goal. His effort lacks pace and that allows the goalkeeper to pull off a stunning save. Stoke force their opponents to concede a corner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mame Diouf (Stoke City) will replace Bojan Krkic.

Joselu (Stoke City) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful low shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Petr Cech made a crucial save! Stoke get a corner.
It will be a substitution. Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) is ready to enter the pitch as Theo Walcott walks off.
Joel Campbell (Arsenal) unleashes a shot, but his effort isn't precise at all and it flies well wide of the left post.
Mark Hughes has decided to substitute Marko Arnautovic and he is replaced by Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City).
The referee signals a substitution. Marco van Ginkel (Stoke City) is brought on as a substitute for Ibrahim Afellay.
Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) gets his head on the corner, but he sees his header blocked.
What a wasted opportunity by Joselu (Stoke City)! He unleashed a powerful low shot from the centre of the box, but Petr Cech makes a decent save to thwart him.
It is time for a substitution. Calum Chambers (Arsenal) is on for Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain.
That's it for today, Craig Pawson has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Adam Lallana (Liverpool) finds himself some space in front of goal, but his attempt is not precise and David de Gea easily stops it.
OFF THE POST! Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) surges forward and manages to get a powerful shot away from 18 metres out. However, the effort crashes against the left post!
