James Milner (Liverpool) blows a big chance to score! He slammed the ball from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it went narrowly over the crossbar.
Roberto Firmino slides a brilliant pass into Jordan Henderson (Liverpool), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Louis van Gaal is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Ashley Young suffers an injury and Cameron Borthwick-Jackson (Manchester United) comes on.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Emre Can (Liverpool) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a great reaction save to stop the effort. Liverpool force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Anthony Martial (Manchester United) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the right post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Chris Smalling (Manchester United). Mark Clattenburg doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
It will be a substitution. Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) is ready to enter the pitch as Jesse Lingard walks off.
Emre Can (Liverpool) produces a nice strike from about 20 metres. It would have probably ended up inside the left post, but David de Gea was there in time with a superb save.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) shoots the rebound towards the goal. His effort lacks pace and that allows the goalkeeper to pull off a stunning save.
Here's the change. Ander Herrera leaves the pitch and Memphis Depay (Manchester United) comes on as a substitute.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Mark Clattenburg ignores the protests.
Substitution. Adam Lallana makes his way off the pitch and Jordon Ibe (Liverpool) comes on as his replacement.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) latches on to a superb cross inside the box but only hits the crossbar with a fine header. What a chance!
Goal! Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 0:1.
It's time for a substitution. Christian Benteke (Liverpool) comes on in place of Kolo Toure.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to substitute James Milner and he is replaced by Steven Caulker (Liverpool).
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He produces a header which goes just wide of the left post.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Mark Bunn (Aston Villa) was quite harsh and Roger East didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Libor Kozak (Aston Villa) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Kasper Schmeichel anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the bottom right corner.

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) sees an opportunity to score and unleashes a powerful first-time strike from the edge of the box. Mark Bunn has a clear sight of the shot and pulls off a great save to block the effort.
Goal! Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 0:1.
Aly Cissokho (Aston Villa) clearly handles the ball, but he is surprised when the referee blows his whistle. Joy for one side, despair for the other as the referee gives a penalty to Leicester!
Aly Cissokho (Aston Villa) is punished with the yellow card.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the middle of the goal, but only into the gloves of a well-prepared Mark Bunn.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester) attempts to score with a first-time shot from the edge of the box. His effort towards the roof of the net is saved by Mark Bunn. Leicester will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Substitution. Ritchie De Laet (Leicester) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Shinji Okazaki walks off.

Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa) was close to scoring a goal after unleashing a first-time effort from inside the six-yard box. The ball was aimed low towards the middle of the net, but the goalkeeper read it well and pulled off a brilliant save to thwart the attempt.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Carles Gil as he is replaced by Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa).
Substitution. Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) in, Riyad Mahrez out.
Goal! Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot inside the right post. He makes it 1:1.
Robert Huth (Leicester) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Roger East's book.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Jamie Vardy (Leicester) is given a yellow card.
Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa) is booked by the referee.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marc Albrighton departs the field of play to be replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms over the bar.
It will be a substitution. Scott Sinclair (Aston Villa) is ready to enter the pitch as Jordan Ayew walks off.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Marc Pugh showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 1:0.
What an opportunity! Harry Arter (Bournemouth) picked the ball up and fired a projectile of a shot from long range which threatened the goalkeeper. The shot went painfully close to the left post!
Declan Rudd (Norwich) has tested the patience of referee Robert Madley and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Bournemouth have a free kick from a promising distance.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Madley has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Declan Rudd makes a great save to stop the effort going low into the middle of the goal.
A yellow card for bad language! Harry Arter (Bournemouth) couldn’t remain silent and the result is obvious.

Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) has a good opportunity as he meets a cross on the edge of the six-yard box and heads it towards the target. One of the defenders stands on the goal line and manages to keep the ball out. The linesman points to the corner flag, Bournemouth are going to take it. The ball goes out for a corner. Bournemouth can continue in their attacking effort.
Foul! Vadis Odjidja-Ofoe (Norwich) is penalised for pulling back his opponent. The referee points to the penalty spot. PENALTY to Bournemouth!
Charlie Daniels (Bournemouth) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Charlie Daniels (Bournemouth) gave the goalkeeper no chance from the penalty. Declan Rudd failed to reach the ball, which bounced off the post into the bottom right corner.
It will be a substitution. Cameron Jerome (Norwich) is ready to enter the pitch as Matthew Jarvis walks off.
Alex Neil has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nathan Redmond (Norwich) replacing Vadis Odjidja-Ofoe.

Steve Cook (Bournemouth) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the right side of the goal. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save. Bournemouth have been awarded a corner kick.
Alex Neil decides to make a substitution. Wesley Hoolahan will be replaced by Graham Dorrans (Norwich).
Goal! Charlie Daniels puts a cross into the box and finds Benik Afobe (Bournemouth), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the middle of the net. He makes it 3:0.
Substitution. Eunan O'Kane (Bournemouth) in, Harry Arter out.
Eddie Howe has decided to substitute Benik Afobe and he is replaced by Glenn Murray (Bournemouth).
Substitution. Dan Gosling will be replaced by Yann Kermorgant (Bournemouth).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Willian (Chelsea) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box, but the goalkeeper is equal to it! Chelsea will take a corner kick.
Bryan Oviedo (Everton) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the right post!

Kevin Mirallas (Everton) produces a nice daisy-cutter from about 21 metres. It would have probably ended up inside the right post, but Thibaut Courtois was there in time with a superb save. Now Everton have a corner.
Mike Jones has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Mike Jones blows his whistle to start the second half.
It's an own goal! A pitiful moment for John Terry (Chelsea), who tries to clear a cross into the six-yard box but instead sends the ball behind his own keeper. The score is 0:0.
Ross Barkley (Everton) picks up an accurate pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that smashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nemanja Matic leaves the pitch and Oscar (Chelsea) comes on.
It's a goal! Kevin Mirallas (Everton) scores with a brilliant shot into the right side of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Leighton Baines. The score is 0:0.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the roof of the net, but Tim Howard is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Diego Costa (Chelsea), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 1:2.
Goal! Diego Costa passes the ball to Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Tim Howard couldn't do anything about it. 2:2.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kenedy (Chelsea) will replace Pedro.
Roberto Martinez is forced to make a change. Bryan Oviedo is unable to continue due to injury, Ramiro Mori (Everton) comes on.
Roberto Martinez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) replacing Aaron Lennon.
Problems for Guus Hiddink as Diego Costa is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Loic Remy (Chelsea) replaces him.
The referee signals a substitution. Steven Pienaar (Everton) is brought on as a substitute for Ross Barkley.
It's in the back of the net! Gerard Deulofeu plays it into the box, and Ramiro Mori (Everton) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 2:2.
Ramiro Mori (Everton) is cautioned by the referee.
Goal! Oscar gets to the ball and heads it over the defence to John Terry (Chelsea), who meets it nicely and fires in into the back of the net. 3:3.
A yellow card is awarded to John Terry (Chelsea).
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.

Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Joe Hart, who pulls off a comfortable save!
Connor Wickham (Crystal Palace) wins the ball from the resulting corner but blazes it well over the bar.
David Silva (Manchester City) decides to keep the ball to himself and weaves through the defence into the box. From there he takes a shot which goes narrowly wide of the target.
Nice piece of skill by Fabian Delph (Manchester City) as he collected a pass and fired an unstoppable thunderbolt into the right side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.

Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) wastes a great chance from the resulting corner. He times his header superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross, but can't aim better than into the middle of the goal, straight into the arms of the goalkeeper.
Fabian Delph (Manchester City) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Crystal Palace.

Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) unleashes a shot goalwards from a mid-range free kick. The ball heads towards the right post, but the goalkeeper makes a decent save to thwart him. The ball goes out of play. Crystal Palace are awarded a corner kick.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.
Goal! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) collected a pass and decided to try his luck from distance. The shot was deflected and it was enough to turn the ball past helpless Wayne Hennessey. 2:0.
The end of the first half.
Jonathan Moss blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Aleksandar Kolarov is substituted due to injury. Manuel Pellegrini gives a chance to Gael Clichy (Manchester City).
Here's the change. Kelechi Iheanacho leaves the pitch and Yaya Toure (Manchester City) comes on as a substitute.

Joe Ledley (Crystal Palace) unleashed a monstrous piledriver. He controlled a pass, glanced up at goal and shot from the edge of the box. It could have been a difficult one for the keeper, but the ball fortunately hit one of the defenders and ball bounced away.
That was close by Joel Ward (Crystal Palace)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the right post.
The substitution has been made. Marouane Chamakh (Crystal Palace) has replaced Connor Wickham.
Goal! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Kevin De Bruyne. The score is 3:0.
Marouane Chamakh (Crystal Palace) is given a fully deserved yellow card.

Wayne Hennessey doesn't have to worry about this one. Sergio Aguero plays a pass into the feet of David Silva (Manchester City), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes well wide of the right post.

What an opportunity! Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) picked the ball up and fired a projectile of a shot from long range which threatened the goalkeeper. The shot went painfully close to the right post!
Substitution. James McArthur will be replaced by Jordon Mutch (Crystal Palace).
Goal! David Silva (Manchester City) scores after an assist by Sergio Aguero that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 4:0.
Here comes a substitution. Sergio Aguero is given a rest as he is replaced by Jesus Navas (Manchester City).
Alan Pardew prepares a substitution. Wilfried Zaha is replaced by Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace).
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Adrian pulls off a great save to deny Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) fires in a first-time projectile from about 18 metres. Adrian stretches but the ball is out of his reach and ends up inside the right post.

Goal! Daryl Janmaat plays in Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box he shoots into the top of the net! Great finish - 2:0.
Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Adrian pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.

CHANCE! Paul Dummett (Newcastle Utd) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a shot towards Adrian, who produces an excellent reflex save. Daryl Janmaat (Newcastle Utd) is first to latch onto the rebound inside the penalty area. He sends a promising shot towards the middle of the goal, but it is denied by the goalkeeper who pulls off a superb save.
Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.
Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot at goal. His effort is blocked by Rob Elliot with a brilliant diving save!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Slaven Bilic makes a half-time substitution. Nikica Jelavic (West Ham) comes on in place of Pedro Obiang.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Nikica Jelavic (West Ham), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 2:1.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Henri Saivet (Newcastle Utd) is coming onto the pitch as Paul Dummett cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Adrian is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) receives a quality pass inside the box and hits a first-time shot. His effort towards the top of the net is saved by the goalkeeper. Newcastle have a corner.
A substitution has been made. Michail Antonio goes off and Victor Moses (West Ham) comes on.
James Tomkins will be replaced by Carl Jenkinson (West Ham).

Adrian was forced into action to thwart Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
The substitution has been made. Yoan Gouffran (Newcastle Utd) has replaced Ayoze Perez.
What a save from Rob Elliot! Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising low header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Nikica Jelavic (West Ham) unleashed a promising volley from the edge of the box, but he narrowly misses the target as his shot goes over the bar.
Rob Elliot (Newcastle Utd) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Substitution. Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) in, Aleksandar Mitrovic out.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) takes the free kick and beats the goalkeeper with a shot which goes inside the left post. Simply stunning!
Poor challenge! Craig Dawson (West Brom) is penalised for tripping and Martin Atkinson blows his whistle. The referee gives a penalty to Southampton!
James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) is going to take the penalty!
James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) converts the penalty with ease by slotting the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal after the goalkeeper guesses wrong and dives the opposite way!
Matt Targett (Southampton) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Tony Pulis makes a switch. Chris Brunt (West Brom) is coming on in place of Darren Fletcher at the start of the second period.
Half-time substitution. Jonas Olsson is replaced by Jose Rondon (West Brom).
Sadio Mane (Southampton) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. His effort sails well wide of the left post.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Sadio Mane will be replaced by Dusan Tadic (Southampton).
Tony Pulis has decided to make a change. Saido Berahino (West Brom) replaces Stephane Sessegnon.

Victor Anichebe (West Brom) unleashes a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Southampton.
Goal! Steven Davis produces a great pass that finds Dusan Tadic (Southampton) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the right side of the goal. 2:0.
Substitution. Oriol Romeu (Southampton) on for Steven Davis.
That will be all from Cedric Soares who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Cuco Martina (Southampton).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.

Toby Alderweireld (Tottenham) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Jordan Pickford pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom right corner, but Jordan Pickford was alert and the score remained the same. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Tottenham.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) misses a rebound from close range. His effort floats narrowly over the crossbar! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Sunderland.

Danny Rose (Tottenham) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Sunderland will have a goal kick.
Erik Lamela (Tottenham) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Goal! Adam Johnson provides Patrick van Aanholt (Sunderland) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the bottom right corner. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save!

After a goalmouth scramble Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) wins the ball and unleashes a powerful and precise effort into the back of the net, beating the helpless goalkeeper. A wonderful football moment.
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, but his low effort is straight at Hugo Lloris.

Great solo effort by Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) as he tricks his way through two defenders before firing a drive from just outside of the box towards the right side of the goal. The goalkeeper is ready and produces a stunning save. Tottenham force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
Here comes a substitution. Jack Rodwell (Sunderland) is brought on as a substitute for Lee Cattermole.
Adam Johnson (Sunderland) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) rises above the defence inside the box, but his header flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jan Kirchhoff (Sunderland) replacing Danny Graham.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom left corner, but Jordan Pickford made an astonishing save! The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Tottenham.
Jordan Pickford stretches to his left and makes a brilliant save! Danny Rose (Tottenham) met a rebound outside the box and attempted to beat the keeper inside the right post.

Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Jordan Pickford is just a bystander as the ball flies into bottom right corner. The score is 2:1.
GOAL 3:1! Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) unleashes a shot from distance, which is deflected past Jordan Pickford. He had no chance of stopping it as the ball rapidly changed its direction.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the middle of the goal is smartly dealt with by Jordan Pickford.
Today's match ends for Erik Lamela who will be replaced by Joshua Onomah (Tottenham).
Substitution. Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Jeremain Lens walks off.
Jan Kirchhoff (Sunderland) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Michael Dean signals. Tottenham are given a penalty!
Harry Kane (Tottenham) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) gives no chance to the keeper and converts the penalty with a sharp low drive into the left side of the net.
Thomas Carroll (Tottenham) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Mousa Dembele.
Close! Jack Rodwell (Sunderland) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) will replace Harry Kane.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Petr Cech hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Emre Can (Liverpool) shoots from the edge of the box towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
A shot is blocked but the rebound lands at the feet of Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) who fires the ball into the back of the net.
Mike Jones has issued a yellow card to Roberto Firmino (Liverpool).
Goal Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal)! Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) was put through by Joel Campbell and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the right side of the net. 1:1.

James Milner passes to Roberto Firmino (Liverpool), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 2:1.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.

What a great touch by Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot towards the roof of the net, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. The ball goes out of play and Arsenal have been awarded a corner kick.

It's a goal! Aaron Ramsey delivers a teasing cross from the resulting corner and the ball falls into the space where Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) is lurking. His close-range shot goes into the net and it's 2:2.
Half-chance! Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) plays a pass into the box, but Petr Cech reacts well to snuff out the attack.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) smashes the ball against the crossbar! What a chance.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Joel Campbell (Arsenal) squandered a huge opportunity from inside the 6-yard box. He blazed it high over the bar.
Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) misses an absolute sitter after connecting with a cross inside the penalty box.
Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Joel Campbell (Arsenal) tries to send the ball in front of the goal, but the opposition's defence averts the threat.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and powers the ball inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper completely helpless.
It is time for a substitution. Christian Benteke (Liverpool) is on for James Milner.
A substitution has been made. Joel Campbell goes off and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) comes on.
Arsene Wenger decides to make a substitution. Theo Walcott will be replaced by Kieran Gibbs (Arsenal).
Substitution. Joe Allen (Liverpool) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Emre Can walks off.
That will be all from Mesut Ozil who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Mikel Arteta (Arsenal).
Here is a change. Adam Lallana is going off and Jurgen Klopp gives the last tactical orders to Steven Caulker (Liverpool).
GOAL! A cross into the box is headed down by Christian Benteke and Joe Allen (Liverpool) does brilliantly to get to the ball and fire home. 3:3.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Toby Alderweireld (Tottenham) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the top left corner. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save. Good work from Tottenham as they win a corner.
N'Golo Kante (Leicester) misses a rebound from the penalty spot. The ball flies just a few inches over the bar.

Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Hugo Lloris makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the right side of the goal. Leicester force their opponents to concede a corner.

Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) has a good chance to score with a mid-range attempt after collecting a pass. He aims for the right side of the goal, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Kasper Schmeichel.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Lee Mason has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

This shall not pass! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) lines up a shot from the edge of the box and goes for goal, but the effort is well blocked by a defender. The ball goes out of play. Leicester are awarded a corner kick.

Erik Lamela (Tottenham) connects with an accurate pass inside the box and fires the ball to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players steps in to block the effort. The referee blows his whistle, Tottenham are awarded a corner kick.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) dribbles into the box, but Hugo Lloris is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.

What a sweet touch by Harry Kane (Tottenham) after latching on to a fine pass on the edge of the box! He finds some space and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net. The goalkeeper makes an excellent reflex save, pushing the ball onto the post.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Jamie Vardy walks off the pitch to be replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester).
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to substitute Christian Eriksen and he is replaced by Mousa Dembele (Tottenham).
Close! Erik Lamela (Tottenham) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot narrowly over the bar.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) collects a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.

Marc Albrighton (Leicester) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick low strike towards the middle of the goal that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a superb goal-line clearance.

Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the bottom right corner that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
Substitution. Shinji Okazaki will be replaced by Andy King (Leicester).

Dele Alli (Tottenham) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom right corner is blocked by Kasper Schmeichel, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Eric Dier (Tottenham) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Here's the change. Thomas Carroll leaves the pitch and Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) comes on as a substitute.
Christian Fuchs takes the corner and Robert Huth (Leicester) rises highest near the penalty spot to plant a brilliant header into the top left corner. The score is 0:1.
Substitution. Nathan Dyer (Leicester) in, Riyad Mahrez out.
Here is a change. Eric Dier is going off and Mauricio Pochettino gives the last tactical orders to Joshua Onomah (Tottenham).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Problems for Tony Pulis as James Morrison is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Craig Gardner (West Brom) replaces him.
Willian (Chelsea) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.

Craig Dawson (West Brom) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the bottom right corner. The effort, however, is blocked by Thibaut Courtois, who pulls off a stunning save! The referee blows his whistle, West Brom are awarded a corner kick.
It's a goal! Branislav Ivanovic plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.
The foul by Claudio Yacob (West Brom) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Anthony Taylor.
What a hit that is! Craig Gardner (West Brom) scores a great goal from approximately 22 metres out. His effort goes straight into the bottom left corner and he makes it 1:1.

Salomon Rondon (West Brom) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 19 metres out, but he missed the right post by a whisker.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Guus Hiddink makes a switch. Kenedy (Chelsea) is coming on in place of Pedro at the start of the second period.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) has tested the patience of referee Anthony Taylor and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Substitution. Claudio Yacob walks off the pitch and Saido Berahino (West Brom) comes on as a substitute.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jose Rondon trots off the pitch and is replaced by Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom).
The yellow card goes to Glyn Oliver Myhill (West Brom). This is an obvious ploy to delay the restart of play from Glyn Oliver Myhill (West Brom).
Thibaut Courtois (Chelsea) is yellow-carded.
James McClean (West Brom) is booked by the referee.
Own goal! Gareth McAuley (West Brom) suffers a good deal of misfortune as he accidentally puts a pass from one of the attacking players into his own net. The score is 1:1.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop.
The game has come to an end for Cesc Fabregas. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Nemanja Matic (Chelsea).
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) for a tough tackle.
James McClean (West Brom) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. He hits the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and it nestles in the net.
That's it for today, Anthony Taylor has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Leon Osman (Everton) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Romelu Lukaku, but he hits a shot just wide of the right post.
Roger East has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
What was Muhamed Besic (Everton) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) inside the box and he manages to steer it to the middle of the target. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Tim Howard makes a save in the nick of time and maintains the current score.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Here is a change. Gerard Deulofeu is going off and Roberto Martinez gives the last tactical orders to Steven Pienaar (Everton).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Leon Osman will be replaced by Arouna Kone (Everton).
Manuel Pellegrini has decided to make a change. David Silva (Manchester City) replaces Kevin De Bruyne.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Matt Targett sends a superb cross into the box. Shane Long (Southampton) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header inside the right post, leaving Heurelho Gomes beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.

Matt Targett (Southampton) picks up the rebound on the edge of the box and shoots. His effort, however, only finds the gloves of the opponent's goalkeeper. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Southampton.

Well-positioned Shane Long (Southampton) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the left post, but Heurelho Gomes reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop!
Craig Pawson shows a yellow card to Cedric Soares (Southampton) for his blatant foul.
Sadio Mane (Southampton) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he fails to change the score as his effort deflects away off the left post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Sadio Mane (Southampton) connects with a cross from the side and steers a header from around the penalty spot towards the goal. The ball goes in the right direction, but it's stopped by one of the defenders. Southampton have been awarded a corner kick.
The manager makes a subsitution with Ikechi Anya (Watford) coming on for Almen Abdi.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Steven Davis (Southampton) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Today's referee Craig Pawson rightly decides to book Sebastian Prodl (Watford) for his harsh tackle.
Here comes a substitution. Allan Nyom is given a rest as he is replaced by Victor Ibarbo (Watford).
Ronald Koeman decides to make a substitution. Sadio Mane will be replaced by Dusan Tadic (Southampton).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera as he is replaced by Craig Cathcart (Watford).
Dusan Tadic (Southampton) displays great tekkers inside the box leading to a fantastic goal, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.
Troy Deeney (Watford) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
A substitution has been made. Steven Davis is replaced by Graziano Pelle (Southampton).
Here is a change.  is going off and Ronald Koeman gives the last tactical orders to Maya Yoshida (Southampton).
Craig Pawson is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
What a huge chance for Joselu (Stoke City). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Gary O'Neil (Norwich) is sent off after deserving nothing other than a red card from a referee for clattering into his opponent!
Neil Swarbrick has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Marko Arnautovic plays a terrific cross over to Jonathan Walters (Stoke City), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
Goal! Vadis Odjidja-Ofoe slips it to Jonathan Howson (Norwich) on the edge of the box and he finds the top left corner with a great effort. The score is 1:1.
The referee signals a substitution. Peter Odemwingie (Stoke City) is brought on as a substitute for Bojan Krkic.
Here is a change. Vadis Odjidja-Ofoe is going off and Alex Neil gives the last tactical orders to Nathan Redmond (Norwich).
The game has come to an end for Wesley Hoolahan. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Matthew Jarvis (Norwich).
Goal - 2:1! Joselu (Stoke City) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Ibrahim Afellay provided an assist for the goal.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Dieumerci Mbokani will be replaced by Cameron Jerome (Norwich).
Mark Hughes has decided to make a change. Marco van Ginkel (Stoke City) replaces Marko Arnautovic.
Alexander Tettey (Norwich) is penalised.
OWN GOAL! The free kick is whipped in and Ryan Bennett (Norwich) is unlucky enough to head the ball into his own net. 3:1.
Here comes a substitution. Peter Crouch (Stoke City) is brought on as a substitute for Joselu.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.
What a sweet touch by Fabio Borini (Sunderland) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Lukasz Fabianski to hold.
Goal! Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 0:1.
Wes Brown (Sunderland) manages to dispossess his opponent of the ball, but he commits a foul in the process and the referee blows his whistle. Swansea are awarded a penalty!
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) fires the penalty inside the left post.
Kyle Naughton (Swansea) attempts to protest after receiving a red card, but it's too late! It was an unjustified decision by the referee, but it doesn't change the fact that it's a red.
Andre Ayew (Swansea) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Vito Mannone with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:1.
Alan Curtis has decided to make a change. Angel Rangel (Swansea) replaces Leon Britton.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Graham Scott blows his whistle to start the second half.
Federico Fernandez (Swansea) scores an unfortunate own goal after deflecting the ball into his own net!
Jeremain Lens (Sunderland) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.

GOAL! Superb work from Adam Johnson, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Jermain Defoe (Sunderland), who beats Lukasz Fabianski with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 2:3.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Angel Rangel (Swansea) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Vito Mannone (Sunderland) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
That will be all from Lee Cattermole who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Jack Rodwell (Sunderland).
Substitution. Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) in, Wayne Routledge out.

Patrick van Aanholt (Sunderland) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent. Free kick. Swansea will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Fabio Borini leaves the pitch and Danny Graham (Sunderland) comes on.
Goal! Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Patrick van Aanholt. The score is 2:4.
Substitution. Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) has come on for Jeremain Lens.
Alan Curtis prepares a substitution. Andre Ayew is replaced by Jack Cork (Swansea).
That's it for today, Graham Scott has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball only rattles the right post.
Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) tries to threaten the goalkeeper as he takes the ball and fires from long range. The shot flies just over the crossbar!
What a big chance! Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Joe Ledley is replaced by Connor Wickham (Crystal Palace).

Libor Kozak (Aston Villa) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom left corner. Wayne Hennessey has a clear sight of it makes a comfortable save. The linesman points to the corner flag, Aston Villa are going to take it.
OWN GOAL! Wayne Hennessey (Crystal Palace) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 1:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marouane Chamakh (Crystal Palace) comes onto the pitch so that Bakary Sako can be given a rest.
Jordan Veretout (Aston Villa) is cautioned by the referee.
James McArthur comes off the pitch to be replaced by Mile Jedinak (Crystal Palace).
Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) takes out his opponent with a horrible challenge and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Idrissa Gueye (Aston Villa) was quite harsh and Mark Clattenburg didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Connor Wickham (Crystal Palace) plants a goal-bound header towards the middle of the target after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders manages to deflect it away.
Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly wide of the right post.
A substitution has been made. Carles Gil goes off and Ciaran Clark (Aston Villa) comes on.
Mark Clattenburg is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Michail Antonio (West Ham) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Artur Boruc is alert and denies him.
Andrew Carroll doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Nikica Jelavic (West Ham) comes onto the pitch to replace him.
What a hit that is! Harry Arter (Bournemouth) scores a great goal from approximately 23 metres out. His effort goes straight into the left side of the goal and he makes it 1:0.
Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header narrowly over the crossbar!

Artur Boruc pulls off a great save to deny Nikica Jelavic (West Ham) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! West Ham force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.

Dimitri Payet (West Ham) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires the ball from the edge of the box towards the roof of the net, but Artur Boruc shows his agility and makes a save. The referee signals a corner kick to West Ham.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Matt Ritchie is substituted due to injury. Eddie Howe gives a chance to Juan Iturbe (Bournemouth).
James Tomkins will be replaced by Carl Jenkinson (West Ham).
The foul by Adam Smith (Bournemouth) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Martin Atkinson. West Ham win a free kick.
Dimitri Payet (West Ham) fires a free kick goalwards from 26-metres. The ball bounces in off the crossbar, leaving the goalkeeper beaten. Superb finish!
Dimitri Payet (West Ham) gets booked for the first time in this match.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Benik Afobe departs the field of play to be replaced by Lewis Grabban (Bournemouth).
Goal! Dimitri Payet plays a pass to the feet of Enner Valencia (West Ham), and he shoots into the roof of the net from inside the box. It's 1:2.
Here is a change. Dimitri Payet is going off and Slaven Bilic gives the last tactical orders to Alex Song (West Ham).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Glenn Murray (Bournemouth) is coming onto the pitch as Harry Arter cannot continue after picking up an injury.
GOAL! Enner Valencia (West Ham) takes the resultant set piece from 20 metres out and curls the ball inside the left hand post. What a hit that is!

Juan Iturbe (Bournemouth) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 24 metres out. Adrian stops the effort which is headed for the bottom left corner. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Bournemouth.
Martin Atkinson is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Handball by Chancel Mbemba (Newcastle Utd). PENALTY to Manchester Utd! Almost the entire opposition team is gathered around the referee and complaining. However, the decision has been made and it's final.
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the right side of the goal.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) for a tough tackle.
Close! Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but David de Gea is alert and denies him.
Ander Herrera (Manchester United) sees a yellow card from Michael Dean after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Cheik Tiote (Newcastle Utd) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Dean ignores the protests.
Goal - 0:2! Wayne Rooney tees up Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Rob Elliot.
What a beautiful long-range strike by Fabricio Coloccini (Newcastle Utd). He is quite unlucky as his shot flies just over the bar.
Goal! Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:2.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Michael Dean has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) gets inside the penalty area and sends a powerful shot that almost ends inside the net. The keeper is alert and makes a good save. Newcastle win a corner.
What a big chance! Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Here comes a substitution. Memphis Depay (Manchester United) is brought on as a substitute for Jesse Lingard.

Chris Smalling (Manchester United) is penalised for holding. Michael Dean signals a set piece. Newcastle are awarded a penalty! The opposing players are protesting, but the referee had an easy-decision to make.
Yellow card! It's like Chris Smalling (Manchester United) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Michael Dean agrees and books him.
Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) takes the penalty and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom the right corner!
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) gets a shot in from close range, but it's unluckily blocked by one of his teammates.
Ander Herrera goes off the pitch and Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) comes on.
Goal! Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot into the top left corner. 2:3.
Steve McClaren has decided to make a change. Yoan Gouffran (Newcastle Utd) replaces Jack Colback.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) escapes his marker to meet a cross and heads to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent reflex save to deny him.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Cheik Tiote trots off the pitch and is replaced by Ivan Toney (Newcastle Utd).
It's in the back of the net! Paul Dummett (Newcastle Utd) tries his luck from the edge of the box and his shot takes a deflection and goes past the stranded David de Gea. He makes it 3:3.
Ayoze Perez will be replaced by Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd).
Michael Dean is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) accepts a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot towards the goal, but he only hits the left post! What an unlucky moment for him.
Goal! Romelu Lukaku tees up Aaron Lennon (Everton) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the left side of the goal. 1:0.
Ben Davies (Tottenham) pounces on a loose ball from the corner kick and fires from the edge of the box. His brilliant effort smashes against the crossbar.
The referee shows the yellow card to Seamus Coleman (Everton).
Toby Alderweireld plays a terrific cross over to Dele Alli (Tottenham), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Harry Kane (Tottenham) makes a good run into the box to meet a cross and fires the ball in on goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender.
Substitution. Arouna Kone is replaced by Muhamed Besic (Everton).
Roberto Martinez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) replacing Aaron Lennon.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Erik Lamela (Tottenham) was quite harsh and Michael Oliver didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The substitution is prepared. Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Christian Eriksen.
Thomas Carroll (Tottenham) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Oliver ignores the protests.

Hugo Lloris receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Muhamed Besic (Everton), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed towards the roof of the net. The ball goes behind for a corner. Everton will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Substitution. Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) on for Dele Alli.
Here comes a substitution. Joshua Onomah (Tottenham) is brought on as a substitute for Erik Lamela.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace) was quite harsh and Kevin Friend didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Guus Hiddink is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Eden Hazard suffers an injury and Pedro (Chelsea) comes on.
It's in the back of the net! Diego Costa sprays a pass out to  Oscar (Chelsea), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:1.

Wayne Hennessey pulls off a great save to deny Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal. The linesman points to the corner flag, Chelsea are going to take it.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Kurt Zouma (Chelsea) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went a whisker over the bar.
Mile Jedinak (Crystal Palace) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Oscar passes to Willian (Chelsea), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 0:2.
Goal! Diego Costa (Chelsea) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:3.
Here is a change. Fraizer Campbell is going off and Alan Pardew gives the last tactical orders to Marouane Chamakh (Crystal Palace).
Substitution. Mile Jedinak will be replaced by Joe Ledley (Crystal Palace).
Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) commits a nasty foul by bringing down his opponent.
Substitution. Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace) makes way for .
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Oscar as he is replaced by Nemanja Matic (Chelsea).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.
Odion Ighalo (Watford) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Joe Hart.
Allan Nyom (Watford) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Unbelievable! Ben Watson (Watford) scores direct from the corner. He curls the ball and it goes straight into the back of the net. 1:0.
Manuel Pellegrini prepares a substitution. Raheem Sterling is replaced by Jesus Navas (Manchester City).
Today's match ends for Eliaquim Mangala who will be replaced by Wilfried Bony (Manchester City).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Adlene Guedioura (Watford) for Jose Manuel Jurado.

Aleksandar Kolarov produces a cross from the resulting corner and finds Yaya Toure (Manchester City) inside the box. He pulls the trigger and scores, sending the ball into the top left corner. What a brilliant finish. 1:1.

It's a goal! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) makes it 1:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Bacary Sagna and planted his close-range header into the right side of the goal. Heurelho Gomes was helpless.
Here comes a substitution. Martin Demichelis (Manchester City) is brought on as a substitute for Sergio Aguero.

Odion Ighalo (Watford) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and produces a low shot that sails towards the middle of a goal. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper makes a comfortable save.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Jack Colback (Newcastle Utd) for a tough tackle.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Anthony Taylor has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Daryl Janmaat (Newcastle Utd) receives a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Joel Campbell (Arsenal) will replace Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain.
Gooal! Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) scores with a shot from inside the box after latching onto a headed pass from Olivier Giroud. He makes it 1:0.
The manager makes a subsitution with Florian Thauvin (Newcastle Utd) coming on for Jack Colback.
Here is a change. Theo Walcott is going off and Arsene Wenger gives the last tactical orders to Kieran Gibbs (Arsenal).
Yellow card. Mathieu Flamini (Arsenal) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Here's the change. Cheik Tiote leaves the pitch and Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd) comes on as a substitute.
The referee signals a substitution. Calum Chambers (Arsenal) is brought on as a substitute for Olivier Giroud.

Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms around the right post.
The referee can't ignore those comments and Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) sees a yellow card for bad language.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Joshua King (Bournemouth), whose header flies narrowly wide of the right post.

OFF THE POST! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Today's referee Andre Marriner rightly decides to book Harry Arter (Bournemouth) for his harsh tackle.
Chance! Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Joshua King, but his shot from inside the box flashes just over the bar.
What a big chance! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
Claudio Ranieri has made a change at the break. Nathan Dyer (Leicester) has come on in place of Leonardo Ulloa.

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) dribbled past his opponents before finding himself in a great position to strike. His attempt from just outside of the box went towards the right side of the goal, but it wasn't dangerous and Artur Boruc made a comfortable save. Leicester force their opponents to concede a corner.
Joshua King comes off the pitch to be replaced by Glenn Murray (Bournemouth).
Wes Morgan (Leicester) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his shot flies just over the crossbar. This should be a big warning for the defence.

Simon Francis (Bournemouth) performs a sliding tackle but catches his opponent's legs. The referee blows his whistle for an infringement. Leicester are awarded a penalty! The opposing players are protesting, but the referee had an easy-decision to make.
Simon Francis (Bournemouth) expresses his disappointment as he receives a straight red card.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the right post, but Artur Boruc leaps out to thwart his attempt.
Substitution. Harry Arter makes way for Sylvain Distin (Bournemouth).
The foul by Marc Albrighton (Leicester) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Andre Marriner.
That's the end of the game for Marc Albrighton, who is replaced by Shinji Okazaki (Leicester).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Danny Simpson as he is replaced by Ritchie De Laet (Leicester).
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the right post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.
Chris Smalling (Manchester United) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Jonathan Moss had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Louis van Gaal probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Phil Jones. He is replaced by Matteo Darmian (Manchester United).

A perfect lofted pass from Ashley Young finds Anthony Martial (Manchester United), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header to the middle in the countermovement of the keeper. His effort was both strong and precise, and Lukasz Fabianski had no chance of stopping that. 0:0.
The substitution has been made. Modou Barrow (Swansea) has replaced Leon Britton.
Andre Ayew (Swansea) latches on to a superb cross into the box and hits the right post with his header. A stroke of luck for the goalkeeper!
Angel Rangel (Swansea) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.

Modou Barrow sends a superb cross into the box. Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving David de Gea beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
GOAL! Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) finishes off a sublime move with a delightful back-heel goal. Anthony Martial provided the assist with a brilliant pass. 2:1.
Louis van Gaal prepares a substitution. Ashley Young is replaced by Paddy McNair (Manchester United).
Here comes a substitution. Jefferson Montero (Swansea) is brought on as a substitute for Wayne Routledge.
Andre Ayew comes off the pitch to be replaced by Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Daley Blind (Manchester United) was quite harsh and Jonathan Moss didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That's the end of the game for Ander Herrera, who is replaced by Michael Carrick (Manchester United).

David de Gea hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Ashley Williams (Swansea) shoots from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. The referee signals a corner kick to Swansea.
Lukasz Fabianski (Swansea) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he arrows his header just a few inches wide of the right post.
Jonathan Moss is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Jonathan Howson (Norwich) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the left post.
Chance! Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Nathan Redmond, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the right post.

Shane Long (Southampton) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to make a good save to keep his effort out. The ball is out of play and Southampton manage to earn a corner.
Victor Wanyama (Southampton) sees a yellow card from Mark Clattenburg after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Jordy Clasie (Southampton) gets into a good scoring position. He creates some space for himself and tries his luck from distance. His decent effort towards the right post is, however, superbly saved by Declan Rudd! The ball goes out of play and Southampton have been awarded a corner kick.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
The manager makes a subsitution with Vadis Odjidja-Ofoe (Norwich) coming on for Nathan Redmond.
Victor Wanyama (Southampton) should have been more careful. He commits a bad foul, receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!
Alexander Tettey (Norwich) receives a precise pass inside the box from Vadis Odjidja-Ofoe and he beats the goalkeeper with a brilliant shot into the top left corner. 1:0.
Substitution. Jordy Clasie makes his way off the pitch and Harrison Reed (Southampton) comes on as his replacement.
Ronald Koeman has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sadio Mane (Southampton) replacing Dusan Tadic.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dieumerci Mbokani departs the field of play to be replaced by Cameron Jerome (Norwich).
Substitution. Wesley Hoolahan leaves the pitch and is replaced by Martin Olsson (Norwich).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and James Ward-Prowse leaves the pitch and Gaston Ramirez (Southampton) comes on.
Declan Rudd (Norwich) picks up a yellow card.
Mark Clattenburg is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
CHANCE! Jordan Veretout (Aston Villa) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a low shot to the bottom right corner, but Vito Mannone produces an excellent save.
Wes Brown (Sunderland) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
OWN GOAL! Micah Richards (Aston Villa) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 1:0.
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Yellow card. Alan Hutton (Aston Villa) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Danny Graham (Sunderland) comes onto the pitch for Duncan Watmore.
Remi Garde has decided to substitute Jack Grealish and he is replaced by Adama Traore (Aston Villa).

An absolutely sensational volley by Carles Gil (Aston Villa). He took a shot from inside the penalty area and the ball went in just under the crossbar. All credit to Carles Gil (Aston Villa), excellent finish.
Adama Traore (Aston Villa) has tested the patience of referee Craig Pawson and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

GOAL! Superb work from Adam Johnson, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Jermain Defoe (Sunderland), who beats Brad Guzan with a brilliant shot into the left side of the net. 2:1.
Remi Garde is forced to make a change. Alan Hutton is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Libor Kozak (Aston Villa).
Substitution. Ola Toivonen (Sunderland) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Fabio Borini walks off.
Carles Gil (Aston Villa) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Craig Pawson lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
Samuel Allardyce decides to make a substitution. Adam Johnson will be replaced by Sebastian Coates (Sunderland).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Scott Sinclair (Aston Villa) comes onto the pitch so that Adama Traore can be given a rest.
Goal - 3:1! Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the right post. Ola Toivonen provided an assist for the goal.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Craig Pawson's book.
Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) has too much to say to the referee and receives a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.

Chance! Darren Fletcher (West Brom) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Stephane Sessegnon, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Goal - 1:0! James Morrison laid the ball off to Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom), who shot from close range into the top of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Today's match ends for Bojan Krkic who will be replaced by Joselu (Stoke City).
Mark Hughes has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) replacing Glenn Whelan.
Caution goes to Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City).

Joselu sends a superb cross into the box. Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Glyn Oliver Myhill beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
Referee Lee Mason goes straight to his pocket and shows Geoff Cameron (Stoke City) a red card. No point in arguing. He has to leave the pitch.
Substitution. Xherdan Shaqiri will be replaced by Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City).
Here is a change. Claudio Yacob is going off and Tony Pulis gives the last tactical orders to Saido Berahino (West Brom).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Callum McManaman (West Brom) will replace Craig Gardner.
GOAL! Jonny Evans (West Brom) was in the right place at the right time. He had a good position inside the box and scored from a rebound.
Chris Brunt (West Brom) earns the yellow card.
That's it for today, Lee Mason has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Enner Valencia produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Michail Antonio (West Ham) rises high to head the ball straight under the crossbar and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:0.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the right post! What a shot that was!
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Madley ignores the protests.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Pedro Obiang (West Ham) will take his place on the pitch.
Emre Can (Liverpool) wastes a promising chance as he unleashes a first-time shot from mid-range which hits the crossbar!
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.

Mark Noble showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Andrew Carroll (West Ham) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header inside the right post. It's 2:0.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. Adam Lallana (Liverpool) replaces Roberto Firmino.
Substitution. Alberto Moreno makes his way off the pitch and Bradley Smith (Liverpool) comes on as his replacement.
Substitution. Enner Valencia leaves the pitch and is replaced by Dimitri Payet (West Ham).
Simon Mignolet makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded low towards the middle of the goal by Andrew Carroll (West Ham) after a cross from the side.

Michail Antonio (West Ham) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball low towards the middle of the goal. However, he couldn't beat Simon Mignolet, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Joe Allen (Liverpool) replacing Mamadou Sakho.
Here's the change. Michail Antonio leaves the pitch and Carl Jenkinson (West Ham) comes on as a substitute.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.

Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Simon Mignolet stops the ball from going into the top of the net. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Sunderland.
Christian Benteke (Liverpool) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) got in a good shooting position on the edge of the box and pulled the trigger. The ball flew towards the left side of the goal, but Vito Mannone punched it onto the post.
Problems for Samuel Allardyce as Jack Rodwell is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) replaces him.
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Kevin Friend has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Goal! Christian Benteke (Liverpool) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Adam Lallana, then sends the ball into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Emre Can (Liverpool) for his blatant foul. Sunderland are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) replaces Jordan Henderson.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jeremain Lens (Sunderland) replacing Adam Johnson.
We are about to witness a subsitution. DeAndre Yedlin (Sunderland) for Sebastian Coates.
