Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Philippe Coutinho is replaced by Jordon Ibe (Liverpool).
Jeremain Lens (Sunderland) takes out his opponent with a nasty challenge and is relieved when the referee only gives him a booking.

Christian Benteke (Liverpool) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Roberto Firmino departs the field of play to be replaced by Kolo Toure (Liverpool).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Kasper Schmeichel pulls off a great save to deny Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! The ball goes out of play and Manchester City have been awarded a corner kick.
Marc Albrighton (Leicester) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but his shot missed the target close to the right post.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Craig Pawson starts the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sergio Aguero trots off the pitch and is replaced by Wilfried Bony (Manchester City).

What a great chance for Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header inside the right post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save. The ball goes out for a corner. Manchester City can continue in their attacking effort.
Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Gokhan Inler will be replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester).
David Silva comes off the pitch to be replaced by Jesus Navas (Manchester City).
Eliaquim Mangala (Manchester City) has tested the patience of referee Craig Pawson and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Daniel Drinkwater leaves the pitch and Andy King (Leicester) comes on.
Marc Albrighton (Leicester) commits a nasty foul by bringing down his opponent.
Here comes a substitution. Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) is brought on as a substitute for Raheem Sterling.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Claudio Ranieri has decided to make a change. Ritchie De Laet (Leicester) replaces Marc Albrighton.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Gabriel (Arsenal) connects with the ball from the resulting corner and places a precise header past the stranded goalkeeper and into the top right corner. The opposing players are staring at each other, unable to understand what happened. Who will take the blame for that one? Gabriel (Arsenal) has a reason to celebrate!
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

Gabriel (Arsenal) rises high to connect with a cross from the corner kick, but his powerful header from center of the box hits the left post! Per Mertesacker (Arsenal) covers his face with his hands after wasting a glorious chance. The ball rebounded to him but his close-range header went a whisker wide of the left post.

Theo Walcott (Arsenal) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the left post. Artur Boruc has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. The referee blows his whistle, Arsenal are awarded a corner kick.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Marc Pugh will not participate anymore and Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) is coming on.
Calum Chambers (Arsenal) picked up a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee. He has to be careful for the remainder of the match.
That's the end of the game for Dan Gosling, who is replaced by Eunan O'Kane (Bournemouth).
Goal! Olivier Giroud produces a great pass that finds Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a low shot into the back of the net. 1:0.
Hector Bellerin links up with Theo Walcott (Arsenal), who fires just wide of the left post from the edge of the box.
CHANCE! Mesut Ozil finds Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the right post!
That will be all from Olivier Giroud who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Joel Campbell (Arsenal).
Eddie Howe has decided to make a change. Glenn Murray (Bournemouth) replaces Joshua King.
The substitution is prepared. Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Kieran Gibbs.

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) received an accurate pass just outside the penalty area and produced a quick strike. It would have probably ended behind the goalkeeper, but one of the defenders managed to deflect it onto the post. The ball goes out of play and Arsenal have been awarded a corner kick.
Substitution. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain is replaced by Alex Iwobi (Arsenal).
Roger East is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!

What a great chance for John Terry (Chelsea). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header right under the bar, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save. Now Chelsea have a corner.
Anthony Martial (Manchester United) shows off his amazing technique to get in front of goal by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the left post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Today's referee Martin Atkinson rightly decides to book John Obi Mikel (Chelsea) for his harsh tackle.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Morgan Schneiderlin (Manchester United) for a tough tackle.
Chris Smalling (Manchester United) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Martin Atkinson ignores the protests.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Pedro (Chelsea) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, David de Gea makes a great save to stop his effort.

Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and sends a shot to the middle of the goal, but is denied by a reflex save from David de Gea. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Chelsea.

Ander Herrera (Manchester United) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range low towards the middle of the net, but Thibaut Courtois was alert and made an amazing save! Manchester Utd have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) controls the ball and sets off to face the goalkeeper, but deep inside the box the ball bounces up on the uneven surface and makes him miss the strike, sending the ball well over the goal. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Manchester Utd.
The referee signals a substitution.  Ramires (Chelsea) is brought on as a substitute for Willian.
Louis van Gaal has decided to make a change. Cameron Borthwick-Jackson (Manchester United) replaces Matteo Darmian.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) sees a yellow card from Martin Atkinson after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Here comes a substitution. Juan Manuel Mata is given a rest as he is replaced by Memphis Depay (Manchester United).
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Bastian Schweinsteiger (Manchester United), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
It is time for a substitution. Phil Jones (Manchester United) is on for Daley Blind.
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) misses an absolute sitter after connecting with a cross inside the penalty box. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Chelsea.
A yellow card for a tackle by Wayne Rooney (Manchester United). Martin Atkinson doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee allows time for a substitution.  Oscar will be replaced by Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Here is an example of luck not being on your side. Carl Jenkinson (West Ham) puts the ball into the back of the net but, unfortunately for him, it's into his own goal!
Steven Davis (Southampton) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the right post. Terrific solo effort, though.

Jose Fonte (Southampton) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper leaps from the ground and makes a stunning save.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Slaven Bilic makes a switch. Andrew Carroll (West Ham) is coming on in place of Mauro Zarate at the start of the second period.
The game is over for Alex Song. Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) comes on for the second half.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) makes some space to meet a perfect cross inside the box, but he blazes his shot over the bar. High, wide and not at all pretty.
Yellow card. Cuco Martina (Southampton) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
A yellow card is awarded to Oriol Romeu (Southampton).
Caution goes to James Tomkins (West Ham).
Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) for his blatant foul.
Michail Antonio (West Ham) scores a peculiar goal using an unorthodox part of his body.
We are about to witness a substitution. Maya Yoshida (Southampton) is replacing Cuco Martina.
Ronald Koeman has decided to substitute Dusan Tadic and he is replaced by Gaston Ramirez (Southampton).
A substitution has been made. Sadio Mane is replaced by Juanmi (Southampton).
Michail Antonio (West Ham) connects with a cross from out wide in the six-yard box, but only plants his header onto the bar.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the roof of the net, and thus alter the score to 0:1.
Enner Valencia comes off the pitch to be replaced by Pedro Obiang (West Ham).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) has tested the patience of referee Neil Swarbrick and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Alan Pardew probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Marouane Chamakh. He is replaced by Patrick Bamford (Crystal Palace).

Brede Hangeland (Crystal Palace) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the bottom right corner, but Lukasz Fabianski keeps the ball out.
Substitution. Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) has come on for Jonjo Shelvey.
Alan Curtis has decided to substitute Marvin Emnes and he is replaced by Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea).
Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Pape Souare (Crystal Palace), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Neil Taylor (Swansea) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Neil Swarbrick ignores the protests.
Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Neil Swarbrick pulls out a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace) will replace Jason Puncheon.

Patrick Bamford (Crystal Palace) makes a yard for himself as he picks up the rebound after chaos in the box and quickly sends a shot towards the middle of the goal. The opponent's goalkeeper pulls off a comfortable save to keep the ball from hitting the net.
Substitution. Jordon Mutch (Crystal Palace) in, James McArthur out.
Alan Curtis has decided to make a change. Kyle Bartley (Swansea) replaces Jordi Amat.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly wide of the right post.
Today's referee Neil Swarbrick rightly decides to book Brede Hangeland (Crystal Palace) for his harsh tackle.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) unleashes a shot goalwards from a mid-range free kick. The ball heads towards the right post, but the goalkeeper makes a decent save to thwart him.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
Goal - 0:1! Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) receives a precise pass inside the box from Marko Arnautovic and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.
Goal! Romelu Lukaku (Everton) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from James McCarthy, then sends the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
What was Philipp Wollscheid (Stoke City) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
We are about to witness a substitution. Tom Cleverley (Everton) is replacing James McCarthy.
Brendan Galloway (Everton) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post.
Mark Clattenburg rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Gerard Deulofeu (Everton).
Wonderful movement! Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) makes a good run to pick up a cross on the edge of the box and sends an accurate shot into the top left corner.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Mark Clattenburg has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Bojan Krkic goes off the pitch and Joselu (Stoke City) comes on.
Tom Cleverley plays a terrific cross over to Romelu Lukaku (Everton), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
Roberto Martinez prepares a substitution. Tom Cleverley is replaced by Steven Naismith (Everton).

Steven Naismith (Everton) gets on the end of a pass and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but it's blocked by one of the defending players. Everton will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
It's in the back of the net! Ross Barkley sprays a pass out to Gerard Deulofeu (Everton), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 3:2.
Here comes a substitution. Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) is brought on as a substitute for Geoff Cameron.
What a hit! Joselu (Stoke City) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the top of the net. 3:3.
The referee signals a substitution. Marco van Ginkel (Stoke City) is brought on as a substitute for Xherdan Shaqiri.
Seamus Coleman (Everton) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
John Stones (Everton) makes a slide tackle, but referee Mark Clattenburg blows for a foul. It's a penalty! What an opportunity to score for Stoke.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by John Stones (Everton) was quite harsh and Mark Clattenburg didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) keeps his cool and scores from the penalty spot.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would have probably ended up inside the right post, but Declan Rudd pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
A stunning volley by Jonathan Howson (Norwich)! His low effort from inside the box finishes deep inside the right post.

Graham Dorrans (Norwich) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner, but his effort goes narrowly wide of the right post. This should be a big warning for the defence. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Aston Villa.
Graham Scott rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Jordan Veretout (Aston Villa).
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Wasted opportunity. Jonathan Howson (Norwich) gets to the rebound inside the box and smashes the ball just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Aston Villa will have a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Scott Sinclair departs the field of play to be replaced by Adama Traore (Aston Villa).
The referee Graham Scott awards Ryan Bennett (Norwich) a yellow card.
Substitution. Leandro Bacuna is replaced by Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa).
Graham Scott shows a yellow card to Idrissa Gueye (Aston Villa), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
It's time for a substitution. Jack Grealish (Aston Villa) comes on in place of Jordan Veretout.
Alex Neil decides to make a substitution. Graham Dorrans will be replaced by Gary O'Neil (Norwich).

A perfect lofted pass from Wesley Hoolahan finds Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Brad Guzan had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
Alex Neil has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Cameron Jerome (Norwich) replacing Dieumerci Mbokani.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Vadis Odjidja-Ofoe (Norwich) is coming onto the pitch as Wesley Hoolahan cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) is booked.
Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Graham Scott didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Russell Martin (Norwich) receives a yellow card!
It's like he was asking for a caution. Micah Richards (Aston Villa) receives a yellow card.
A truly beautiful footballing moment. Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) takes the free kick from a very promising position, but the goalkeeper thwarts the effort with an amazing save.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Dele Alli (Tottenham).
GOAL! Erik Lamela (Tottenham) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 0:1.
Gooal! Odion Ighalo (Watford) scores with a shot from inside the box after latching onto a headed pass from Troy Deeney. He makes it 1:1.
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) comes onto the pitch after Mousa Dembele signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Half-time substitution. Almen Abdi is replaced by Valon Behrami (Watford).
Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) is booked by the referee.
Jose Manuel Jurado (Watford) picks up a caution.
It's time for a substitution. Sebastian Prodl (Watford) comes on in place of Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera.
Nathan Ake (Watford) can have an early bath after being sent off by the referee for a tackle that simply has no place in football!
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Troy Deeney (Watford).
The game is interrupted. Odion Ighalo (Watford) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Here comes a substitution. Allan Nyom (Watford) is brought on as a substitute for Jose Manuel Jurado.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) replacing Thomas Carroll.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) will replace Dele Alli.
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Toby Alderweireld (Tottenham) for a tough tackle.
What a goal! Kieran Trippier swings a cross into the box and Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) scores a magnificent back-heel goal! 1:2.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Victor Anichebe (West Brom) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Jonas Olsson just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Craig Gardner (West Brom) replaces him.
Steve McClaren is forced to make a change. Vurnon Anita is unable to continue due to injury, Cheik Tiote (Newcastle Utd) comes on.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Paul Dummett (Newcastle Utd) latches on to the corner kick inside the box, but his header crashes against the crossbar! The goalkeeper would have been helpless. Fabricio Coloccini (Newcastle Utd) gets to a rebound in the six-yard box and his effort smashes off the right post.

Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Newcastle earn a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Saido Berahino (West Brom) replaces James Morrison.
Here is a change. Ayoze Perez is going off and Steve McClaren gives the last tactical orders to Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd).
CHANCE! Victor Anichebe (West Brom) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar!

A perfect lofted pass from Claudio Yacob finds Darren Fletcher (West Brom), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header to the middle in the countermovement of the keeper. His effort was both strong and precise, and Karl Darlow had no chance of stopping that. 0:0.

Victor Anichebe (West Brom) bursts inside the box, beats two defenders and produces a strike from the penalty spot. The shot has power, but lacks precision and the goalkeeper stops it easily. The scoreline remains the same. West Brom have been awarded a corner kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Florian Thauvin (Newcastle Utd) comes onto the pitch so that Jack Colback can be given a rest.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Rickie Lambert (West Brom) is coming onto the pitch as Victor Anichebe cannot continue after picking up an injury.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Goal - 1:0! Mesut Ozil laid the ball off to Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal), who shot from close range into the bottom right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Goal Mesut Ozil (Arsenal)! Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) was put through by Theo Walcott and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 2:0.

Theo Walcott passes to Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 3:0.
Ashley Young (Manchester United) has tested the patience of referee Anthony Taylor and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
What was Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Alexis Sanchez swings in an inviting cross that finds Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal). He doesn't take advantage as his effort goes harmlessly wide of the left post.

Anthony Martial (Manchester United) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and produces a low shot that sails towards the middle of a goal. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper makes a comfortable save.
Anthony Taylor has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Anthony Taylor starts the second half.
Half-time substitution. Memphis Depay will not participate anymore and Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) is coming on.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Matteo Darmian is replaced by Antonio Valencia (Manchester United).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) was quite harsh and Anthony Taylor didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 19 metres out. Petr Cech stops the effort which is headed to the right post. The ball goes out of play and Manchester Utd have been awarded a corner kick. Manchester Utd have been awarded a corner kick.
Arsene Wenger has decided to substitute Theo Walcott and he is replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).
Here comes a substitution. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) is brought on as a substitute for Mesut Ozil.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alexis Sanchez departs the field of play to be replaced by Kieran Gibbs (Arsenal).
Louis van Gaal has decided to make a change. James Wilson (Manchester United) replaces Juan Manuel Mata.
What a chance that is! Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the crossbar!
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Jefferson Montero sends a precise lofted pass into the box, Andre Ayew (Swansea) rises above the defenders to meet the ball and heads it straight into the right side of the goal. The score sheet now reads 1:0.
A yellow card for a tackle by Federico Fernandez (Swansea). Michael Dean doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Tottenham are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) takes the free kick and sends it towards the bottom right corner of the goal, giving the goalkeeper no chance.

This is really unlucky! Harry Kane (Tottenham) attempted to clear the ball away after the opposition’s corner kick into the box, but instead miskicked the clearance and put it into his own net, specifically into the top left corner. He won't enjoy watching the highlights later.
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) sends a direct shot in from the free kick that's in a promising position. The ball sails towards the right post, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Ben Davies (Tottenham) for a tough tackle.
The referee signals a substitution. Andros Townsend (Tottenham) is brought on as a substitute for Erik Lamela.
Here comes a substitution. Clinton N'Jie (Tottenham) is brought on as a substitute for Nacer Chadli.
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) scores a goal from the resulting free kick, sending it into the top right corner. What a strike that is, absolutely fantastic!
Substitution. Modou Barrow (Swansea) on for Gylfi Sigurdsson.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Lukasz Fabianski stops the ball from going inside right post.
The foul by Eric Dier (Tottenham) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Dean.

Andros Townsend (Tottenham) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom right corner, but Lukasz Fabianski made a crucial save!
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) replacing Harry Kane.
Jan Vertonghen (Tottenham) gets a yellow card. The referee Michael Dean made the right call.
Substitution. Jack Cork (Swansea) replaces Jonjo Shelvey.
Kyle Walker (Tottenham) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Dean ignores the protests.

Great movement by Ashley Williams (Swansea)! He jumps for a precise cross and produces a header towards the top right corner, but the goalkeeper luckily denies the effort by pushing the ball onto the post.
Michael Dean is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Danny Ings (Liverpool) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar.

James Milner (Liverpool) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Tim Howard is alert and denies him with a nice save. Liverpool force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.

Steven Naismith (Everton) leaps highest around the penalty spot to meet a cross from the free kick and produces a promising goal-bound header towards the roof of the net, but Simon Mignolet pulls off a fine save to deny him. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Everton.

The ball rebounds outside of the penalty area and falls to James McCarthy (Everton) who directs his shot to the left side of the goal, but the keeper is there in time to stop his effort. The referee points to the corner flag and Everton will take a corner.
The referee gives a yellow card to Ross Barkley (Everton).
Emre Can (Liverpool) is punished with the yellow card.
Gooal! James Milner takes over corner duties. Danny Ings (Liverpool) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the right side of the net. 0:1.
Goal! Romelu Lukaku (Everton) gathered the ball off a rebound inside the box and fired home into the bottom left corner.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Martin Atkinson has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The substitution is prepared. Aaron Lennon (Everton) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Gerard Deulofeu.
James McCarthy (Everton) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Martin Atkinson had an easy-decision to make.
Ross Barkley (Everton) has an effort on goal, but he misses to the right of the goal.
Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Simon Mignolet is alert and denies him.
Danny Ings comes off the pitch to be replaced by Adam Lallana (Liverpool).
Today's match ends for Steven Naismith who will be replaced by Arouna Kone (Everton).
Brendan Rodgers has decided to substitute Lucas Leiva and he is replaced by Joe Allen (Liverpool).
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Mamadou Sakho (Liverpool) is yellow-carded.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) picks up a yellow card for a foul. Chelsea earn a free kick.
Willian (Chelsea) successfully takes the free kick. He curls the ball over the wall of defenders from about 25 metres from goal and it bounces in off the inside of the right post.
Steven Davis (Southampton) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.
Oscar (Chelsea) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed under the crossbar, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Sadio Mane (Southampton) is given a yellow card.

Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. Southampton win a corner.
Ramires (Chelsea) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.

It's in the back of the net! Steven Davis (Southampton) produces a brilliant first-time effort from the edge of the penalty area after receiving the ball from Graziano Pelle. The goalkeeper would need to possess super powers to stop this shot from reaching the left side of the goal.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Oriol Romeu comes off for James Ward-Prowse (Southampton).
Here is a change after the half-time break.  Ramires is replaced by Nemanja Matic (Chelsea).
Sadio Mane (Southampton) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Asmir Begovic.

Sadio Mane (Southampton) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.
James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) gets the ball from a rebound before trying his luck with a good long-range shot which threatens the goalkeeper! The ball sails painfully wide of the right post!
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Falcao (Chelsea).
Goal! Graziano Pelle displays great vision and sends a pass to Sadio Mane (Southampton), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 1:2.
It will be a substitution. Pedro (Chelsea) is ready to enter the pitch as Willian walks off.
Goal! Sadio Mane displays great vision and sends a pass to Graziano Pelle (Southampton), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:3.
Here comes a substitution. Loic Remy (Chelsea) is brought on as a substitute for Nemanja Matic.

Dusan Tadic (Southampton) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. It will be a corner kick for Southampton.
Robert Madley shows the yellow card to James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) for a heavy challenge.
Ronald Koeman has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) replacing Dusan Tadic.
Robert Madley shows a yellow card to Graziano Pelle (Southampton) for a tough tackle. Chelsea are awarded the free kick.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Sadio Mane as he is replaced by Maya Yoshida (Southampton).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.

Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) gets into a good scoring position. He creates some space for himself and tries his luck from distance. His decent effort towards the top left corner is, however, superbly saved by Brad Guzan! Corner kick. Stoke will have an opportunity.

Joleon Lescott (Aston Villa) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Stoke will have a goal kick.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
A brilliant cross into the box finds Jonathan Walters (Stoke City), who directs his header to the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes an astonishing save.
Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Tim Sherwood has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Jack Grealish (Aston Villa) comes on the pitch for Joleon Lescott.
Glen Johnson plays a neat ball into the path of Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City), who makes room for a shot and fires in off the right post! 0:1.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City) is coming onto the pitch as Bojan Krkic cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Tim Sherwood prepares a substitution. Scott Sinclair is replaced by Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa).
Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels low towards the middle of the target, but Jack Butland easily deals with the threat.
Mark Hughes is forced to make a change. Marko Arnautovic is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Marco van Ginkel (Stoke City).
Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City) goes on a mazy run and tries his luck with a mid-range strike, but one of the defending players steps in and makes a block.
That's the end of the game for Ashley Westwood, who is replaced by Carles Gil (Aston Villa).
Mark Hughes is forced to make a change. Mame Diouf is unable to continue due to injury, Joselu (Stoke City) comes on.

An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Stoke will have a goal kick.
Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Brad Guzan stops the ball from hitting the bottom left corner.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Matt Ritchie produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Glenn Murray (Bournemouth) rises high to head the ball into the left side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:0.
Glenn Murray (Bournemouth) has received a yellow card for his foul.
GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Odion Ighalo (Watford) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 1:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Michael Oliver blows his whistle to start the second half.
Ben Watson (Watford) tries his luck with a shot from the edge of the box, but the ball crashes against the crossbar! It would have been a superb goal.
Marc Pugh comes off the pitch to be replaced by Adam Smith (Bournemouth).
Joshua King will be replaced by Eunan O'Kane (Bournemouth).
Quique Flores has decided to substitute Allan Nyom and he is replaced by Victor Ibarbo (Watford).
Problems for Quique Flores as Ikechi Anya is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Juan Carlos Paredes (Watford) replaces him.

Etienne Capoue (Watford) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Michael Oliver blows his whistle for an infringement. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for Bournemouth.
Heurelho Gomes (Watford) disagrees with the decision of the referee and is given a yellow card.
Glenn Murray (Bournemouth) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.

Glenn Murray (Bournemouth) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot inside the right post. Heurelho Gomes anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and leaps to stop his effort. Now Bournemouth have a corner.
That's the end of the game for Almen Abdi, who is replaced by Adlene Guedioura (Watford).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) produces a mid-range free kick and sends a daisy-cutter towards the left post, but the goalkeeper makes a good save and stops his effort.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) latches onto a cross into the box from the wing and gets in a header. It went well towards the goal, but it was blocked by one of the defenders.

It's a goal! Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) makes it 0:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Georginio Wijnaldum and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Joe Hart was helpless.
Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Joe Hart pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post.
Vurnon Anita (Newcastle Utd) takes out his opponent with a nasty challenge and is relieved when the referee only gives him a booking.
GOAL! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) scores with a header from close range after Fernandinho headed a pin-point lofted cross into his path. It's 1:1.
Fernandinho (Manchester City) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Manuel Pellegrini makes a half-time substitution. Jesus Navas (Manchester City) comes on in place of Raheem Sterling.
GOAL 2:1! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) brilliantly slaloms his way forward past a few defenders and unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which is deflected and goes into the back of the net.
Goal! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) picks up a pass and gets to the edge of the box before clipping a brilliant lob over the goalkeeper and into the empty net. He makes it 3:1.
It will be a substitution. Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) is ready to enter the pitch as Kevin Mbabu walks off.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) finds himself unmarked in the penalty box and gets himself on the end of a brilliant cross to smash the ball into the top left corner.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box. The ball goes inside the right post and past the goalkeeper.

Goal! Kevin De Bruyne displays great vision and sends a pass to Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 6:1.
Fabricio Coloccini (Newcastle Utd) receives a yellow card for infringement.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Sergio Aguero walks off the pitch to be replaced by Wilfried Bony (Manchester City).
Steve McClaren has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Florian Thauvin (Newcastle Utd) replacing Yoan Gouffran.
Moussa Sissoko goes off the pitch and Cheik Tiote (Newcastle Utd) comes on.
Wilfried Bony (Manchester City) spurns a great opportunity from inside the 6-yard box. The ball flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Substitution. Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) in, David Silva out.
Pablo Zabaleta (Manchester City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Kevin Friend had an easy-decision to make.
Booking. Eliaquim Mangala (Manchester City) receives a caution from the referee.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) missed a great opportunity! He finds himself some space near the penalty spot and plants a header goalwards which lacks both power and accuracy. The ball sails well over the bar!

Nice individual effort by Jamie Vardy (Leicester). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the bottom left corner, but John Ruddy does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out. Leicester have been awarded a corner kick.

Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but John Ruddy leaps like a salmon to deny him. Leicester force their opponents to concede a corner.
Mark Clattenburg blows the whistle, Sebastien Bassong (Norwich) is penalised for a foul. Leicester are awarded a penalty!
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) fires the penalty inside the left post.
Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Jeffery Schlupp (Leicester) receives a well-taken defence-splitting low pass inside the box and scores! His great effort makes its way into the bottom right corner of the net.
Substitution. Nathan Redmond (Norwich) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Graham Dorrans walks off.
Here comes a substitution. Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) is brought on as a substitute for Matthew Jarvis.
Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) leaps like a salmon to produce a header from the resulting corner, but one of the defending players intercepts the ball and averts the danger. Norwich win a corner.
Robert Huth (Leicester) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Danny Simpson departs the field of play to be replaced by Yohan Benalouane (Leicester).

Jonathan Howson sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:2.
The substitution is prepared. Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Shinji Okazaki.
Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Substitution. Jeffery Schlupp makes way for Andy King (Leicester).
Here is a change. Cameron Jerome is going off and Alex Neil gives the last tactical orders to Kyle Lafferty (Norwich).
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) connects with a pass inside the box, but his effort goes well wide of the left post.

Nathan Redmond (Norwich) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the top right corner. Kasper Schmeichel is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. Norwich force a corner. They send men into the box.
Robert Huth (Leicester) rises high to meet a cross from the corner kick and plants a header from inside the penalty area. His effort went just narrowly wide of the left post.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) attempts to score with a first-time shot from the edge of the box. His effort towards the middle of the goal is saved by John Ruddy.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Yellow card. Mark Noble (West Ham) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Goal Steven Fletcher (Sunderland)! Steven Fletcher (Sunderland) was put through by Yann M'Vila and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the top of the net. 1:0.
Goal! Jeremain Lens (Sunderland) picks up a pass and gets to the edge of the box before clipping a brilliant lob over the goalkeeper and into the empty net. He makes it 2:0.
Winston Reid (West Ham) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Neil Swarbrick had an easy-decision to make.

What a great chance for John O'Shea (Sunderland). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header right under the bar, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save.
Jeremain Lens (Sunderland) picks up a yellow card.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) was quite harsh and Neil Swarbrick didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post.
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post.
Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) is booked by the referee.
It's in the back of the net! Victor Moses picks out Carl Jenkinson (West Ham) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 2:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Neil Swarbrick has ended it.
Referee Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle to start the second half.
That was close. Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) fires a shot from the edge of the box which goes a whisker wide of the right post.
RED CARD! Jeremain Lens (Sunderland) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Neil Swarbrick. He can have an early bath.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Victor Moses as he is replaced by Nikica Jelavic (West Ham).
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) fires a strong shot to the middle of the goal and the save is unexpectedly difficult for Costel Pantilimon.
Dimitri Payet (West Ham) is in the right place at the right time. He picks up the rebound after the goalkeeper's poor save and scores easily!
Nikica Jelavic (West Ham) misses a rebound from close range. His effort floats narrowly over the crossbar!
We are about to witness a subsitution. James Collins (West Ham) for Winston Reid.
Carl Jenkinson (West Ham) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Sebastian Coates (Sunderland) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Substitution. Mark Noble makes way for Mauro Zarate (West Ham).
The substitution has been made. Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland) has replaced Ola Toivonen.
Dick Advocaat has decided to substitute Steven Fletcher and he is replaced by Jack Rodwell (Sunderland).
The manager makes a subsitution with Jordi Gomez (Sunderland) coming on for Yann M'Vila.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) produces a stunning solo run from the middle of the pitch, all the way to the penalty area. He unleashes a decent strike which goes narrowly wide of the right post.
James McClean (West Brom) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Jonathan Moss had an easy-decision to make.
Problems for Tony Pulis as Jonny Evans is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and James Chester (West Brom) replaces him.
The game has begun to heat up. Pape Souare (Crystal Palace) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.

Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) weaves his way through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the right post is thwarted by Glyn Oliver Myhill. The linesman makes the right call and Crystal Palace will have a corner.

Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Glyn Oliver Myhill makes a great save to stop the effort going into the middle of the goal.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Jonathan Moss blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Tony Pulis gives a chance to Craig Gardner (West Brom) and Saido Berahino is off.
Yellow card! It's like James Chester (West Brom) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Jonathan Moss agrees and books him.

It's a goal! Yannick Bolasie (Crystal Palace) makes it 0:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Yohan Cabaye and planted his close-range header into the right side of the goal. Glyn Oliver Myhill was helpless.
Substitution. Callum McManaman (West Brom) has come on for James Morrison.
Here is a change. Dwight Gayle is going off and Alan Pardew gives the last tactical orders to Fraizer Campbell (Crystal Palace).
Fraizer Campbell (Crystal Palace) picks up a yellow card.
The foul by Claudio Yacob (West Brom) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jonathan Moss.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) is shown a yellow card.
One of the West Brom players unfairly tackled his opponent and conceded a foul. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Crystal Palace!
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Goal! Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) slams home the penalty with a precise shot which goes inside the right post.
Substitution. Wilfried Zaha walks off the pitch and Joe Ledley (Crystal Palace) comes on as a substitute.
Jonathan Moss is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Jonas Olsson is being substituted because of an injury. Tony Pulis sends James Chester (West Brom) on the pitch.
Goal - 1:0! James Morrison laid the ball off to Saido Berahino (West Brom), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The end of the first half.
Referee Robert Madley blows his whistle to start the second half.
Gooal! Chris Brunt takes over corner duties. Craig Dawson (West Brom) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the left side of the net. 2:0.

It's in the back of the net! Gerard Deulofeu sends a superb cross into the box. Romelu Lukaku (Everton) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header inside the left post, leaving Glyn Oliver Myhill beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:1.
Steven Naismith (Everton) attempts to discuss the decision with Robert Madley, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Craig Gardner (West Brom) is coming onto the pitch as Jose Rondon cannot continue after picking up an injury.
James McCarthy (Everton) is cautioned by the referee.
Roberto Martinez has decided to make a change. Darron Gibson (Everton) replaces Tyias Browning.
Here is a change. Steven Naismith is going off and Roberto Martinez gives the last tactical orders to Arouna Kone (Everton).
Goal! Romelu Lukaku produces a great pass that finds Arouna Kone (Everton) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom left corner. 2:1.
Booking. Arouna Kone (Everton) receives a caution from the referee.
Goal! Gerard Deulofeu puts a cross into the box and finds Romelu Lukaku (Everton), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the right post. He makes it 2:3.
Here comes a substitution. Rickie Lambert (West Brom) is brought on as a substitute for Claudio Yacob.
Rickie Lambert (West Brom) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Roberto Martinez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Aaron Lennon (Everton) replacing Romelu Lukaku.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A yellow card for a tackle by Almen Abdi (Watford). Anthony Taylor doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
OFF THE BAR! Jose Manuel Jurado (Watford) strikes a brilliant shot towards goal from the free kick, but his effort rattles the crossbar.

OFF THE POST! Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Substitution. Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) replaces Bakary Sako.
Quique Flores prepares a substitution. Almen Abdi is replaced by Steven Berghuis (Watford).
Allan Nyom (Watford) tackles a bit over-zealously and Anthony Taylor blows for a foul. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Crystal Palace.
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) is going to take the penalty!
Jose Manuel Jurado (Watford) is booked for saying more than Anthony Taylor was willing to tolerate.
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) coolly converts the penalty, sending the ball into the top left corner.
Substitution. Nathan Ake (Watford) has come on for Allan Nyom.
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) for a tough tackle.
Here is a change. Yohan Cabaye is going off and Alan Pardew gives the last tactical orders to James McArthur (Crystal Palace).
Sebastian Prodl (Watford) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) sees a yellow card from Anthony Taylor after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Craig Cathcart (Watford) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Anthony Taylor didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Substitution. Ben Watson leaves the pitch and is replaced by Victor Ibarbo (Watford).
Alan Pardew has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Fraizer Campbell (Crystal Palace) replacing Dwight Gayle.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
A yellow card is awarded to Wayne Hennessey (Crystal Palace).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Loic Remy (Chelsea) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Newcastle.

Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the middle of the target, but Asmir Begovic was alert and the score remains the same.

Asmir Begovic was forced into action to thwart Daryl Janmaat (Newcastle Utd). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Jack Colback (Newcastle Utd) for his blatant foul.

Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 25 metres out. Tim Krul stops the effort which is headed for the top right corner. The ball is out of play and Chelsea manage to earn a corner.

Vurnon Anita sends an inch-perfect lofted cross into the box. Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot which hits the left post and bounces in off it. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:0.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
Steve McClaren prepares a substitution. Jack Colback is replaced by Gabriel Obertan (Newcastle Utd).
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header perfectly into the left side of the goal. He makes it 1:0.
The game has come to an end for Loic Remy. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Falcao (Chelsea).
Jose Mourinho has decided to make a change. Willian (Chelsea) replaces Nemanja Matic.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) was quite harsh and Martin Atkinson didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution.  Oscar makes way for  Ramires (Chelsea).
Ramires (Chelsea) latches on to a pass and controls it with a good first touch. He unleashes a deadly strike from around 24 metres out which goes into the top left corner.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Aleksandar Mitrovic departs the field of play to be replaced by Ivan Toney (Newcastle Utd).

Willian (Chelsea) scores a marvellous goal! He smashed a direct free kick from 25 metres into the middle of the net. The normally comfortable situation became a problem for the goalkeeper as the ball slipped behind his back.

Ramires (Chelsea) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Tim Krul pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
Here comes a substitution. Moussa Sissoko is given a rest as he is replaced by Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd).
Pedro (Chelsea) has tested the patience of referee Martin Atkinson and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
What a great touch by Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.

What a chance that is! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the right post!
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Petr Cech with a strike into the right side of the goal. He makes it 1:0.

Kasper Schmeichel pulls off a great save to deny Theo Walcott (Arsenal) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Arsenal have been awarded a corner kick.
What a chance that is! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header crashes off the crossbar!
After receiving a beautiful pass, Theo Walcott (Arsenal) had a huge opportunity. He coolly unleashed a perfect shot, which went in off the right post.
The referee signals a substitution. Mikel Arteta (Arsenal) is brought on as a substitute for Mathieu Flamini.
Goal 1:2! Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Claudio Ranieri has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Andy King (Leicester) comes on the pitch for Shinji Okazaki.

Mesut Ozil showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header inside the right post. It's 1:3.
Substitution. Marc Albrighton leaves the pitch and is replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester).
What an amazing save by Kasper Schmeichel! Theo Walcott (Arsenal) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot low towards the middle of the target, but fails.
Mikel Arteta (Arsenal) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Craig Pawson pulls out a yellow card.
Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Craig Pawson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Substitution. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) on for Aaron Ramsey.
Claudio Ranieri has decided to substitute Daniel Drinkwater and he is replaced by Andrej Kramaric (Leicester).
It's time for a substitution. Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) comes on in place of Theo Walcott.
Nice piece of skill by Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal). He perfectly collected a pass from Nacho Monreal and unleashed a fantastic long-range strike which went into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:4.
