Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Carles Gil (Aston Villa) gets booked.
It is time for a substitution. Craig Gardner (West Brom) is on for Saido Berahino.
Tim Sherwood prepares a substitution. Carles Gil is replaced by Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa).
Claudio Yacob (West Brom) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
That's the end of the game for Carlos Sanchez, who is replaced by Jordan Veretout (Aston Villa).
Jordan Amavi (Aston Villa) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Tony Pulis has decided to substitute Jose Rondon and he is replaced by Rickie Lambert (West Brom).
The referee signals a substitution. Jonas Olsson (West Brom) is brought on as a substitute for James McClean.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Goal! Dan Gosling produces a great pass that finds Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a low shot into the back of the net. 1:0.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Matt Ritchie (Bournemouth) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a magnificent shot into the top left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Costel Pantilimon, so the score changes to 2:0.
Sebastian Coates (Sunderland) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Jordi Gomez (Sunderland) almost scores with a cheeky low shot towards goal that goes under the defensive wall, but Artur Boruc is alert and makes a good save.
Billy Jones (Sunderland) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his low effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Artur Boruc.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Younes Kaboul (Sunderland) was quite harsh and Kevin Friend didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Dick Advocaat probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Jordi Gomez. He is replaced by Jack Rodwell (Sunderland).
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Glenn Murray (Bournemouth) receives a yellow card!
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Jeremain Lens (Sunderland) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) struck the ball which rebounded to the edge of the box. His attempt went narrowly over the crossbar.
Today's referee Kevin Friend rightly decides to book Fabio Borini (Sunderland) for his harsh tackle.
The manager makes a subsitution with Eunan O'Kane (Bournemouth) coming on for Lee Tomlin.
Dick Advocaat prepares a substitution. Jermain Defoe is replaced by Steven Fletcher (Sunderland).
Substitution. Fabio Borini walks off the pitch and Adam Johnson (Sunderland) comes on as a substitute.
Younes Kaboul (Sunderland) should have been more careful. He commits a bad foul, receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!
Eddie Howe has decided to make a change. Glenn Murray (Bournemouth) replaces Callum Wilson.
Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Kevin Friend didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Ola Toivonen (Sunderland) for a tough tackle. That's a free kick to Bournemouth.
OFF THE BAR! Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball crashes against the crossbar.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Adam Smith (Bournemouth) for Matt Ritchie.
Kevin Friend shows the yellow card to Glenn Murray (Bournemouth) for a heavy challenge.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Odion Ighalo (Watford) unleashes a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.

Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd) finds himself some space inside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Heurelho Gomes pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going low into the middle of the target.
Odion Ighalo (Watford) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Etienne Capoue, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:1.
Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
What a chance for Troy Deeney (Watford) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball went just wide of the right post.
Goal - 0:2! Troy Deeney laid the ball off to Odion Ighalo (Watford), who shot from close range into the bottom right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Almen Abdi (Watford) receives a yellow card!
Florian Thauvin (Newcastle Utd) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires from the edge of the box to the middle of the goal, but Heurelho Gomes is equal to it.
The end of the first half.
Steve McClaren has made a change at the break. Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd) has come on in place of Papiss Cisse.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

GOAL! Superb work from Moussa Sissoko, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Daryl Janmaat (Newcastle Utd), who beats Heurelho Gomes with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 1:2.
Daryl Janmaat (Newcastle Utd) takes a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball heads towards the right post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a fantastic save.
The manager makes a subsitution with Steven Berghuis (Watford) coming on for Almen Abdi.

Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He latches on to a precise pass and fires a decent first-time low shot towards goal from a promising distance, but Heurelho Gomes denies him.
Substitution. Nathan Ake (Watford) has come on for Jose Manuel Jurado.
Steve McClaren has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Rolando Aarons (Newcastle Utd) replacing Massadio Haidara.
Caution goes to Etienne Capoue (Watford).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ben Watson trots off the pitch and is replaced by Adlene Guedioura (Watford).
Steve McClaren prepares a substitution. Florian Thauvin is replaced by Gabriel Obertan (Newcastle Utd).
Jack Colback (Newcastle Utd) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Allan Nyom (Watford) makes a good run with the ball into the box, but mishits his shot as it goes high over the bar.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Bojan Krkic (Stoke City). Marko Arnautovic plays a fantastic through ball and finds Bojan Krkic (Stoke City), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Jonathan Walters (Stoke City), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 2:0.
Ritchie De Laet (Leicester) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) connects with a cross and powers a header goalwards, but his effort goes just over the bar.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Claudio Ranieri makes a half-time substitution. Marc Albrighton (Leicester) comes on in place of Gokhan Inler.

Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Andre Marriner blows his whistle for an infringement. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Leicester.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the right side of the goal.

Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) has a good opportunity as he meets a cross on the edge of the six-yard box and heads it towards the target. One of the defenders stands on the goal line and manages to keep the ball out.
Today's referee Andre Marriner rightly decides to book Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) for his harsh tackle.
N'Golo Kante (Leicester) sees a yellow card from Andre Marriner after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Jack Butland makes a decent save to deny his effort directed to the bottom right corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Shinji Okazaki leaves the pitch and Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) comes on.
Goal! Riyad Mahrez plays a pass to the feet of Jamie Vardy (Leicester), and he shoots into the bottom right corner from inside the box. It's 2:2.
Bojan Krkic (Stoke City) argues with the referee and is booked for dissent.
Substitution. Marko Arnautovic makes his way off the pitch and Peter Crouch (Stoke City) comes on as his replacement.
The game is interrupted. Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.

What an opportunity! Geoff Cameron (Stoke City) leaps high to meet a beautiful cross into the box from the resulting free kick, and he plants a header from near the penalty spot which goes a whisker wide of the right post.
Here comes a substitution. Stephen Ireland (Stoke City) is brought on as a substitute for Marco van Ginkel.
Jeffery Schlupp (Leicester) takes out his opponent with a horrible challenge and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) fires the resulting free kick to the left side of the goal from the edge of the box, but Kasper Schmeichel pulls off a superb save to deny him.
Substitution. Bojan Krkic makes way for Peter Odemwingie (Stoke City).
N'Golo Kante has picked up an injury and is replaced by Andy King (Leicester).
Leonardo Ulloa links up with Jamie Vardy (Leicester), who fires just wide of the right post from the edge of the box.
Andre Marriner is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

Phil Jagielka (Everton) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the resulting corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly over the crossbar.

Romelu Lukaku (Everton) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Romelu Lukaku (Everton) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Everton force their opponents to concede a corner.
Jack Cork (Swansea) says something out of turn to the referee and is shown a yellow card.
Stuart Attwell has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Chance! Brendan Galloway (Everton) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Ross Barkley, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the right post.

Lukasz Fabianski doesn't have to worry about this one. Gareth Barry plays a pass into the feet of Romelu Lukaku (Everton), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes high over the bar.
A yellow card for a tackle by Gareth Barry (Everton). Stuart Attwell doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The free kick from the edge of the box is taken by Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the right post. What a chance!
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
That's the end of the game for Gylfi Sigurdsson, who is replaced by Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea).

What an amazing save by Tim Howard! Jefferson Montero (Swansea) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot under the crossbar, but fails. Swansea win a corner.
The substitution is prepared. Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Arouna Kone.
Tyias Browning (Everton) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Stuart Attwell ignores the protests.
Wow, what an escape. Romelu Lukaku (Everton) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
Stuart Attwell shows the yellow card to Andre Ayew (Swansea) for a heavy challenge.
Substitution. Bafetimbi Gomis makes his way off the pitch and Eder (Swansea) comes on as his replacement.
Here is a change. Andre Ayew is going off and Garry Monk gives the last tactical orders to Modou Barrow (Swansea).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Ross Barkley walks off the pitch to be replaced by Kevin Mirallas (Everton).
Kevin Mirallas (Everton) makes an ugly challenge on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!
Stuart Attwell is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) for a tough tackle.
Pedro (Chelsea) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to make a good save to keep his effort out.
Pedro (Chelsea) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Petr Cech pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Gabriel (Arsenal) earns the yellow card.
Booking. Diego Costa (Chelsea) receives a caution from the referee.
Red card! Gabriel (Arsenal) simply can't believe his eyes. The referee makes the call and sends him off.
Michael Dean has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Arsene Wenger makes a switch. Calum Chambers (Arsenal) is coming on in place of Francis Coquelin at the start of the second period.
Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) sees a yellow card from Michael Dean after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Perfectly taken free kick! Cesc Fabregas sends a cross in and Kurt Zouma (Chelsea) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes inside the right post and he makes it 1:0.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Oscar (Chelsea) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Oscar as he is replaced by Ramires (Chelsea).
Calum Chambers (Arsenal) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Dean ignores the protests.
That's the end of the game for Alexis Sanchez, who is replaced by Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger prepares a substitution. Mesut Ozil is replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) must have known he would be sent off for this foul, but he had to stop the opponent at all costs. Michael Dean shows him a second yellow card and the game has ended for him.
Substitution. Diego Costa walks off the pitch and Loic Remy (Chelsea) comes on as a substitute.
OWN GOAL! Calum Chambers (Arsenal) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 2:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and John Obi Mikel (Chelsea) comes onto the pitch so that Cesc Fabregas can be given a rest.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) fails to turn the rebound in from a promising position. The goalkeeper pulls off a superb save and denies his effort.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.

Dimitri Payet (West Ham) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the top right corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 1:0.

Daryl Janmaat (Newcastle Utd) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball low towards the middle of the goal. However, he couldn't beat Darren Randolph, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Jack Colback (Newcastle Utd) for a tough tackle.
Angelo Ogbonna doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Carl Jenkinson (West Ham) comes onto the pitch to replace him.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.

Victor Moses (West Ham) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball hits the bar and ricochets away.
Goal! The rebound fell to Dimitri Payet (West Ham) and he fired home from close range. The score is 2:0.
Daryl Janmaat (Newcastle Utd) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Anthony Taylor ignores the protests.
Substitution. Manuel Lanzini walks off the pitch and Pedro Obiang (West Ham) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Vurnon Anita did his best and is replaced by Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd).
Steve McClaren prepares a substitution. Florian Thauvin is replaced by Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd).

Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) takes a shot from the free kick on the edge of the box and the ball sails inches wide of the right post. What a chance! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Newcastle.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Georginio Wijnaldum leaves the pitch and Rolando Aarons (Newcastle Utd) comes on.

Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the roof of the net, but Darren Randolph was alert and the score remains the same. The ball goes behind for a corner. Newcastle will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Tim Krul makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Diafra Sakho (West Ham) inside the box and he drills a strike goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Victor Moses walks off the pitch to be replaced by Andrew Carroll (West Ham).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Gabriel Agbonlahor (Aston Villa) breaks past challenges inside the box, but puts too much pace on his pass to Scott Sinclair.

It's in the back of the net! Jack Grealish (Aston Villa) fires a brilliant volley from the edge of the box and it goes inside the right post, leaving the goalkeeper helpless. Micah Richards (Aston Villa) assisted in a goal. What a finish, 0:1.
The foul by Marc Albrighton (Leicester) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Dean.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Michael Dean blows his whistle to start the second half.
Half-time substitution. Claudio Ranieri decided to make a change. Shinji Okazaki is replaced by Nathan Dyer (Leicester).
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) gets on the end of a cross from Jeffrey Schlupp, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the left post.

Carles Gil (Aston Villa) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes inside the left post. He couldn't have done it any better. 0:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Gokhan Inler trots off the pitch and is replaced by N'Golo Kante (Leicester).
Tim Sherwood has decided to make a change. Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) replaces Marc Albrighton.
Substitution. Carles Gil will be replaced by Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa).

Riyad Mahrez produces a cross from the resulting corner and finds Ritchie De Laet (Leicester) inside the box. He pulls the trigger and scores, sending the ball into the top of the net. What a brilliant finish. 1:2.
The substitution has been made. Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) has replaced Gabriel Agbonlahor.
Nathan Dyer (Leicester) goes into the book for bad language. His vulgar comments could have made it worse. Luckily for him, it's a yellow card.
Jordan Amavi (Aston Villa) sees a yellow card from Michael Dean after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Goal! Daniel Drinkwater displays great vision and sends a pass to Jamie Vardy (Leicester), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 2:2.
Alan Hutton (Aston Villa) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Leandro Bacuna.

It's in the back of the net! Riyad Mahrez sends a superb cross into the box. Nathan Dyer (Leicester) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header low inside the right post, leaving Brad Guzan beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 3:2.
That's it for today, Michael Dean has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Referee Craig Pawson blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
A yellow card for a tackle by Jan Vertonghen (Tottenham). Craig Pawson doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Craig Pawson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

OFF THE POST! Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Billy Jones (Sunderland) sees a yellow card from Craig Pawson after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Craig Pawson starts the second half.
That's the end of the game for Heung-Min Son, who is replaced by Andros Townsend (Tottenham).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Dele Alli as he is replaced by Erik Lamela (Tottenham).
Dick Advocaat prepares a substitution. Jordi Gomez is replaced by Lee Cattermole (Sunderland).
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Fabio Borini leaves the pitch to be replaced by Duncan Watmore (Sunderland).
Substitution. Jack Rodwell (Sunderland) replaces Ola Toivonen.
It's in the back of the net! Erik Lamela slips the ball through to Ryan Mason (Tottenham), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:1.
Jack Rodwell (Sunderland) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from just outside the box wasn't accurate enough and the ball bounced away off the bar!
Ryan Mason (Tottenham) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Thomas Carroll (Tottenham) will take his place on the pitch.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Michael Oliver blows his whistle to start the second half.
Louis van Gaal has made a change at the break. Ashley Young (Manchester United) has come on in place of Memphis Depay.

Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Michael Oliver didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket. That's a free kick to Manchester Utd.
Juan Manuel Mata floats a lovely ball in from the free kick to Daley Blind (Manchester United), and he smashes the ball into the top left corner to increase the score to 1:0.

Danny Ings (Liverpool) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the left side of the goal. David de Gea is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save. The linesman makes the right call and Liverpool will have a corner.
The free kick from a promising distance is taken by Ashley Young (Manchester United), who fires in a direct effort inches over the crossbar. What a chance!
Danny Ings (Liverpool) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort.
Here is a change. Roberto Firmino is going off and Brendan Rodgers gives the last tactical orders to Jordon Ibe (Liverpool).
It is time for a substitution. Anthony Martial (Manchester United) is on for Juan Manuel Mata.
Poor challenge! Joe Gomez (Liverpool) is penalised for tripping and Michael Oliver blows his whistle. PENALTY! One of the players from Manchester Utd is about to take a penalty kick.
Ander Herrera (Manchester United) is going to take the penalty!
Ander Herrera (Manchester United) steps up to take the penalty and converts it with a shot into the roof of the net.
Substitution. Morgan Schneiderlin (Manchester United) replaces Michael Carrick.
Today's referee Michael Oliver rightly decides to book Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) for his harsh tackle. Liverpool get a free kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Divock Origi (Liverpool) will replace Danny Ings.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. James Milner (Liverpool) is given a yellow card.

Jordon Ibe (Liverpool) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort under the crossbar is thwarted by David de Gea. The ball goes out for a corner. Liverpool can continue in their attacking effort.
Goal! Christian Benteke (Liverpool) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 2:1.

An amazing individual effort from Anthony Martial (Manchester United) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and makes it 3:1. Simon Mignolet was helpless.
The referee signals a substitution. Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) is brought on as a substitute for Lucas Leiva.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the right post.
Theo Walcott (Arsenal) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post.
The ball goes out of play and Stoke will have a goal kick.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the right post! What a shot that was!
Hector Bellerin swings the cross over. Theo Walcott (Arsenal) gets his head to it but it goes just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stoke.

What a wasted opportunity by Santi Cazorla (Arsenal)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the middle of the net, but Jack Butland makes a comfortable save to thwart him.
It's a goal! Theo Walcott (Arsenal) scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Mesut Ozil. The score is now 1:0.
A yellow card for a tackle by Mesut Ozil (Arsenal). Jonathan Moss doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Jonathan Moss has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Stephen Ireland (Stoke City) will replace Joselu.
Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Jack Butland is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Theo Walcott (Arsenal) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stoke.
Substitution. Mame Diouf makes way for Bojan Krkic (Stoke City).
Arsene Wenger prepares a substitution. Theo Walcott is replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).

Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stoke.
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stoke.
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to Phillip Bardsley (Stoke City) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) on for Mesut Ozil.

It's in the back of the net! Santi Cazorla flights the free kick into the box, where Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) peels off his marker and heads straight into the left side of the net from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 2:0.

Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the right side of the target, but Jack Butland keeps the ball out. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Arsenal.

Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Stoke will have a goal kick.

Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) is shown a yellow card by the referee for a bad sliding tackle on an opponent.
