Mike Jones shows a yellow card to Yaya Toure (Manchester City) for his blatant foul.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.

Jesus Navas (Manchester City) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Jesus Navas (Manchester City). This could have been a legendary goal.
It's time for a substitution. Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) comes on in place of Bakary Sako.
Samir Nasri (Manchester City) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the right side of the goal. Joe Hart shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Brede Hangeland (Crystal Palace) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Mike Jones had an easy-decision to make.
Alan Pardew has decided to substitute Yannick Bolasie and he is replaced by Mile Jedinak (Crystal Palace).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Eliaquim Mangala (Manchester City) was quite harsh and Mike Jones didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Jason Puncheon is substituted due to injury. Alan Pardew gives a chance to Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace).
Substitution. Wilfried Bony makes way for Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City).
Goal 0:1! Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Substitution. Martin Demichelis (Manchester City) on for Samir Nasri.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Sebastien Bassong (Norwich) rises high to connect with a lofted pass inside the box, but one of his opponents is in the right place at the right time to thwart him.
Alexander Tettey (Norwich) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Martin Atkinson ignores the protests.
Simon Francis (Bournemouth) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Adam Smith (Bournemouth) receives a yellow card!

Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender. The linesman points to the corner flag, Bournemouth are going to take it.
Martin Atkinson shows the yellow card to Wesley Hoolahan (Norwich) for a heavy challenge. A free kick has been awarded to Bournemouth.
What a big chance! Cameron Jerome (Norwich) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.

Goal! Wesley Hoolahan displays great vision and sends a pass to Cameron Jerome (Norwich), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:0.
The end of the first half.
Referee Martin Atkinson blows his whistle to start the second half.

Goal! Wesley Hoolahan (Norwich) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom right corner. Artur Boruc had no chance of reaching it. The score is 2:0.
Cameron Jerome (Norwich) connects with a precise cross inside the goalmouth and shoots. One of the defending players reacts in time and clears the ball to safety. Now Norwich have a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yann Kermorgant (Bournemouth) comes onto the pitch for Junior Stanislas.
Eddie Howe prepares a substitution. Joshua King is replaced by Glenn Murray (Bournemouth).
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Matt Ritchie (Bournemouth) for a tough tackle. It's a free kick to Norwich in a dangerous position.
Post! Robbie Brady (Norwich) latches on to a sweet pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which only hits the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
Fantastic team goal! Matthew Jarvis (Norwich) was set free in the area by Jonathan Howson and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the left side of the net. 3:0.
Substitution. Eunan O'Kane is replaced by Dan Gosling (Bournemouth).
Alex Neil has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Graham Dorrans (Norwich) replacing Wesley Hoolahan.
The game has come to an end for Matthew Jarvis. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Martin Olsson (Norwich).

Simon Francis showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Steve Cook (Bournemouth) gets onto the scoresheet by sweetly heading it into the top of the net – 2:0.
Alex Neil has decided to make a change. Dieumerci Mbokani (Norwich) replaces Cameron Jerome.

Robbie Brady (Norwich) doesn't hesitate and begins a run towards the opponent's goal. Defenders try to tackle him, but he manages to keep the ball at his feet and pulls the trigger in front of the goal. The strike, though, was not as successful as the solo run and the ball is easily stopped by the keeper. Norwich force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Almen Abdi (Watford) volleys the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but one of the defenders blocks his shot. The ball is out of play. Watford win a corner kick.

Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom right corner, but Heurelho Gomes was alert and the score remained the same.
Almen Abdi (Watford) whips a volley from long range towards the goal. His beautiful effort whistles wide of the right post. It was close and it could have been a top class goal!
Troy Deeney (Watford) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.

Odion Ighalo (Watford) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Lukasz Fabianski makes a great save to stop the effort going into the bottom left corner.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Robert Madley blows his whistle to start the second half.
What a hit! Odion Ighalo (Watford) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Substitution. Jefferson Montero (Swansea) in, Wayne Routledge out.
Valon Behrami (Watford) can have an early bath after being sent off by the referee for a tackle that simply has no place in football!
Garry Monk has decided to substitute Jack Cork and he is replaced by Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea).
A substitution due to the red card. Almen Abdi walks off the pitch and is replaced by Ben Watson (Watford).
Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Garry Monk prepares a substitution. Gylfi Sigurdsson is replaced by Eder (Swansea).
It will be a substitution. Steven Berghuis (Watford) is ready to enter the pitch as Odion Ighalo walks off.

Lukasz Fabianski was forced into action to thwart Etienne Capoue (Watford). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Jefferson Montero (Swansea) misses a big chance! He fires the ball high over the crossbar from inside the 6-yard box after the ball rebounded to him.
Substitution. Troy Deeney makes his way off the pitch and Alessandro Diamanti (Watford) comes on as his replacement.
The foul by Etienne Capoue (Watford) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Madley.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.

Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) in a great chance! He climbs highest deep in the penalty box and strikes with a powerful header towards the net. Next time he should aim better. His effort ends wide of the right post.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Jose Rondon (West Brom) has a big opportunity! He finds some space for a shot inside the penalty box after collecting a lofted pass and sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar.
Tony Pulis has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Saido Berahino (West Brom) replacing Rickie Lambert.
It's time for a substitution. James McClean (West Brom) comes on in place of Callum McManaman.
A substitution has been made. Jay Rodriguez goes off and Sadio Mane (Southampton) comes on.
Sadio Mane (Southampton) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the right post.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from  as he is replaced by Maya Yoshida (Southampton).
Chris Brunt (West Brom) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Jonny Evans is being substituted because of an injury. Tony Pulis sends Jonas Olsson (West Brom) on the pitch.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Steven Naismith (Everton) comes onto the pitch after Muhamed Besic signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.

It's a goal! Steven Naismith (Everton) makes it 1:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Brendan Galloway and planted his close-range header into the top right corner. Asmir Begovic was helpless.

A brilliant cross into the box finds Arouna Kone (Everton), who directs his header towards the left post, but the goalkeeper shows all his agility and makes an astonishing save. Everton earn a corner.
Goal - 2:0! Steven Naismith (Everton) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Ross Barkley provided an assist for the goal.
Nice piece of skill by Nemanja Matic (Chelsea). He perfectly collected a pass from John Obi Mikel, then unleashed a fantastic long-range strike which went inside the left post. The score is 2:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kenedy (Chelsea) will replace John Obi Mikel.
Brendan Galloway (Everton) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Asmir Begovic can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Romelu Lukaku (Everton). The ball would have probably ended up in the bottom left corner.
That will be all from Pedro who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Falcao (Chelsea).
A substitution has been made. Arouna Kone is replaced by Aaron Lennon (Everton).
Here is a change. Cesc Fabregas is going off and Jose Mourinho gives the last tactical orders to Willian (Chelsea).
Seamus Coleman is substituted due to injury. Roberto Martinez gives a chance to Ramiro Mori (Everton).
Goal! Ross Barkley displays great vision and sends a pass to Steven Naismith (Everton), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 3:1.
John Stones (Everton) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.
Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Andre Marriner had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
CHANCE! Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) fires just wide of the right post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Ander Herrera.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the left post.
Off the post! Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range bounced off the left post.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Morgan Schneiderlin (Manchester United) for his blatant foul.
The foul by Memphis Depay (Manchester United) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Martin Atkinson.
Wayne Routledge (Swansea) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Martin Atkinson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
It's in the back of the net! Luke Shaw plays it into the box, and Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the roof of the net. 0:1.
Wayne Routledge will be replaced by Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea).

A perfect lofted pass from Gylfi Sigurdsson finds Andre Ayew (Swansea), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the left side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Sergio Romero had no chance of stopping that. 0:0.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea). Andre Ayew plays a fantastic through ball and finds Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 2:1.
Juan Manuel Mata comes off the pitch to be replaced by Ashley Young (Manchester United).
Louis van Gaal prepares a substitution. Morgan Schneiderlin is replaced by Michael Carrick (Manchester United).
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ander Herrera.
Jonjo Shelvey (Swansea) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Martin Atkinson's book.
Substitution. Bafetimbi Gomis is replaced by Eder (Swansea).
Substitution. Jonjo Shelvey makes way for Kyle Bartley (Swansea).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.

James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) fires the resultant free kick towards the left post, but the keeper makes a brilliant save and denies him the chance to score. The referee points to the corner flag and Southampton will take a corner.
Dusan Tadic clips a neat ball into the box towards Graziano Pelle (Southampton), whose header from the centre of the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.
The expression of the referee Jonathan Moss is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Steven Whittaker (Norwich) is shown a yellow card.
What a big chance! Dusan Tadic (Southampton) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Jonathan Moss blows his whistle and Steven Whittaker (Norwich) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
Alex Neil has decided to make a change due to the red card. Andre Wisdom (Norwich) is brought on as a substitute for Wesley Hoolahan.

GOAL! Superb work from Sadio Mane, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Graziano Pelle (Southampton), who beats John Ruddy with a brilliant shot into the right side of the net. 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Ronald Koeman has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) comes on the pitch for Steven Davis.
Sadio Mane (Southampton) produced a promising shot towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but John Ruddy thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
Sadio Mane links up with Graziano Pelle (Southampton), who fires just wide of the right post from the edge of the box.
It's 2:0! Sadio Mane feeds Dusan Tadic (Southampton) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the top right corner.

Graziano Pelle (Southampton) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by John Ruddy, who pulls off a comfortable save!
Goal! Dusan Tadic (Southampton) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 3:0.
That will be all from Graham Dorrans who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Bradley Johnson (Norwich).
Ronald Koeman prepares a substitution.  is replaced by Cuco Martina (Southampton).
A substitution has been made. Sadio Mane is replaced by Juanmi (Southampton).
The substitution is prepared. Gary Hooper (Norwich) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Cameron Jerome.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.

Hugo Lloris hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Tom Cleverley (Everton) shoots from the edge of the box towards the top of the net, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. Everton have a corner.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the bottom right corner. His dangerous effort is blocked by Tim Howard, who makes a glorious save!

Ryan Mason (Tottenham) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Tim Howard guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. Tottenham force a corner. They send men into the box.

What a wonderful moment! Nabil Bentaleb (Tottenham) receives a perfect pass in the middle of the pitch, lines up the ball and unloads a powerful strike towards the bottom right corner. His effort fails to surprise Tim Howard, who makes a nice save.
Gareth Barry (Everton) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Roberto Martinez is forced to make a change. Tom Cleverley is unable to continue due to injury, Kevin Mirallas (Everton) comes on.
The end of the first half.
Mike Jones blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Mauricio Pochettino is forced to make a change. Mousa Dembele is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Dele Alli (Tottenham).

What a wasted opportunity by Ryan Mason (Tottenham)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the bottom left corner, but Tim Howard makes an astonishing save to thwart him.
The referee Mike Jones awards Dele Alli (Tottenham) a yellow card.
The foul by Nabil Bentaleb (Tottenham) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Mike Jones.
Eric Dier (Tottenham) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) blows a big chance to score! He slammed the ball from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it went narrowly over the crossbar.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Romelu Lukaku will be replaced by Steven Naismith (Everton).
Jan Vertonghen (Tottenham) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes narrowly over the bar. Terrific solo effort, though.
What a chance that is! Arouna Kone (Everton) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header narrowly wide of the right post.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Harry Kane (Tottenham) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Substitution. Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Arouna Kone walks off.
Mauricio Pochettino prepares a substitution. Ryan Mason is replaced by Alex Pritchard (Tottenham).
The main referee, Mike Jones, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Mike Jones is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Yann M'Vila (Sunderland) scores from a 23-metre free kick. He curled the ball inside the right post, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows for a foul after seeing the whole situation. It's a penalty for Aston Villa!
Scott Sinclair (Aston Villa) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Scott Sinclair (Aston Villa) gives no chance to the keeper and converts the penalty with a sharp low drive into the left side of the net.
Ciaran Clark (Aston Villa) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Goal! Jordan Amavi puts the ball on a plate for Scott Sinclair (Aston Villa), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 2:1.
Robert Madley has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Dick Advocaat makes a half-time substitution. Ola Toivonen (Sunderland) comes on in place of Lee Cattermole.
Half-time substitution. Danny Graham will not participate anymore and Steven Fletcher (Sunderland) is coming on.

Steven Fletcher (Sunderland) rises high to head a nice lofted cross towards the roof of the net. Unfortunately for him, his close-range effort lacks pace and Brad Guzan makes a comfortable save. The referee points to the corner flag and Sunderland will take a corner.
Goal - 2:2! Ola Toivonen tees up Jeremain Lens (Sunderland) inside the box and he slams the ball past Brad Guzan.

Nice touch by Micah Richards (Aston Villa) as he latched on to an accurate cross and attempted to direct the ball with a fine header towards the net, but the goalkeeper reacted quickly to keep it out.

Jordan Amavi (Aston Villa) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Aston Villa.
Tim Sherwood has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Carles Gil (Aston Villa) replacing Leandro Bacuna.
Substitution. Jeremain Lens is replaced by Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland).
That's a clear yellow card. Carles Gil (Aston Villa) goes into the book.
Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range towards the middle of the goal, but Costel Pantilimon was alert and made an amazing save!
That was close by Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
Costel Pantilimon (Sunderland) is booked by the referee.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Max Gradel (Bournemouth) was quite harsh and Neil Swarbrick didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Ritchie De Laet (Leicester) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
What a chance that is! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar.
Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) collects a rebound and hits it precisely into the top of the net.

Max Gradel (Bournemouth) fires in a promising strike from the free kick just outside the penalty area. His nice effort flies towards the left post but is denied by Kasper Schmeichel, who pulls off a glorious save!
Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Andy King (Leicester) for a tough tackle.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Eddie Howe has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Tyrone Mings (Bournemouth) comes on the pitch for Charlie Daniels.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Claudio Ranieri probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Riyad Mahrez. He is replaced by Shinji Okazaki (Leicester).
A yellow card for a tackle by Robert Huth (Leicester). Neil Swarbrick doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Adam Smith (Bournemouth) is coming onto the pitch as Tyrone Mings cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Eddie Howe is forced to make a change. Max Gradel is unable to continue due to injury, Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) comes on.

Jeffrey Schlupp (Leicester) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the middle of the goal. Artur Boruc has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Marc Albrighton will be replaced by Joe Dodoo (Leicester).
The foul by Eunan O'Kane (Bournemouth) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Neil Swarbrick.
Wes Morgan (Leicester) makes a good run inside the box to meet a precise cross. He latches on to it and shoots, but the goalkeeper pulls off an excellent save.
Jeffery Schlupp (Leicester) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post.
Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle after Steve Cook (Bournemouth) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. Leicester are awarded a penalty kick!
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) fires the penalty into the top right corner. The spot kick is too good for the goalkeeper.
Here comes a substitution. Yohan Benalouane (Leicester) is brought on as a substitute for Ritchie De Laet.
Jeffrey Schlupp (Leicester) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Neil Swarbrick ignores the protests.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Pedro (Chelsea) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Crystal Palace.
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) latches on to an accurate pass into the box and immediately unleashes a low shot goalwards. His effort is well saved by the keeper.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Alex McCarthy makes a great save to stop his effort.

Alex McCarthy makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) inside the box and he drills a strike goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.
Craig Pawson has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Craig Pawson blows his whistle to start the second half.

Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the bottom left corner, but is thwarted by a great save from Thibaut Courtois. Crystal Palace force a corner. They send men into the box.
Substitution. Wilfried Zaha makes way for Yannick Bolasie (Crystal Palace).
Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender.
Goal! Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 0:1.
Here is a change. Willian is going off and Jose Mourinho gives the last tactical orders to Falcao (Chelsea).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Cesar Azpilicueta will be replaced by Kenedy (Chelsea).
Gary Cahill (Chelsea) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Craig Pawson had an easy-decision to make.
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
The manager makes a subsitution with Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea) coming on for Nemanja Matic.
Yannick Bolasie (Crystal Palace) connects with a pass inside the box, but his effort goes well wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Chelsea.
Pedro launches a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Falcao (Chelsea) rises high to head the ball into the right side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. 0:0.
Goal! Bakary Sako plays the ball into the area and Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) gets on the end of it to glance a header into the back of the net. He makes it 1:2.
Today's match ends for Yohan Cabaye who will be replaced by Joe Ledley (Crystal Palace).
Alan Pardew has decided to make a change. Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace) replaces Bakary Sako.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Aaron Cresswell puts the ball on a plate for Manuel Lanzini (West Ham), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:1.
OFF THE POST! Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) surges forward and manages to get a powerful shot away from 25 metres out. However, the effort crashes against the left post!
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the left post by a whisker.
What a hit! Mark Noble (West Ham) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot inside the right post. 0:2.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Mark Noble (West Ham) was quite harsh and Kevin Friend didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) is cautioned and receives a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Kevin Friend blows his whistle to start the second half.
Brendan Rodgers has made a change at the break. Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) has come on in place of Emre Can.
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) makes a bad challenge and is given a second yellow card which means he's off.
Substitution. Roberto Firmino did his best and is replaced by Danny Ings (Liverpool).
Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Kevin Friend ignores the protests.

Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) zig-zags his way into the box and fails to direct a shot inside the left post. The goalkeeper pulls off a miraculous stop. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to West Ham.
Winston Reid (West Ham) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the left post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jordon Ibe (Liverpool) comes onto the pitch so that Joe Gomez can be given a rest.
An early bath for Mark Noble (West Ham). He receives a red card from Kevin Friend. His teammates will not thank him after the match.
The referee gives a yellow card to Manuel Lanzini (West Ham).
Slaven Bilic has decided to make a change. Reece Oxford (West Ham) replaces Manuel Lanzini.
Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his shot flies just over the crossbar. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Kevin Friend shows the yellow card to Danny Ings (Liverpool) for a heavy challenge.
Dimitri Payet is being substituted because of an injury. Slaven Bilic sends Matthew Jarvis (West Ham) on the pitch.
Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Diafra Sakho (West Ham) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Simon Mignolet with a strike into the right side of the goal. He makes it 0:3.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Diafra Sakho walks off the pitch to be replaced by Josh Cullen (West Ham).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.

Heurelho Gomes was forced into action to thwart Raheem Sterling (Manchester City). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper. Manchester City will take a corner kick.
Mark Clattenburg shows a yellow card to Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) for his blatant foul.
Allan Nyom (Watford) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and can count himself very lucky that the referee didn't issue a red card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Manuel Pellegrini has made a change at the break. Samir Nasri (Manchester City) has come on in place of Jesus Navas.
Goal! Bacary Sagna puts a cross into the box and finds Raheem Sterling (Manchester City), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the right post. He makes it 1:0.

GOAL! Superb work from David Silva, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Fernandinho (Manchester City), who beats Heurelho Gomes with a brilliant shot into the left side of the net. 2:0.
The substitution is prepared. Ikechi Anya (Watford) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Almen Abdi.
Sebastian Prodl (Watford) has tested the patience of referee Mark Clattenburg and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Miguel Layun (Watford) replaces Odion Ighalo.
Manuel Pellegrini has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Fabian Delph (Manchester City) replacing David Silva.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Etienne Capoue trots off the pitch and is replaced by Ben Watson (Watford).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Raheem Sterling departs the field of play to be replaced by Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) heads the ball towards goal, but his effort is saved by the goalkeeper.
James Morrison (West Brom) misses a great chance after striking the ball towards the left side of the goal and the goalkeeper makes a comfortable save.
Craig Gardner (West Brom) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City) can have an early bath after being sent off by the referee!
Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) makes a reckless challenge on his opponent and is shown a red card without any hesitation from the referee!
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Claudio Yacob as he is replaced by Rickie Lambert (West Brom).

Rickie Lambert showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Jose Rondon (West Brom) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header inside the right post. It's 0:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Michael Oliver has ended it.
Michael Oliver blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Half-time substitution. Craig Gardner is replaced by Callum McManaman (West Brom).
Salomon Rondon (West Brom) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header narrowly over the crossbar!
Substitution. Glen Johnson makes his way off the pitch and Marc Wilson (Stoke City) comes on as his replacement.
Tony Pulis has decided to substitute James McClean and he is replaced by Cristian Gamboa (West Brom).
The referee gives a yellow card to Erik Pieters (Stoke City).
Substitution. Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) in, Xherdan Shaqiri out.
Cristian Gamboa (West Brom) picks up a yellow card.
That was close. Callum McManaman (West Brom) fires a shot from the edge of the box which goes a whisker wide of the right post.
Here is a change. Mame Diouf is going off and Mark Hughes gives the last tactical orders to Stephen Ireland (Stoke City).
Gareth McAuley (West Brom) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Rickie Lambert (West Brom) is booked.
That's it for today, Michael Oliver has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) for his blatant foul.

Theo Walcott (Arsenal) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Tim Krul to get hold of the ball.

It's a foul from Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd). Surprisingly, the referee comes and pulls out a red card. It was a very harsh one and Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) complains, but it's no use of course. The decision has been made.
Chancel Mbemba (Newcastle Utd) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Andre Marriner ignores the protests.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Florian Thauvin (Newcastle Utd), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) with a wonderful solo effort. He blasted from long range, but the shot towards the left side of the goal was thwarted by Tim Krul. Theo Walcott (Arsenal) misses a rebound from close range. His effort floats narrowly over the crossbar!
Alexis Sanchez plays a pass to Theo Walcott (Arsenal), but he fails to get a decent shot away from inside the box and the ball flies well wide of the right post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Vurnon Anita (Newcastle Utd) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Andre Marriner shows the yellow card to Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) for a heavy challenge.
Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) says something out of turn to the referee and is shown a yellow card.
Fabricio Coloccini (Newcastle Utd) deflects the ball past his own goalkeeper and into the goal after trying to jump in the way of a shot!
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Tim Krul makes a great save to stop his effort.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Theo Walcott as he is replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).
Steve McClaren prepares a substitution. Vurnon Anita is replaced by Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd).
Moussa Sissoko goes off the pitch and Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd) comes on.
Arsene Wenger has decided to substitute Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain and he is replaced by Mikel Arteta (Arsenal).
Steve McClaren has decided to make a change. Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd) replaces Florian Thauvin.
A yellow card for a tackle by Fabricio Coloccini (Newcastle Utd). Andre Marriner doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Tim Krul.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) picks up a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that crashes against the bar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.

Petr Cech pulls off a great save to deny Christian Benteke (Liverpool) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Now Liverpool have a corner.

Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) picks up the rebound after chaos in the box and directs a sweet strike towards the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper, however, denies him with a stunning save. The ball goes out of play and Liverpool have been awarded a corner kick.
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he fails to change the score as his effort deflects away off the right post.
Michael Oliver has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

OFF THE POST! Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Martin Skrtel (Liverpool) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Oliver ignores the protests.
Today's match ends for Roberto Firmino who will be replaced by Jordon Ibe (Liverpool).
The foul by Gabriel (Arsenal) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Oliver.
A yellow card for a tackle by Emre Can (Liverpool). Michael Oliver doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Simon Mignolet was forced into action to thwart Olivier Giroud (Arsenal). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Arsenal.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Olivier Giroud walks off the pitch to be replaced by Theo Walcott (Arsenal).
Brendan Rodgers has decided to make a change. Jordan Rossiter (Liverpool) replaces Lucas Leiva.
Michael Oliver shows the yellow card to Joe Gomez (Liverpool) for a heavy challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Francis Coquelin trots off the pitch and is replaced by Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal).
Simon Mignolet (Liverpool) receives a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) replaces Philippe Coutinho.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and sends a shot to the middle of the goal, but is denied by a reflex save from Tim Howard. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Manchester City will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) decided to shoot after receiving a sweet pass. The ball went low to the middle of the goal, but Tim Howard made a easy save.
Eliaquim Mangala (Manchester City) sees a yellow card from Anthony Taylor after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Brendan Galloway is being substituted because of an injury. Roberto Martinez sends Tyias Browning (Everton) on the pitch.
A yellow card for a tackle by Fernandinho (Manchester City). Anthony Taylor doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) takes the resulting free kick from the edge of the box. His rocket of a shot crashes against the crossbar! What a shot.
Anthony Taylor has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
David Silva (Manchester City) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the left post! What an opportunity that was!

Goal! Raheem Sterling displays great vision and sends a pass to Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 0:1.

Jesus Navas (Manchester City) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Tim Howard makes a great save to stop the effort going into the middle of the goal. Manchester City will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Today's match ends for Arouna Kone who will be replaced by Steven Naismith (Everton).
That's the end of the game for Raheem Sterling, who is replaced by Samir Nasri (Manchester City).

Gareth Barry (Everton) connects with a cross from the side and steers a header from around the penalty spot towards the goal. The ball goes in the right direction, but it's stopped by one of the defenders.
Substitution. Sergio Aguero makes his way off the pitch and Wilfried Bony (Manchester City) comes on as his replacement.
It's a yellow card for Samir Nasri (Manchester City).
Roberto Martinez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) replacing Tom Cleverley.

Jesus Navas (Manchester City) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the middle of the goal. Tim Howard is alert, though, and makes an easy save to deny him.
GOAL - 0:2! Yaya Toure found Samir Nasri (Manchester City) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Tim Howard off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
Substitution. Fabian Delph (Manchester City) replaces David Silva.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Ronald Koeman is forced to make a change. Sadio Mane is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Shane Long (Southampton).

Shane Long (Southampton) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Heurelho Gomes anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the bottom right corner.
The whistle blows and Victor Wanyama (Southampton) is booked for an infringement.
Ikechi Anya (Watford) clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Odion Ighalo, but he can't get on the end of the pass. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Southampton.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Jose Holebas is replaced by Alessandro Diamanti (Watford).

Graziano Pelle (Southampton) meets a delivery on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards the top right corner. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Heurelho Gomes pulls off an easy save. The ball goes behind for a corner. Southampton will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Steven Davis sends a lovely ball from the corner into the path of Shane Long (Southampton), whose close-range header flashes just over the bar.
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
What a great effort!  decides to unleash a long-range shot. Despite hitting it very well, it scorches inches wide of the right post. We could have witnessed a magnificent goal.
Etienne Capoue (Watford) meets a cross inside the box, but he is unable to produce an accurate header and it goes just over the bar.
The game has come to an end for Steven Davis. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of James Ward-Prowse (Southampton).
pounced on a rebound on the edge of the box and his shot goes a whisker over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Watford will have a goal kick.
Graziano Pelle will be replaced by Jay Rodriguez (Southampton).
Valon Behrami goes off the pitch and Ben Watson (Watford) comes on.

Steven Caulker (Southampton) leaps highest around the penalty spot to meet a cross from the free kick and produces a promising goal-bound header towards the middle of the goal, but Heurelho Gomes pulls off a comfortable save to deny him.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.

Diego Costa (Chelsea) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms around the right post.
Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) brings his opponent down. Mark Clattenburg has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle for a foul. That's a penalty to West Brom! They have a good chance to score now.
James Morrison (West Brom) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.

James Morrison (West Brom) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot low into the middle of the goal. Thibaut Courtois anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and doesn't have to move to stop the effort. West Brom have been awarded a corner kick.
Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) is given a yellow card.
Goal! Eden Hazard slips it to Pedro (Chelsea) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom right corner with a great effort. The score is 0:1.
Goal! Diego Costa (Chelsea) scores after an assist by Pedro that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:2.
Goal! Salomon Rondon displays great vision and sends a pass to James Morrison (West Brom), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 1:2.
James McClean (West Brom) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Mark Clattenburg didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Golden chance! Willian (Chelsea) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for West Brom.
Goal - 1:3! Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Diego Costa provided an assist for the goal.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
John Terry (Chelsea) is sent off! Several teammates attempts to argue with the referee, but the decision has been made - it's beyond the point of no return.
Willian will be replaced by Gary Cahill (Chelsea).

What a finish! James Morrison (West Brom) leaps high to meet a perfect cross from Callum McManaman and scores with a bullet header from around the penalty spot. His effort is planted precisely off the crossbar into the roof of the net, leaving Thibaut Courtois beaten. The score is now 1:3.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and James McClean departs the field of play to be replaced by Rickie Lambert (West Brom).
Diego Costa (Chelsea) gets on the end of a cross from Pedro, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Callum McManaman (West Brom) receives a yellow card from the referee for dissent.
A brilliant individual effort! Callum McManaman (West Brom) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Falcao (Chelsea) comes onto the pitch for Diego Costa.
Tony Pulis has decided to substitute Callum McManaman and he is replaced by Serge Gnabry (West Brom).
Substitution. John Obi Mikel (Chelsea) replaces Pedro.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly wide of the right post.
Substitution. James Morrison makes his way off the pitch and Craig Gardner (West Brom) comes on as his replacement.
That's it for today, Mark Clattenburg has blown his whistle and the game is over.

Gabriel Agbonlahor (Aston Villa) picks up a pass and unleashes a low shot towards goal, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Alex McCarthy.
The game is interrupted. Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Keith Stroud has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Alan Pardew has decided to substitute Glenn Murray and he is replaced by Jordon Mutch (Crystal Palace).
We are about to witness a substitution. Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) is replacing Wilfried Zaha.

Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Brad Guzan guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. Crystal Palace will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) is cautioned by the referee.
Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as James McArthur (Crystal Palace) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
Here comes a substitution. Adama Traore (Aston Villa) is brought on as a substitute for Carlos Sanchez.

Goal! Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) jumps highest inside the box to meet the resulting corner from Jason Puncheon. His well-placed header ends up in the top of the net, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. 1:0.

Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) produces a good strike that sails towards the left post, but the goalkeeper shows great reflexes and dives to keep the effort from hitting the net. The linesman makes the right call and Crystal Palace will have a corner.
It's an own goal! Pape Souare (Crystal Palace) puts the ball into his own net.
It will be a substitution. Mile Jedinak (Crystal Palace) is ready to enter the pitch as Yohan Cabaye walks off.
The whistle blows and Ciaran Clark (Aston Villa) is booked for an infringement.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa).
Brilliant finish! Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Scott Dann, then produced a nice strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 2:1.
Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) receives a yellow card for infringement.
That's it for today, Keith Stroud has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Erik Lamela sends a lovely ball from the corner into the path of Eric Dier (Tottenham), whose close-range header flashes just over the bar.

Kasper Schmeichel hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) shoots from the edge of the box towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. Tottenham will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
The referee gives a yellow card to Mousa Dembele (Tottenham).
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Erik Lamela (Tottenham).
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Martin Atkinson has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) misses a sitter from inside the six-yard box after striking the ball towards goal and it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Erik Lamela (Tottenham) goes close to scoring with a shot from inside the box, but he drags his effort wide of the left post.
Eric Dier (Tottenham) is booked.
What a wasted opportunity by Harry Kane (Tottenham)! He unleashed a powerful low shot from the centre of the box, but Kasper Schmeichel makes a decent save to thwart him.
That's the end of the game for Erik Lamela, who is replaced by Dele Alli (Tottenham).
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) goes close to scoring with a shot from inside the box, but he drags his effort wide of the right post.
Substitution. Mousa Dembele walks off the pitch and Thomas Carroll (Tottenham) comes on as a substitute.
Claudio Ranieri has decided to make a change. N'Golo Kante (Leicester) replaces Marc Albrighton.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Daniel Drinkwater walks off the pitch to be replaced by Gokhan Inler (Leicester).
Nacer Chadli launches a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Dele Alli (Tottenham) rises high to head the ball into the right side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. 1:1.

Goal! Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box inside the left post. Hugo Lloris had no chance of reaching it. The score is 1:1.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Ryan Mason (Tottenham).
A header by Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) from very close range goes towards the middle of the target, but doesn't get past Hugo Lloris, who makes a nice save.
Ryan Mason (Tottenham) will be replaced by Nabil Bentaleb.
Andy King (Leicester) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
We are about to witness a substitution. Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) is replacing Riyad Mahrez.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
GOAL! Xherdan Shaqiri curls the free kick into the box. Mame Diouf (Stoke City) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past John Ruddy and into the left side of the net. 0:0.
It's in the back of the net! Nathan Redmond picks out Russell Martin (Norwich) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 1:1.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Mame Diouf (Stoke City) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Russell Martin (Norwich) was quite harsh and Michael Dean didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Sebastien Bassong (Norwich) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

Cameron Jerome (Norwich) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Stoke will have a goal kick.

Graham Dorrans (Norwich) latches on to a pin-point pass on the edge of the box and fires the ball towards the right post, but the goalkeeper performs an amazing acrobatic dive to deny him. The strike bounces off his gloves and hits the post. The ball is out of play and Norwich manage to earn a corner.
Substitution. Joselu (Stoke City) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Marko Arnautovic walks off.
Mark Hughes has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Stephen Ireland (Stoke City) replacing Ibrahim Afellay.

Jack Butland pulls off a great save to deny Nathan Redmond (Norwich) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Good work from Norwich as they win a corner.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Alexander Tettey (Norwich) for his blatant foul.
Here is a change. Wesley Hoolahan is going off and Alex Neil gives the last tactical orders to Bradley Johnson (Norwich).
It's time for a substitution. Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) comes on in place of Marco van Ginkel.
Steven Whittaker (Norwich) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Erik Pieters (Stoke City) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jonathan Howson trots off the pitch and is replaced by Gary O'Neil (Norwich).
