Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Jeremain Lens (Sunderland) says more than he should have to the referee and is shown a yellow card.
Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) for a tough tackle.
Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and drills the ball into the bottom left corner. Magnificent finish!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
The foul by Sebastian Coates (Sunderland) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Neil Swarbrick. A free kick to Swansea.
Andre Ayew (Swansea) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the bar!
Andre Ayew (Swansea) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Neil Swarbrick ignores the protests.

Stunning strike! Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) latches on to a precise through ball from Danny Graham before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the bottom left corner from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 1:1.
Here is a change. Danny Graham is going off and Dick Advocaat gives the last tactical orders to Steven Fletcher (Sunderland).

Costel Pantilimon hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) shoots from the edge of the box towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. The ball goes out of play. Swansea are awarded a corner kick.
A header by Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) from very close range goes towards the right-hand post, but doesn't get past Costel Pantilimon, who makes a brilliant save.
It is time for a substitution. Eder (Swansea) is on for Bafetimbi Gomis.
Patrick van Aanholt (Sunderland) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Substitution. Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) in, Jermain Defoe out.
Neil Swarbrick shows the yellow card to Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) for a heavy challenge. Sunderland are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jeremain Lens leaves the pitch and Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland) comes on.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal! Simon Francis provides Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the top right corner. 0:1.
Dimitri Payet (West Ham) attempted to pick out a free teammate inside the box, but Artur Boruc comes off the line to clear the ball away.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Callum Wilson (Bournemouth), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 0:2.

Darren Randolph doesn't have to worry about this one. Simon Francis plays a pass into the feet of Joshua King (Bournemouth), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes high over the bar.
Here comes a substitution. James Tomkins (West Ham) is brought on as a substitute for Angelo Ogbonna.

Great touch by Max Gradel (Bournemouth) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save! The ball is out of play. Bournemouth will have a chance to score from a corner.
The end of the first half.
Jonathan Moss blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Substitution. Kevin Nolan makes his way off the pitch and Matthew Jarvis (West Ham) comes on as his replacement.
Mark Noble (West Ham) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Mark Noble (West Ham) fires the penalty inside the left post.
That will be all from Joshua King who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Marc Pugh (Bournemouth).
Diafra Sakho (West Ham) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Artur Boruc.
Goal! Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) fires the rebound into the roof of the net after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:2.
Great touch by Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot inside the right post.
Diafra Sakho will be replaced by Modibo Maiga (West Ham).
Artur Boruc (Bournemouth) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
There's no point in Carl Jenkinson (West Ham) arguing about the referee's decision as it's an obvious red card for a dangerous tackle.
Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) steps up and confidently powers the spot kick into the bottom left corner.

Goal! Modibo Maiga (West Ham) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom right corner. Artur Boruc had no chance of reaching it. The score is 3:4.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Max Gradel leaves the pitch and Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) comes on.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Matt Ritchie walks off the pitch to be replaced by Adam Smith (Bournemouth).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) has a goal ruled out for offside!

Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Tim Krul guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. Manchester Utd earn a corner.
Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Massadio Haidara (Newcastle Utd) receives a yellow card.
What a chance that is! Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header crashes off the crossbar!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
The booking goes to Gabriel Obertan (Newcastle Utd).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Bastian Schweinsteiger departs the field of play to be replaced by Michael Carrick (Manchester United).
Substitution. Adnan Januzaj did his best and is replaced by Chicharito (Manchester United).
Steve McClaren has decided to substitute Gabriel Obertan and he is replaced by Florian Thauvin (Newcastle Utd).
Luke Shaw (Manchester United) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.

Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) latches onto a brilliant cross and fires the ball towards goal, but his shot goes high over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Newcastle.

Luke Shaw (Manchester United) sees an opportunity to score and unleashes a powerful first-time strike from the edge of the box. Tim Krul has a clear sight of the shot and pulls off a great save to block the effort.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) is coming onto the pitch as Matteo Darmian cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Steve McClaren has decided to make a change. Cheik Tiote (Newcastle Utd) replaces Ayoze Perez.
Chicharito (Manchester United) picks up the rebound and shoots. The goalkeeper was ready and denies his effort with a fine save.

Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it. Manchester Utd will take a corner kick.
Aleksandar Mitrovic comes off the pitch to be replaced by Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
It's in the back of the net! Jordan Henderson plays it into the box, and Christian Benteke (Liverpool) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 0:0.
Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) clutches his head. He fired from long range without any hesitation, but the bullet shot crashed against the crossbar!
Eunan O'Kane (Bournemouth) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Close! Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Craig Pawson blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Substitution. Emre Can (Liverpool) on for Jordan Henderson.

What a chance that is! Matt Ritchie (Bournemouth) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the right post!
Eddie Howe has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Lee Tomlin (Bournemouth) replacing Joshua King.
Substitution. Jordon Ibe walks off the pitch and Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) comes on as a substitute.
Joe Gomez (Liverpool) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Craig Pawson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Matt Ritchie (Bournemouth) was quite harsh and Craig Pawson didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Lee Tomlin (Bournemouth) receives a yellow card.
The game has come to an end for Max Gradel. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Adam Smith (Bournemouth).
Here is a change. Philippe Coutinho is going off and Brendan Rodgers gives the last tactical orders to Alberto Moreno (Liverpool).
It's time for a substitution. Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) comes on in place of Eunan O'Kane.
Christian Benteke (Liverpool) controls a cross deep inside the box and hits the crossbar!
Steve Cook (Bournemouth) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Craig Pawson had an easy-decision to make.
That's it for today, Craig Pawson has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.

Nice individual effort by Sergio Aguero (Manchester City). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a shot to the middle of the goal, but Asmir Begovic does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.
Jesus Navas (Manchester City) strikes a shot towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but it flies just wide of the left post.

Asmir Begovic was forced into action to thwart Sergio Aguero (Manchester City). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) receives a quality pass inside the box and fires a first-time shot. His effort towards the right post is saved by the goalkeeper.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike wasn't accurate at all and the ball went well wide of the left post.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) receives a precise pass inside the box from Yaya Toure and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the left side of the net. 1:0.
A yellow card for a tackle by Vincent Kompany (Manchester City). Martin Atkinson doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) unleashes a decent effort from just outside the box which goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Aleksandar Kolarov swings the cross over. Eliaquim Mangala (Manchester City) gets his head to it but it goes just wide of the right post.
The foul by Fernandinho (Manchester City) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Martin Atkinson.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Jose Mourinho gives a chance to Kurt Zouma (Chelsea) and John Terry is off.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) for a tough tackle. Manchester City get a free kick.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle.  Ramires (Chelsea) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Yellow card! It's like Yaya Toure (Manchester City) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Martin Atkinson agrees and books him.
Substitution.  Ramires makes way for Juan Cuadrado (Chelsea).

What a chance that is! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post.
Manuel Pellegrini has decided to substitute Jesus Navas and he is replaced by Samir Nasri (Manchester City).
Joe Hart pulls off a great save to deny Eden Hazard (Chelsea), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
Raheem Sterling will be replaced by Martin Demichelis (Manchester City).
Jose Mourinho has decided to make a change. Falcao (Chelsea) replaces Willian.
David Silva delivers a well-placed cross from the corner. Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) wins the ball and powers an unstoppable header in off the right post. The score now reads 2:0.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Martin Atkinson ignores the protests.

Yaya Toure (Manchester City) gets into a good scoring position. He creates some space for himself and tries his luck from distance. His decent effort towards the right post is, however, superbly saved by Asmir Begovic!
The manager makes a subsitution with Wilfried Bony (Manchester City) coming on for Sergio Aguero.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Fernandinho (Manchester City) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the left side of the net.

What a wasted opportunity by Juan Cuadrado (Chelsea)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the middle of the net, but Joe Hart makes a comfortable save to thwart him.
Eliaquim Mangala (Manchester City) gets a yellow card. The referee Martin Atkinson made the right call.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) attempts to test the goalkeeper after collecting a cross inside the penalty area. Luck doesn't appear to be on his side today as his attempt rattles the left post.
Falcao (Chelsea) attempts to turn the rebound in from close range. Nevertheless, the goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save and stops the ball from hitting the net. Great goalkeeping.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) finds some space inside the box to meet a beautiful cross and with a precise low drive puts the ball into the bottom left corner.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) produces a good strike that sails to the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper shows great reflexes and dives to keep the effort from hitting the net.
Great ball in from Nacho Monreal. Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.

It's in! Yannick Bolasie spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) doesn't think twice and rifles a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. The score is now 1:1.

Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Alex McCarthy to get hold of the ball.
Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) has received a yellow card for his foul.
James McArthur (Crystal Palace) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Alan Pardew makes a half-time substitution. Jordon Mutch (Crystal Palace) comes on in place of Yannick Bolasie.
What a chance that is! Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the right post!
It's an own goal! Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace) puts the ball into his own net.

Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and releases a quick shot to the bottom right corner. His promising effort is kept out by Petr Cech, who pulls off a stunning save!
Arsene Wenger has decided to make a change. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) replaces Francis Coquelin.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) attempts to surprise the keeper with a nice shot, but the ball goes narrowly over the bar.
Arsene Wenger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mikel Arteta (Arsenal) replacing Alexis Sanchez.
Substitution. Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace) replaces Wilfried Zaha.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and James McArthur departs the field of play to be replaced by Patrick Bamford (Crystal Palace).
The substitution has been made. Kieran Gibbs (Arsenal) has replaced Mesut Ozil.
Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting set piece and aims a header towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes a superb save.

Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the bottom right corner. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save! The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Arsenal.

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Alex McCarthy is alert and denies him with a nice save.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Sebastien Bassong (Norwich) has tested the patience of referee Kevin Friend and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. A free kick is awarded to Sunderland.
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Jeremain Lens (Sunderland) for his blatant foul.

Jonathan Howson (Norwich) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the bottom right corner. Costel Pantilimon pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The ball is out of play. Norwich win a corner kick.

Robbie Brady (Norwich) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Costel Pantilimon makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the left side of the goal.
Goal! Russell Martin (Norwich) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 0:1.
Goal - 0:2! Wesley Hoolahan tees up Steven Whittaker (Norwich) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Costel Pantilimon.
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
Dick Advocaat has made a change at the break. Danny Graham (Sunderland) has come on in place of Sebastian Larsson.
Alexander Tettey (Norwich) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Fantastic team goal! Nathan Redmond (Norwich) was set free in the area by Wesley Hoolahan and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom right corner. 0:3.
That will be all from Wesley Hoolahan who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Bradley Johnson (Norwich).
The game has come to an end for Cameron Jerome. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Lewis Grabban (Norwich).
Here is a change. Steven Fletcher is going off and Dick Advocaat gives the last tactical orders to Duncan Watmore (Sunderland).
Substitution. Gary O'Neil (Norwich) in, Nathan Redmond out.
Goal! Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 1:3.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Jonjo Shelvey plays a pass to the feet of Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) and he shoots low into the back of the net from inside the box. It's 1:0.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Daryl Janmaat (Newcastle Utd) was quite harsh and Mike Jones didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Daryl Janmaat (Newcastle Utd) should have been more careful. He commits a bad foul, receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!
Jefferson Montero (Swansea) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the left post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
The end of the first half.
Referee Mike Jones blows his whistle to start the second half.
Steve McClaren makes a switch. Steven Taylor (Newcastle Utd) is coming on in place of Moussa Sissoko at the start of the second period.
OFF THE POST! Out of nothing, Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) meanders towards the goal before wriggling away from a defender and unleashing a shot from 20 metres out that hits the crossbar!
Mike Jones shows a yellow card to Andre Ayew (Swansea) for his blatant foul. Newcastle will take a free kick near the side line.

It's a goal! Andre Ayew (Swansea) makes it 2:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Jefferson Montero and planted his close-range header into the top of the net. Tim Krul was helpless.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Papiss Cisse leaves the pitch and Rolando Aarons (Newcastle Utd) comes on.
Mike Jones shows the yellow card to Kyle Naughton (Swansea) for a heavy challenge.
Lovely cross from Jefferson Montero to find Andre Ayew (Swansea) deep in the box, but he steers his header well wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Newcastle will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Nathan Dyer (Swansea) in, Andre Ayew out.
Garry Monk has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Wayne Routledge (Swansea) replacing Jefferson Montero.
Steve McClaren prepares a substitution. Gabriel Obertan is replaced by Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd).
The referee gives a yellow card to Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd).
Substitution. Gylfi Sigurdsson is replaced by Leon Britton (Swansea).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Glenn Whelan (Stoke City) has tested the patience of referee Robert Madley and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Another situation results in a direct free kick for Tottenham.

Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending the ball towards the bottom left corner only for Jack Butland to dive and make a save. Tottenham get a corner.

Hugo Lloris can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stopped the close-range effort from Mame Diouf (Stoke City). The ball would have probably ended up in the bottom right corner.
Marco van Ginkel (Stoke City) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Eric Dier (Tottenham) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a bullet header from close range into the middle of the net. The score is 1:0.
Kyle Walker (Tottenham) earns the yellow card.
A header by Mame Diouf (Stoke City) from very close range goes towards the middle of the target, but doesn't get past Hugo Lloris, who makes a nice save.
Goal! Nacer Chadli (Tottenham) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper inside the left post. 2:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Ben Davies (Tottenham) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.

Jack Butland gets a well deserved ovation! Harry Kane (Tottenham) produces a decent first-time strike towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. Nice goalkeeping skills.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Jonathan Walters (Stoke City), whose header flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Marco van Ginkel comes off the pitch to be replaced by Stephen Ireland (Stoke City).
Mark Hughes has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Joselu (Stoke City) replacing Jonathan Walters.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the bottom left corner, but Hugo Lloris easily deals with the threat.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) rises high to head a nice lofted cross towards the middle of the goal. Unfortunately for him, his close-range effort lacks pace and Hugo Lloris makes a comfortable save.
Substitution. Erik Lamela (Tottenham) has come on for Harry Kane.
It's time for a substitution. Nabil Bentaleb (Tottenham) comes on in place of Ryan Mason.
Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. Some classy goalkeeping by Jack Butland stops the ball out of the bottom right corner.
Erik Lamela (Tottenham) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Tottenham.
Marc Muniesa (Stoke City) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Robert Madley interrupts the game for a tactical foul by Toby Alderweireld (Tottenham). The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for Stoke!
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal to give the goalkeeper no chance!

A perfect lofted pass from Stephen Ireland finds Mame Diouf (Stoke City), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the right side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Hugo Lloris had no chance of stopping that. 2:0.
Great ball in from Marko Arnautovic. Stephen Ireland (Stoke City) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.
A substitution has been made. Marko Arnautovic is replaced by Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City).
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Jonas Olsson (West Brom) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Paul Tierney didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket. Watford will look to take advantage of a free kick in a promising position in the middle of the field.
Jose Manuel Jurado (Watford) takes a shot from a mid-range free kick and the ball flies inches wide of the left post! The ball goes out of play and West Brom will have a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Paul Tierney blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Miguel Layun will be replaced by Almen Abdi (Watford).
Tony Pulis has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jose Rondon replacing Craig Gardner (West Brom).
Rickie Lambert (West Brom) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
The substitution has been made. James McClean (West Brom) has replaced Rickie Lambert.

Saido Berahino (West Brom) blows a chance to score! He pinged a fine header from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it flew narrowly wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Watford.
Substitution. Steven Berghuis (Watford) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Jose Manuel Jurado walks off.
Chris Brunt (West Brom) attempts to score from a mid-range free kick, but he curls his effort a few inches over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Watford.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Saido Berahino trots off the pitch and is replaced by Callum McManaman (West Brom).
Allan Nyom (Watford) is penalised.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.

Diafra Sakho (West Ham) creates himself some space in front of goal and connects with the resulting free kick. His almost perfect header hits the bar and ricochets away off it. The ball goes out of play and Leicester will have a goal kick.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Anthony Taylor had an easy-decision to make.
Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the left post. His promising effort is kept out by Adrian, who pulls off a stunning save!
Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Goal Riyad Mahrez (Leicester)! Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) was put through by Marc Albrighton and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the top right corner. 0:2.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Carl Jenkinson (West Ham) was quite harsh and Anthony Taylor didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Anthony Taylor has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Slaven Bilic makes a half-time substitution. Pedro Obiang (West Ham) comes on in place of Reece Oxford.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) receives a yellow card.
Dimitri Payet (West Ham) controls the ball with an excellent first touch on the edge of the penalty box after receiving a splendid pass and smashes the ball into the top right corner!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Shinji Okazaki departs the field of play to be replaced by N'Golo Kante (Leicester).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Yohan Benalouane (Leicester) comes onto the pitch so that Ritchie De Laet can be given a rest.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) for Cheikhou Kouyate.
That's the end of the game for Riyad Mahrez, who is replaced by Christian Fuchs (Leicester).
Slaven Bilic prepares a substitution. Mauro Zarate is replaced by Modibo Maiga (West Ham).
Yohan Benalouane (Leicester) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Adrian (West Ham) takes out his opponent with an awful tackle and is shown a red card by the referee!
Anthony Taylor is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Matt Targett (Southampton) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle. Everton have a free kick from a promising distance.
Graziano Pelle (Southampton) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the left post!

Arouna Kone sends a superb cross into the box. Romelu Lukaku (Everton) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the top right corner, leaving Maarten Stekelenburg beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
James McCarthy (Everton) produces a good strike that sails towards the right post, but the goalkeeper shows great reflexes and dives to keep the effort from hitting the net. Everton get a corner.

Ross Barkley (Everton) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Maarten Stekelenburg guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
The booking goes to Graziano Pelle (Southampton).
Goal - 0:2! Romelu Lukaku (Everton) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Ross Barkley provided an assist for the goal.
Ross Barkley (Everton) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game is over for Dusan Tadic. Oriol Romeu (Southampton) comes on for the second half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) picks up a yellow card.

Tim Howard can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Graziano Pelle (Southampton). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Shane Long will be replaced by Jay Rodriguez (Southampton).
James McCarthy (Everton) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Kelvin Davis (Southampton) for his blatant foul.

Sadio Mane (Southampton) picks up a pass, lines up a shot and strikes from 20 metres out, but Tim Howard thwarts the effort which is headed for the top right corner. Southampton force their opponents to concede a corner.
We are about to witness a substitution. James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) is replacing Kelvin Davis.
Roberto Martinez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Steven Naismith (Everton) replacing Arouna Kone.
Ross Barkley (Everton) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home inside the right post. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Substitution. Brendan Galloway makes way for Tyias Browning (Everton).
Here is a change. Romelu Lukaku is going off and Roberto Martinez gives the last tactical orders to Gerard Deulofeu (Everton).
That's it for today, Michael Oliver has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.

What a chance that is! Morgan Schneiderlin (Manchester United) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly wide of the right post.
Juan Manuel Mata passes the ball into the penalty area. Adnan Januzaj (Manchester United) collects it and quickly sends it into the bottom right corner via the post! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:1!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
The substitution has been made. Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) has replaced Scott Sinclair.
Louis van Gaal has decided to substitute Adnan Januzaj and he is replaced by Ander Herrera (Manchester United).
Substitution. Bastian Schweinsteiger (Manchester United) in, Michael Carrick out.
Yellow card! It's like Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Michael Dean agrees and books him.
Memphis Depay (Manchester United) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Ander Herrera (Manchester United) is penalised for holding. Michael Dean signals a set piece. A yellow-coloured card is received by Ander Herrera (Manchester United).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Carlos Sanchez (Aston Villa) is coming onto the pitch as Jordan Veretout cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Louis van Gaal has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ashley Young (Manchester United) replacing Memphis Depay.

Dangerous play by Matteo Darmian (Manchester United). Michael Dean blows his whistle for a foul. The game is interrupted. Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
A clumsy foul by Idrissa Gueye (Aston Villa) and Michael Dean blows his whistle. Idrissa Gueye (Aston Villa) is cautioned by the referee.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Goal! David Silva (Manchester City) scores after an assist by Yaya Toure that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:1.

It's in! Wilfried Bony spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Yaya Toure (Manchester City) doesn't think twice and curls a first-time shot into the top right corner. The score is now 0:2.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Darren Fletcher (West Brom).

What an amazing save by Glyn Oliver Myhill! Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the bottom right corner, but fails.
A goal, which was scored by Saido Berahino (West Brom), was disallowed due to offside.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Tony Pulis makes a switch. Claudio Yacob (West Brom) is coming on in place of James McClean at the start of the second period.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his low drive to the left post is smartly dealt with by Glyn Oliver Myhill.
Close! Rickie Lambert (West Brom) stands over the resulting free kick from around 26 metres out and his shot goes just over the crossbar.

Saido Berahino (West Brom) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and produces a low shot that sails towards the middle of a goal. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper makes a comfortable save.
Fernandinho (Manchester City) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The game is interrupted. Craig Gardner (West Brom) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
James Chester (West Brom) receives a yellow card.
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header perfectly into the right side of the goal. He makes it 0:2.
Claudio Yacob (West Brom) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The referee signals a substitution. Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) is brought on as a substitute for Wilfried Bony.
Tony Pulis has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Victor Anichebe (West Brom) replacing Rickie Lambert.
Raheem Sterling goes off the pitch and Samir Nasri (Manchester City) comes on.
That will be all from Saido Berahino who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Callum McManaman (West Brom).
Manuel Pellegrini prepares a substitution. Yaya Toure is replaced by Martin Demichelis (Manchester City).

David Silva (Manchester City) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender. Glyn Oliver Myhill makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the bottom left corner.

Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) stands over the resulting free kick from long range and fires a shot towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save to deny him. Now Manchester City have a corner.
That's it for today, Michael Dean has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City) gets a yellow card.
Martin Skrtel (Liverpool) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Glen Johnson (Stoke City) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
James Milner (Liverpool) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Anthony Taylor had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
Mark Hughes has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Philipp Wollscheid (Stoke City) comes on the pitch for Erik Pieters.
Booking. Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) receives a caution from the referee.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Adam Lallana will be replaced by Emre Can (Liverpool).
The foul by Joe Gomez (Liverpool) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Anthony Taylor.
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) for a tough tackle.
It is time for a substitution. Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) is on for Jordon Ibe.
Here is a change. Ibrahim Afellay is going off and Mark Hughes gives the last tactical orders to Peter Odemwingie (Stoke City).
Here's the change. Charles Graham Adam leaves the pitch and Steve Sidwell (Stoke City) comes on as a substitute.

What a beautiful moment! Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the top of the net. Jack Butland just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 0:1.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Today's referee Martin Atkinson rightly decides to book Mark Noble (West Ham) for his harsh tackle.
Angelo Ogbonna (West Ham) sees a yellow card from Martin Atkinson after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. Arsenal are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) unleashes a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain, but he hits a shot just over the crossbar.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) tries his luck with a shot from the edge of the box, but the ball crashes against the crossbar! It would have been a superb goal.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to James Tomkins (West Ham), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late. Arsenal earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.

Perfectly taken free kick! Dimitri Payet sends the ball in, Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) manages to jump highest near the penalty spot and plants a cracking header into the middle of the net. It's 0:1.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Adrian leaps like a salmon to deny him.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Mauro Zarate (West Ham) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power into the bottom left corner.
Substitution. Theo Walcott (Arsenal) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Francis Coquelin walks off.
Substitution. Mauro Zarate makes way for Matthew Jarvis (West Ham).
Substitution. Mathieu Debuchy is replaced by Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal).
The referee shows the yellow card to Nacho Monreal (Arsenal).
Slaven Bilic has decided to substitute Reece Oxford and he is replaced by Kevin Nolan (West Ham).
Theo Walcott (Arsenal) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Modibo Maiga (West Ham) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Diafra Sakho.
Adrian pulls off a great save to deny Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Martin Atkinson is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) takes a first-time shot from the edge of the box, but his effort is well blocked by the defender.
Cedric Soares (Southampton) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee. Newcastle earn a free kick.
collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.

It's in the back of the net!  sends a superb cross into the box. Graziano Pelle (Southampton) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header low inside the left post, leaving Tim Krul beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd) was in the right place to put the ball into the back of the net with his body. It's 0:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Erwin Koeman decided to make a change.  is replaced by Cuco Martina (Southampton).

Maya Yoshida (Southampton) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up low in the middle of the goal, but Tim Krul pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.

Goal – 2:1! Gabriel Obertan sends a precise lofted pass into the box, Georginio Wijnaldum (Newcastle Utd) rises above the defenders to meet the ball near the penalty spot and heads it straight into the left side of the goal.
Jack Colback (Newcastle Utd) commits a nasty foul by bringing down his opponent.

The foul by Jose Fonte (Southampton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Craig Pawson. Newcastle are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this. Newcastle win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Substitution. Shane Long (Southampton) has come on for Jay Rodriguez.
Vurnon Anita is being substituted because of an injury. Steve McClaren sends Cheik Tiote (Newcastle Utd) on the pitch.
That's the end of the game for Papiss Cisse, who is replaced by Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd).
Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) is lucky to receive a yellow card from the referee because he could easily have been given a red card for his foul.
Dusan Tadic showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Shane Long (Southampton) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 2:2.
The game has come to an end for Georginio Wijnaldum. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Siem De Jong (Newcastle Utd).
Today's referee Craig Pawson rightly decides to book Steven Davis (Southampton) for his harsh tackle.
Graziano Pelle (Southampton) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Craig Pawson ignores the protests.
Sadio Mane (Southampton) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.
Today's referee Michael Oliver rightly decides to book Jonjo Shelvey (Swansea) for his harsh tackle.
Oscar (Chelsea) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up inside the right post.
Asmir Begovic makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the bottom left corner by Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea).
Andre Ayew (Swansea) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Goal! Andre Ayew (Swansea) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 1:1.
Goal! Federico Fernandez (Swansea) sent the ball towards his own goal in an attempt to intercept a pass.
Problems for Garry Monk as Sung-Yong Ki is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Jack Cork (Swansea) replaces him.
Jack Cork (Swansea) sees a yellow card from Michael Oliver after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Thibaut Courtois (Chelsea) trips an opposition player and Michael Oliver signals a foul. That is a penalty kick for Swansea.
Thibaut Courtois (Chelsea) knows that the game is over for him after receiving a red card from the referee for fouling his opponent!
The expression of the referee Michael Oliver is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. John Terry (Chelsea) is shown a yellow card.
The manager is forced to make a substitution due to a red card. Jose Mourinho issues instructions to Asmir Begovic (Chelsea), who will replace  Oscar.
Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the right side of the goal.

Asmir Begovic pulls off a great save to deny Jefferson Montero (Swansea) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the top left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! The linesman makes the right call and Swansea will have a corner.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jefferson Montero leaves the pitch and Wayne Routledge (Swansea) comes on.

Nice individual effort by Eden Hazard (Chelsea). He gets all the way to the goalkeeper, produces a strike towards the right side of the target, but Lukasz Fabianski does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out with a save.
It will be a substitution. Kurt Zouma (Chelsea) is ready to enter the pitch as Cesc Fabregas walks off.
Here is a change. Bafetimbi Gomis is going off and Garry Monk gives the last tactical orders to Eder (Swansea).
Here comes a substitution. Falcao (Chelsea) is brought on as a substitute for Willian.
The foul by Ashley Williams (Swansea) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Oliver.
That's it for today, Michael Oliver has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Joshua King (Bournemouth).
Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
Today's referee Mark Clattenburg rightly decides to book Steve Cook (Bournemouth) for his harsh tackle.
A yellow card for a tackle by Ciaran Clark (Aston Villa). Mark Clattenburg doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) connects with the ball in the six-yard box after the resulting free kick and shoots towards goal, but Brad Guzan makes a magnificent save!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

It's unbelievable, Idrissa Gueye (Aston Villa) blows a huge opportunity! He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific daisy-cutter from point blank range. His first-time effort is directed towards the middle of the target, but Artur Boruc reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
Eddie Howe has decided to make a change. Yann Kermorgant (Bournemouth) replaces Joshua King.
Tim Sherwood prepares a substitution. Jordan Ayew is replaced by Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa).
Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the left post.
Substitution. Marc Pugh will be replaced by Max Gradel (Bournemouth).
Tim Sherwood has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Carlos Sanchez (Aston Villa) replacing Jordan Veretout.

Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the right side of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 0:1.
Mark Clattenburg has issued a yellow card to Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa).
Idrissa Gueye (Aston Villa) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Scott Sinclair walks off the pitch to be replaced by Kieran Richardson (Aston Villa).
Booking. Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) receives a caution from the referee.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dan Gosling departs the field of play to be replaced by Eunan O'Kane (Bournemouth).
Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) picks up a yellow card.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Miguel Layun (Watford) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and powers the ball inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper completely helpless.

Gareth Barry (Everton) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting corner and steers his header into the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper pulls off an astonishing save to deny him. Everton force their opponents to concede a corner.

Ross Barkley (Everton) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it under the roof. Unfortunately for him, Heurelho Gomes makes a great save to stop his effort. The referee signals a corner kick to Everton.
Troy Deeney (Watford) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Kevin Mirallas (Everton) gets into a good scoring position. He creates some space for himself and tries his luck from distance. His decent effort towards the underside of the crossbar is, however, superbly saved by Heurelho Gomes! The ball goes out for a corner. Everton can continue in their attacking effort.
Ross Barkley swings the cross over. Romelu Lukaku (Everton) gets his head to it but it goes just wide of the left post.
Seamus Coleman (Everton) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Mike Jones had an easy-decision to make.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Juan Carlos Paredes (Watford) comes onto the pitch for Miguel Layun.
Roberto Martinez has decided to make a change. Arouna Kone (Everton) replaces Brendan Galloway.
Jose Holebas (Watford) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Substitution. Odion Ighalo (Watford) has come on for Jose Manuel Jurado.
Nice piece of skill by Ross Barkley (Everton). He perfectly collected a pass from Arouna Kone, then unleashed a fantastic long-range strike which went into the top right corner. The score is 1:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kevin Mirallas leaves the pitch and Bryan Oviedo (Everton) comes on.
Here is a change. Valon Behrami is going off and Quique Flores gives the last tactical orders to Ben Watson (Watford).

Goal! Odion Ighalo (Watford) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box inside the right post. Tim Howard had no chance of reaching it. The score is 1:2.
Goal! Romelu Lukaku plays a pass to the feet of Arouna Kone (Everton), and he shoots into the bottom left corner from inside the box. It's 2:2.
The manager makes a subsitution with Steven Naismith (Everton) coming on for Romelu Lukaku.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The ball from the free kick finds its way to Jamie Vardy (Leicester) who finds himself some space and scores with a thunderous header inside the right post. An incredible long-range header!
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Jack Rodwell (Sunderland) for a tough tackle.

Marc Albrighton shows his great technique and produces a beautiful cross into the box. Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) gets on the scoresheet by heading the ball precisely inside the right post. It's now 2:0.

Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) trips an opponent with a slide tackle. Lee Mason stops the game and he could give him a card, but eventually decides on just a warning. PENALTY to Leicester! Let's see who will take responsibility.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) is going to take the penalty!
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the right side of the goal.

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Costel Pantilimon makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the right side of the goal.
Dick Advocaat has decided to make a change. Steven Fletcher (Sunderland) replaces Lee Cattermole.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Billy Jones (Sunderland) was quite harsh and Lee Mason didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Lee Mason starts the second half.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) has tested the patience of referee Lee Mason and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
That will be all from Billy Jones who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Adam Matthews (Sunderland).
Off the post! Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range bounced off the left post.

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Jamie Vardy (Leicester) inside the box and he manages to steer it to the left side of the target. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Costel Pantilimon makes a save in the nick of time and maintains the current score. Leicester earn a corner.

Jack Rodwell is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot into the bottom left corner to make the score 3:1.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Marc Albrighton (Leicester) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner of the net.
It's in the back of the net! Jeremain Lens puts the ball on a plate for Steven Fletcher (Sunderland), who has an easy finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 4:2.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Younes Kaboul (Sunderland).
Substitution. Yohan Benalouane (Leicester) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Ritchie De Laet walks off.
Claudio Ranieri prepares a substitution. Riyad Mahrez is replaced by Christian Fuchs (Leicester).
Substitution. Jamie Vardy makes way for N'Golo Kante (Leicester).
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Sebastian Coates (Sunderland), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Jeffery Schlupp (Leicester) is booked.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Tempers flare after Alexander Tettey (Norwich) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.
Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at John Ruddy.
Goal! Jason Puncheon puts a cross into the box and finds Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the left post. He makes it 0:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Simon Hooper has ended it.
The second half has just started.
GOAL - 0:2! The corner comes over and Pape Souare flicks on with his head to Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace), who makes no mistake and fires the ball into the back of the net.

Lewis Grabban (Norwich) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Alex McCarthy guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Bradley Johnson (Norwich) is in the right place at the right time to meet a rebound and attempts a header low towards the middle of the goal. Alex McCarthy is alert and denies him with a quick save.
Substitution. Lewis Grabban is replaced by Cameron Jerome (Norwich).
Alex Neil has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nathan Redmond (Norwich) replacing Alexander Tettey.
Nathan Redmond (Norwich) receives a brilliant pass and fires a powerful long-range daisy-cutter into the bottom left corner. It couldn't have gone in a better place.
Substitution. Yannick Bolasie (Crystal Palace) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Wilfried Zaha walks off.
Here is a change. Jordon Mutch is going off and Alan Pardew gives the last tactical orders to Mile Jedinak (Crystal Palace).
Goal disallowed! Cameron Jerome (Norwich) scores but Simon Hooper blows his whistle for a foul.
Alex Neil has decided to make a change. Gary Hooper (Norwich) replaces Graham Dorrans.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Glenn Murray (Crystal Palace) walks off the pitch to be replaced by Connor Wickham.
Goal! James McArthur provides Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom right corner. 1:3.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) has a big opportunity! He finds some space for a shot inside the penalty box after collecting a lofted pass and sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar.
Own goal! Kyle Walker (Tottenham) suffers a good deal of misfortune as he accidentally puts a pass from one of the attacking players into his own net. The score is 1:0.
Jan Vertonghen (Tottenham) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Jonathan Moss had an easy-decision to make.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to make a change. Ryan Mason (Tottenham) replaces Nabil Bentaleb.
Substitution. Michael Carrick will be replaced by Bastian Schweinsteiger (Manchester United).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Memphis Depay as he is replaced by Ander Herrera (Manchester United).
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to substitute Mousa Dembele and he is replaced by Erik Lamela (Tottenham).
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to Bastian Schweinsteiger (Manchester United), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The foul by Eric Dier (Tottenham) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jonathan Moss. Another situation results in a direct free kick for Manchester Utd.
Here comes a substitution. Eric Dier is given a rest as he is replaced by Dele Alli (Tottenham).
Substitution. Matteo Darmian makes way for Antonio Valencia (Manchester United).

Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous low effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Sergio Romero, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
That's all for today as the game is over.
